Packages.PackageDesc: 3-Day Banjaran Hot Springs Retreat from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Escape from it all with an indulgent 3-day break at the award-winning Banjaran Hotsprings Retreat, including round-trip transport from Kuala Lumpur. Enjoy luxury accommodation in a water villa with your own butler, private pool and hot tub; relax with daily yoga classes; or soak up the idyllic surroundings with a stroll around the rainforest and waterfalls. Alternatively, choose from an array of spa treatments and therapies (extra cost) including reflexology, a fitness center, thermal baths, and steam and meditation caves.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-day Banjaran Hotsprings Retreat in Ipoh.
Relax and rejuvenate in the tranquil surroundings of a blissful retreat nestled amid caves, waterfalls and rainforest.
Luxuriate in the seclusion of your water villa, complete with private pool, outdoor rain shower and thermal spring-fed hot tub.
Indulge in therapeutic treatments such as the Geo Thermal Steam Cave or Garra Rufa Doctor Fish Pool (own expense).
Enjoy complimentary butler service, daily yoga and aromatherapy body care products.
Choose twin- or triple-share accommodations including breakfast.
Round-trip transport by private car from Kuala Lumpur hotels or airport included.

PackageDetails.why: A winner of the TripAdvisor 2014 Travelers’ Choice Award, Banjaran Hotsprings Retreat offers the perfect hideaway to rejuvenate with daily yoga sessions, among other activities and spa treatments to get your bliss on.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Nestled in a 17-acre (6-hectare) valley amid lush tropical jungle and embraced by magnificent limestone cliffs on every side, the Banjaran Hotsprings Retreat in Tambun provides luxury in perfect harmony with its natural surroundings. Designed for short-term stays with a primary focus on healthy living, the sanctuary — a 2-hour drive from Kuala Lumpur — is geared toward fitness, healthy eating, relaxation and renewal.

Enjoy 2 nights’ accommodations in a water villa includes breakfast. Each 1,667-square-foot (508-sq-meter) villa overlooks a canal that you can enjoy views of from your private balcony. You also get your own private pool, a private outdoor rain shower, and a sunken hot tub fed by natural geothermal hot springs.

Relax in the master suite’s luxurious king-size bed with a feather-bed topped mattress, down duvet, cotton-rich linens and hypoallergenic pillows. Other amenities include: aromatherapy body care products, butler service, nightly turndown service, a movie and music library, and daily yoga, among other additional retreat activities. (See Itinerary for complete description of facilities.)
Please note: A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Day 1: Kuala Lumpur – Ipoh A private vehicle picks you up from your Kuala Lumpur hotel or Kuala Lumpur International Airport. Relax as you’re driven north to Sunway City in Tambun, where the only natural hot springs resort in West Malaysia is located. You’ll journey along the scenic highway for about two hours, covering a distance of 125 miles (200 km) until you reach your destination, which is 15 minutes from the city of Ipoh. Upon check-in, you can abandon all worldly concerns and stresses. Rest on your comfortable king-size bed; open a book in the ensuite seating area; or refresh in your private pool, outdoor rain shower, or the sunken hot tub fed by natural geothermal hot springs. During the day, you might explore on a half-hour jungle walk through the deep limestone hills. Lunch and dinner can be purchased at the resort's on-site restaurant (own expense). Overnight: Banjaran Hotsprings Retreat in Ipoh.

Day 2: Ipoh (B) Spend an entire day free to enjoy your Water Villa as you please, or make use of an array of therapeutic facilities. If you’d like, dip into the Geo Thermal Pool, Geo Thermal Steam Cave, Ice Bath, Meditation Cave, Crystal Cave, Therapeutic Reflexology Pool, Garra Rufa Doctor Fish Pool or Freeform Swimming Pool, or head to the Spa and Wellness Center to select from a variety of holistic treatments (see descriptions below). Overnight: Banjaran Hotsprings Retreat in Ipoh.

Day 3: Ipoh – Kuala Lumpur (B) After two nights of relaxation and rejuvenation, check out at noon and make the return journey to Kuala Lumpur by private car, with drop-off at the airport or your hotel. (Departure time is flexible, depending on the time of your flight.) Wellness facilities at additional cost include:

Hotspots.SpotName: Geo Thermal Hot Springs Dipping Pools
Hotspots.SpotDesc: Relieve stressed muscles and tired joints. Enjoy a relaxing soak in the natural Jacuzzi-style dipping pools containing fresh hot water from the 800,000 gallons (3 million liters) that billow up daily from the ground below.

Seek solace in this cave with a platform overlooking a body of crystal-clear geothermal hot springs water. Indulge in its natural sauna for a restorative therapy to soothe, relax and detoxify. Ice Bath Elevate your state of health by plunging into the freezing ice bath, which helps improve blood circulation, reduce blood pressure and strengthen the parasympathetic and sympathetic nervous systems.

With calming temperatures and the absence of external sounds and interruptions, focus your mind in silence for complete relaxation and contemplation in the natural granite and limestone Meditation Cave.

Restore and balance your natural life force energy in a crystal cave with amethyst and quartz crystals that facilitate metaphysical healing. This cave is perfect for a session of Reiki. Garra Rufa Doctor Fish Pool Dip your legs and feel the tingling yet relaxing sensation of exotic Garra Rufa fish. This therapy is a natural form of exfoliation and relaxation, eliminating dead skin cells and rejuvenating the skin.

Created over the natural hot springs bed, the outdoor mineral-rich geothermal-heated swimming pool invites you to simply relax in its healing waters, or swim up to the pool bar to sip on refreshing beverages.
Enjoy a satisfying workout in the modern and spacious fitness center, which accommodates the latest movements with a full range of quality fitness and training machines amid a relaxed atmosphere.

Restore life and soul into your exhausted self with a choice of more than 40 Asian holistic treatments and therapies offered for the full relaxation of the body and rejuvenation of the mind (own expense).

inclusion.item: 2 nights' accommodation at Banjaran Hotsprings Retreats.
Meals as per itinerary (B=breakfast, L=lunch, D=dinner).
Hotel pickup and drop-off or KLIA.

exclusion.item: Access to Geo Thermal Hot Dipping Pool, Geo Thermal Steam Cave, Crystal Cave, Meditation Cave, Ice Bath, Therapeutic Reflexology Pool, Garra Rufa Doctor Fish Pool, Fitness Center available for extra fee.

Packages.PackageDesc: 3-Day Pangkor Island Trip from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Take a trip to a tropical paradise during this relaxing 3-day excursion to Pangkor Island from Kuala Lumpur. Leave the city behind as you weave your way through the lush Malaysian countryside to catch your ferry. Then chill out on beautiful Pangkor Island, sunning you on the postcard-perfect white sand beaches, or enjoying a jetski ride or snorkeling. This Pangkor Island experience also includes round-trip transport from your hotel, ferry to the island, two nights’ accommodations and meals as per the itinerary.

highlights.highlightItem: Pangkor island 3-day trip from Kuala Lumpur.
See traditional Malaysian houses and oil palm tree plantations.
Enjoy a scenic ferry ride from Lumut to Pangkor.
Optional activities available, such as catamaran sailing, snorkelling and canoeing.
2 nights’ accommodation in a 4-star hotel.
Kuala Lumpur hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Enjoy the life of a tropical island castaway during this wonderful 3-day excursion to Malaysia's Pangkor Island from Kuala Lumpur. If you're looking for a way to escape the stress and fast-pace of the city for a little rest and relaxation, this is (literally) your ticket to paradise.

Depart on day one from Kuala Lumpur with a pickup at 8am from your hotel, leaving on a 3.5-hour drive through the Malaysian countryside. Along the way you'll pass traditional kampongs (villages) with raised wooden houses, eventually arriving in Lumut to catch a ferry to the island. Reach the island that afternoon and check into the 4-star PangkorLaut Resort, after which you'll have time to explore the island at your leisure or relax on the island's incredible beaches.

Spend day two however you wish, either perfecting your tan or taking part in activities like catamaran sailing, snorkelling, sport fishing and more (at your own expense) and enjoying a second night at your resort. Return to Kuala Lumpur on day three, the feeling of calm and relaxation still radiating through your body. See below for full itinerary details.

inclusion.item: Meals as per itinerary (B=breakfast, L=lunch, D=dinner).

Packages.PackageDesc: Gopeng Rainforest White Water Rafting Adventure

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy a thrilling White Water Rafting and Waterfall Abseiling adventure in the Gopeng Rainforest - the hottest destination for White Water Rafting. Worry not as each raft will have an experienced facilitator traveling with you. Enjoy the cooling water splashing and gushing that hits you and raft when hitting the rapids falls!

highlights.highlightItem: Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Close encounter with wildlife.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Welcome to Kampar River (Sungai Itek), Gopeng, Perak. This is Malaysia’s re-known gateway for rainforest adventure activities! There are 2 standard times to choose from with this tour, a morning tour at 9am, or an afternoon tour at 2pm. You will be picked up from GuaTempurung Parking or the Gopeng Museum. From here, you will be taken to the starting point of your adventure, where you will be welcomed by the crystal clear river water that flows from the Titiwangsa Mountains. You’ll be met by your trainer who will give a briefing on safety so you feel confident in the cool water. You will also be taught how to correctly use the rafting equipment. After the briefing, you’ll be provided with a safety jacket and a safety helmet.

Teamwork is the key word of the day as you will need to work together and follow instructions in order to move forward or backwards. This tour will provide you with a fun, interesting, and adrenaline-pumping experience you are not likely to forget! Be prepared to get wet.

For those who enjoy nature will love the scenic atmosphere surrounding you. Kampar River flows from the highlands in a valley shape to the lower reaches into Perak river mouth in Strait of Malacca. On either side of you, you will see jungles and farmland.

After the thrilling experience is finished, you will be met by the team. You will be given time to change into dry clothing before enjoying lunch. (9am session only. Lunch will be provided prior to Rafting on the 2pm session).

inclusion.item: Return transfer from GuaTempurung to Rafting Point or Waterfall Abseiling Point.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
A moderate level of fitness is required for this activity.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Orangutan Island, Taiping Zoo and Perak Museum from Penang.

PackageDetails.overview: Get an up close look at the endangered orangutan on this incredible private tour of Orangutan Island, Taiping Zoo and Perak Museum from Penang. Experience some of the area’s most stunning natural highlights and learn more about local wildlife from your professional guide. You’ll walk through the Taiping Lake Gardens and wander the halls of Perak Museum, plus enjoy the air-conditioned comfort and convenience of your own private vehicle.

highlights.highlightItem: Day trip to Orangutan Island, Taiping Lake Gardens, Zoo Taiping, and Perak Museum from Penang with a private guide.
See endangered orangutans at the conservation center on Orangutan Island.
Visit the highlights of Taiping, a well-preserved colonial city with a gorgeous mountain backdrop from the Bintang Range.
Stroll through the tranquil Taiping Lake Gardens and learn how it was once a mining area.
Visit the Taiping zoo and see a variety of exotic animals Check out the extensive and unusual natural history collections at the Perak Museum, Malaysia’s oldest museum.
Learn from your private guide about Malaysia’s wildlife and the challenges of conservation.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your private tour of Orangutan Island, Taiping Zoo and Perak Museum from Penang kicks off with hotel pick up by your friendly and professional guide. Travel by ferry to the mainland, where you’ll meet your driver and make your way two hours south to Bukit Merah in the comfort of your own private vehicle. Upon arrival, you’ll follow your guide on a 10-minute boat ride across calm waters to the stunning Orangutan Island. This quiet sanctuary is home to these endangered animals, as well as a staff of individuals charged with protecting and preserving them.
Wander the paths with your friendly guide and learn about the efforts to protect their habitat as you keep your eyes peeled for roaming orangutans and maybe even some of their playful babies!

Leave the island head to Taiping, where you’ll visit a well-preserved colonial town and enjoy lunch (own expense) before exploring Taiping Lake Gardens. Once a destination for mining companies, this 160-acred (64-hectare) park has been transformed into a natural escape where you’ll have a chance to see angsana tress and relax in the quiet beauty of the park.

From there, follow your guide to the Taiping Zoo. Check out elephants, monkeys and dozens of other animals before making your way to Perak Museum. Your guide will walk you through the Art Deco building, built in 1883, and share stories about the history of the nation, as well as this historic building on your tour.
Finally return to your Penang hotel via the Penang Bridge—the third longest bridge on earth. Enjoy epic views and snap some memorable photos before your journey ends.
Please note: In case the Bukit Merah Laketown Orangutan Island is not open, you'll visit the Kuala Sepetang mangrove forest and see a charcoal kiln where charcoal is produced.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
A moderate amount of walking is involved; comfortable walking shoes and insect repellent are recommended.
2 passenger minimum per booking required.
In case the Bukit Merah Laketown Orangutan Island is not operating, we will replace with a visit to Kuala Sepetang mangrove forest and a charcoal kiln where charcoals are produced.

Packages.PackageDesc: Batu Caves and Bukit Melawati Day Tour

PackageDetails.overview: This full day tour takes you outside of Kuala Lumpur city and gives you the opportunity to see what the surrounding areas have to offer. Start with a trip to the iconic Batu Caves, then make your way to an Elephant Conservation Center, finally take a relaxed drive through the countryside to Bukit Melawati to meet the silver-leaf monkeys, have dinner and see the amazing spectacle of the fireflies in the mangroves on a boat trip.

highlights.highlightItem: Small group ensures personal service.
Close encounter with wildlife.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Family friendly.
Lunch included.
Dinner included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Nestled in a 17-acre (6-hectare) valley amid lush tropical jungle and embraced by magnificent limestone cliffs on every side, the Banjaran Hotsprings Retreat in Tambun provides luxury in perfect harmony with its natural surroundings. Designed for short-term stays with a primary focus on healthy living, the sanctuary — a 2-hour drive from Kuala Lumpur — is geared toward fitness, healthy eating, relaxation and renewal.

Enjoy 2 nights’ accommodations in a water villa includes breakfast. Each 1,667-square-foot (508-sq-meter) villa overlooks a canal that you can enjoy views of from your private balcony. You also get your own private pool, a private outdoor rain shower, and a sunken hot tub fed by natural geothermal hot springs.

Relax in the master suite’s luxurious king-size bed with a feather-bed topped mattress, down duvet, cotton-rich linens and hypoallergenic pillows. Other amenities include: aromatherapy body care products, butler service, nightly turndown service, a movie and music library, and daily yoga, among other additional retreat activities. (See Itinerary for complete description of facilities.)
Please note: A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: 9am - depart for Batu Caves, a limestone outcrop and 272 steps climb takes to the temple of Hindu deity Lord Subramaniam who is honored during the Hindu festival of Thaipusam in January or February every year. The statue of the Hindu deity stands at 140 feet and was built at a cost of 2.5 million ringgit. The 140 meters statue of Hindu deity Lord Subramaniam is mesmerizing.
1pm - Lunch at the elephant conservation center is followed by a video show on catching and the re-location of rogue elephants.
2pm - A briefing on elephants and introduction. Feeding and feeling of the gentle giants. Bathing of the elephants is subject to river conditions. Bring extra changing clothes just in case.
4pm - A relaxed drive through the countryside to Bukit Melawati in Kuala Selangor.

6pm - On arrival, monkey feeding and interaction. These friendly silvered leaf monkeys live in clusters of 6 - 10 and their infants are orange in color and after 3 months turn silver. They live on young leaves, wild shoots and fruits. This is a unique brush with nature and a take-home experience.
7pm - Seafood dinner at a riverside cafe.

8pm - Take an enjoyable boat ride to watch fireflies fizzing along the mangroves. The fireflies congregate on mangrove trees like dazzling lights on a Christmas tree. They flash synchronously through a biochemical reaction in organs on their bottoms.
9pm - Return transfer to Kuala Lumpur, arriving approximately at 10pm at your hotel.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Dress code: formal.
A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.

Packages.PackageDesc: Batu Caves and Malaysian Crafts Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Escape the urban landscapes and leave the streets of Malaysia’s capital city behind on this Batu Caves and Malaysian Crafts Tour from Kuala Lumpur. Visit one of the nation’s most beloved shrines, located in the Batu Caves, and see how two of the country’s traditional crafts are made during stops at the Royal Selangor Pewter factory and a batik centre. Choose from a morning or afternoon tour and enjoy round-trip transportation.

highlights.highlightItem: Morning or afternoon tour to Batu Caves.
Take a scenic drive through the countryside outside Kuala Lumpur.
Tour the famous Royal Selangor Pewter factory.
See how batik fabric is designed and printed.
Visit the ancient Hindu shrine at Batu Caves.
Choice of morning and afternoon tours.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet your friendly and professional guide at your Kuala Lumpur hotel and leave the city streets behind as you embark on this Batu Caves and Malaysian Crafts Tour. You’ll pass the famed ‘Ambassador Row’ as you depart the city and make your way to the picturesque countryside.

Pay a visit to the Royal Selangor Pewter Factory, where you’ll see how local artisans fashion handmade pieces using age-old techniques. Learn about casting, filing, polishing and hammering techniques used to produce beautiful works as you tour the factory.

From there, make your way to a local batik factory, where expert artisans create stunning masterpieces using fabric, wax and colorful dyes. Learn how this age-old art is produced and watch locals at work using this traditional art form.

After learning about the arts and crafts of Malaysia, head to the limestone hills of Batu Caves. Climb the 272 steps that lead to one of the country’s most incredible religious structures. Visit the temple museum, housed inside the cave, and listen in as your guide shares information and insight about the deities that are represented in the temple murals.
Your tour ends with hotel drop off in Kuala Lumpur, after a day filled with Malaysian history, culture and traditions.

inclusion.item: Entry to sites (all are free of charge)

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Please note that hotel pickup and drop-off service operates only for hotels within the Kuala Lumpur central city limits. If you are staying at the following hotels, please either make your own way to a hotel in central Kuala Lumpur or contact the local tour operator after booking to arrange pickup service for an additional fee (contact info will be provided on your confirmation voucher).

Greater Kuala Lumpur: Le Meridien, Hilton, Cititel, Boulevard MidValley, Pearl International, Eastin Hotel Petaling Jaya, Crystal Crown, Armada, Holiday Villa Subang, Grand Dorset Subang, Petaling Jaya Hilton, Sunway Lagoon, One World Damansara.
Sri Kembangan: Palace of the Golden Horses.
Shah Alam: Holiday Inn Glenmarie, The Saujana, all hotels within the Shah Alam area.
Putrajaya & KLIA: Putrajaya Shangrila, Putrajaya Marriott, Cyberview Lodge, Equatorial Bangi, Pan Pacific KLIA, Concorde Inn KLIA.
A moderate amount of walking is involved; comfortable walking shoes and a hat are recommended.

Packages.PackageDesc: Batu Caves and Temple Tourfrom Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Explore the culture and traditions of Malaysia on this three-hour Batu Caves and Temple tour from Kuala Lumpur. Spend the afternoon visiting these famed natural caverns with your expert local guide and wander the impressive grounds of the Batu Cave Hindu Temple, where you’ll gain insight and understanding of the religious roots of this incredible and diverse nation. Drive through Little India, learn about the art of batik and pewter smithing and enjoy round-trip transportation and hotel pick up and drop off.

highlights.highlightItem: Afternoon exploration of Batu Caves from Kuala Lumpur, led by a professional guide.
Drive along Little India (Brickfields) and admire the colorful community of local shops and quaint restaurants.
Be greeted by comical monkeys at the Batu Caves Hindu temple.
Climb the 272 steps that lead you into the spectacular caverns See the art of Batik silk designing and learn about pewter arts at the Royal Selangor Visitor Center.
Hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your cultural tour of Malaysia kicks off with hotel pick up. Meet your friendly local guide and professional driver in Kuala Lumpur and begin this memorable three-hour Batu Caves and Temple Tour. You’ll drive through Little India, a neighbourhood in Brickfields known for its colourful streets, flavourful cuisine and unique shops.

The 30-minute scenic drive ends at the Batu Caves. These natural limestone masses are home to Hindu shrines that house various religious deities. Learn from your guide about the deep Hindu roots of this nation as you make your way up the 272 steps to the golden Lord Murugan.
Once you arrive at the top, you’ll head to Cathedral Cave—the largest in the complex. Your guide will offer background on the significance of this space, which houses intricate Hindu shrines.

On your way back to Kuala Lumpur, stop at an area batik centre and learn about this traditional art is made. You’ll also visit the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre to learn about the ancient art of pewter smiting before returning to your hotel.

Packages.PackageDesc: Crab Island Day Trip from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Come to Crab Island! The Island is a prospering fishing village with a bustling harbour that is frequented by scores of floating vehicles ranging from wobbly sampan (small row-boats) to ‘clonking’ fishing boats. Your day will begin with a hotel pick up and you will be taken to Port Klang where you will enjoy a 30 minute ferry ride to Crab Island that offers a panoramic view of the busy harbour. Although Crab Island doesn’t offer vast a territory to explore, it is an interesting village compact with recreation sports, rich culture, delicious seafood and a community of gentle, welcoming locals. Note: Not available on Chinese New Year Festival.

highlights.highlightItem: Full-day trip to car-free Crab Island.
Experience a local fishing village.
Enjoy the slow pace of life on a traditional island.
Have lunch at a neighbourhood restaurant.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will begin with a hotel pick up where you will be taken from Kuala Lumpur to Port Klang. The journey takes approximately 1 hour. From Port Klang you will embark on a short 30 minute ferry ride to Crab Island. The ferry route will take you out of Port Klang's busy South port from where you could catch a glimpse of the Glenn Ports and Cruise Terminal on nearby Pulau Indah. The ferry will then take a short cut through the rivers which dissect the swampy Mangrove Island of Pulau Klang. Within no time you will find yourself at Crab Island (Pulau Ketam).

On arrival, you will take a leisurely stroll to see an entire village where even the roads are built on stilts. You will be able to soak in the atmosphere before heading off to eat lunch at a local restaurant.

After lunch you will be given the opportunity to explore the village. It is possible for you to rent bicycles to ride around the village but inexperienced cyclists should be careful on the narrow paths.
After your exploration is complete you will return on the ferry. Before returning to the hotel you will be taken on a drive up to see the fabulous palace of the Selangor Sultan.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Minimum 2 people per booking is required.
Infants free of charge, no seat.

Packages.PackageDesc: Day Trip Sunway Lagoon Theme Park with Round-Trip Transfer and Lunch

PackageDetails.overview: Let’s come and enjoy at Sunway Lagoon Theme Park, place for non-stop fun and entertainment. Have a relaxing and comfortable return transfer from Kuala Lumpur City Center hotels to Sunway Lagoon Theme Park. Sunway Lagoon Theme Park is absolutely a best attraction for family and friends. Relish your holiday tour with smiles and laughter.

highlights.highlightItem: Admission, lunch and transfer to Sunway Lagoon theme park from KL.
Enjoy the park at your own pace.
Have lunch at the park Spend your day hassle-free.
Popular choice with kids.
All taxes, fuel surcharges and service fees included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: You'll get two ways transfer to Sunway Lagoon Theme Park from Kuala Lumpur City Center hotels on private basic (PVT). These transfers are between Kuala Lumpur City Center hotels to Sunway Lagoon Theme Park by van (Toyota Hiace or Hyundai Starex). The pickup and drop of services session will be between 9am -7pm daily and the journey duration will be approximately 45 minutes.

Upon your arrival, please collect your entrance ticket at the counter with the assist of your friendly driver cum guide and enjoy your splendid moment in Water Park, Amusement Park, Wildlife Park, Extreme Park and Scream Park. You'll get complimentary food voucher as well.

In Sunway Lagoon Explore world’s largest man-made surf beach with the area over 13,000 sf. It will boost your excitement while catching the perfect wave each time! It is also home to the world’s largest water ride, Vuvuzela, and to First Waterplexx 5D, Malaysia’s first FlowRider, and many other great attractions.

Hop on board Pirate’s Revenge, Malaysia’s first 360-degree Rotating Pirate Ship. Scream your way along the ride on the Lost City of Gold Scream Coaster. Captian kids Playland and Captian Kid’s Candyland are themed playgrounds that are designed especially for kids. Kids will have tons of fun at these 2 newly designed attractions. Challenge yourself at adrenaline-pumping fun at Extreme Park. . Hit the bullseye at the Archery Target Shooting Range, go off-road on an all-terrain vehicle (ATV), or satisfy your need for speed on a go-kart.

Helicopters are waiting to rescue you but to reach them you have to make your way through an industrial complex swarming with zombies. World War Z! Live is just one of the highlights of the Scream Park that features no less than 3 floors of fear!

Ground zero is turned into World War Z! Live. This is the latest addition to Lynton V. Harris’s Scream Park, based on the blockbuster movie starring Brad Pitt. The walk-through scare attraction places you firmly in the middle of the war against zombies. Once you have complete enjoy your excursion, get ready to return back to your hotel with comfortable air-conditioned private vehicle.

inclusion.item: Admission and entrance tickets except for Water Park 2- Amusement, park 3- Wildlife Park, 4- Extreme Park, 5- Scream Park English speaking guide/driver, Hotel pickup and drop-off (Private basis).

exclusion.item: There is additional fees for the following rides in Go Cart, Bungy Jump and G-Force X.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Children must be accompanied by an adult.
Please carry along your own towel and swimwear Please note pick up and drop-off hotels within Kuala Lumpur city centre only.

Packages.PackageDesc: Fireflies and Kuala Selangor Tour Including Dinner

PackageDetails.overview: You will start your tour with a visit to the remains of a fort on Bukit Melawati before heading to the protected Taman Alam mangrove swamp. This is an ideal spot for bird-watching and witnessing other animals from the area. You will then enjoy a a delicious seafood dinner, before taking a boat ride down the Kuala Selangor River to watch fireflies twinkling among the mangroves that line the banks of the river.

highlights.highlightItem: 8-hour tour of Kuala Selangor from Kuala Lumpur.
Visit a colonial-era fort.
Enjoy a seafood dinner.
Explore the mangroves in a traditional boat.
See thousands of fireflies.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Upon arrival at Kuala Selangor, you will visit Kota Melawat,i formerly known as Fort Altinsburg, the execution block, royal mausoleum, and colonial buildings. You will also visit a bird sanctuary park at the foot of Bukit Melawati. It is an ideal place to watch migratory birds.

After a local fish dinner, you will proceed to Kampung Kuantan - the highlight of the tour. You will travel upstream in a small un-motorized boat (tongkang) in the quiet darkness to witness the blinking trees. This scintillating display of fireflies brings to mind images of flashing Christmas trees. The synchronized rhythmic flashing is produced by the thousands of fireflies found in the mangrove swamp of Kampung Kuantan. Your skilled local oarsmen will make this an unforgettable experience.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Infants free of charge, provided they don't occupy a seat.
A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.
Note: Not available on Chinese New Year Festival.

Packages.PackageDesc: Full-Day Mah Meri Cultural Village Tour with Coconut Wine and Home Cooked Lunch

PackageDetails.overview: Old Malaysia is at its best when you are up close to nature and enjoying the slower pace of life. This full day tour starts in Kuala Lumpur and takes you to the old tribal area of Carey Island, Immersed in culture and tradition this trip and will give you a real insight into old Malaysia. Lunch is also included. The Mah Meri  are an indigenous tribe subgroup of Senoi aborigines, who were sea gypsies, around 2,000 remaining. They are soft spoken, depend on fishing and agriculture and excel in woodcarvings depicting rich mythological meanings with spiritual connections. Their ancestors come in their dreams to tell them what to carve. Mah Meri is listed in UNESCO.

highlights.highlightItem: Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Step back in time on a history tour.
Fully narrated tour.
All entrance fees included.
Lunch included.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This tour showcases the older tribal areas of the Mah Meri aborigines. A Mah Meri Guide will take us on a comprehensive tour of the village. The tapping of Coconut wine was a practice that was copied from India and other parts of the world. The drink which has an alcohol content of 4% was popular with the Indian laborers in Malaysia as it was quite affordable to them. The tapping of this wine is slowly being faced out due to its alcoholic content and is now a health drink.

The tour will starts after a breakfast around 8am, and depart for the countryside. We will arrival at the Mah Meri Village approximately 2-hour drive. Mah Meri guide will take us on a tour of the village explaining their culture and traditions. After visiting the Rumah Moyang (Ancestral Home) we move on for a demonstration of wood carving and origami by the folks. A simple souvenir awaits you with their soft spoken and awesome hospitality.

Around 12pm, visit a coconut plantation to watch coconut tree climbers moving from tree to tree on mere ropes to harvest a unique drink - the coconut wine (Toddy). Toddy is a health drink that cleanses the urethral and liver systems. Fresh toddy is served.
Next, we will visit a typical Malay home for a herbal garden tour of traditional plants for blood pressure, cancer, diabetes and other ailments. A delicious home cooked meal will be served.

After lunch, we will drive past scenic villages and houses on stilts with photo stops along the way. Then it’s time for Toddy party, fresh toddy with a touch of exotic snacks as in wild boar, chicken, mutton before departing for Kuala Lumpur and arriving approximately 5pm.

Infant seats are available on request if advised at time of booking.

Packages.PackageDesc: Guided Tour of Royal Selangor Visitor Centre including Pewter Crafting Lesson

PackageDetails.overview: Immerse yourself in the rich history of Malaysian pewter crafting on a 30-minute guided tour of the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre in Kuala Lumpur. Follow a professional guide to informative exhibits and discover the complex process behind pewter crafting. After learning about the craft, try your hand at creating your own pewter dish using traditional tools in the factory workshop. Take your finished product home as a special souvenir and receive a personalized certificate on completing your creation.

highlights.highlightItem: 30-minute guided tour of the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre in Kuala Lumpur.
Learn about the rich colonial history of Malaysian pewter crafting with an expert guide.
Try your hand at making a pewter dish using traditional tools.
Receive a personalized certificate and keep your completed pewter product as a special souvenir.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Royal Selangor Visitor centre visitors are guided through various tin/pewter exhibits in the museum before proceeding to the factory where they can try out a pewter crafting process. The tour includes a brief look at Comyns' historical archive and the Selberan fine jewellery workshop, the two precious metal brands under Royal Selangor. Workshops on crafting take-home pewter souvenirs are available. There are also photo opportunities with the world’s largest pewter tankard.

inclusion.item: Guided tour of the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre, including the factory to see how pewter is made.
School of hard knocks pewter-making workshop.
Hand-made pewter bowl, an apron, and a personalized certificate.
Hotel pickup and drop-off (selected hotels only). Your hotel’s concierge will have details on our shuttle van pick up points and timetable.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Wheelchair accessible.
Minimum age is 3 years for School of Hard Knocks workshop.
Children must be accompanied by an adult.
A maximum of 15 people per booking.

Packages.PackageDesc: Half-Day School of Hard Knocks and Royal Selangor Pewter Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Experience fun and excitement with the chance to make your own pewter  creation. Showcase your artistic talents and de-stress with a hammer while expressing your creativity in pewter smiting workshop at Royal Selangor Pewter. In two separate sessions, you will be guided through the process of creating a pewter dish using traditional tools such as the hammer and wooden mold. You will learn the process of casting, polishing and decorating pewter by an experienced instructor. At the end of the session, you will take home your own finished pewter dish.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day tour and pewter smiting workshop from Kuala Lumpur.
Enjoy a hands-on experience.
Learn the secrets behind Royal Selangor Pewter.
Take home a handmade souvenir.
Family friendly.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: You’ll be picked up from your hotel in Kuala Lumpur and taken to the Royal Selangor Pewter. Upon arrival at the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre, you’ll be met by the house guide for a guided tour. Tour a house with more than a century of history.

Founded in 1885, Royal Selangor is a well-known name in quality pewter, a brand synonymous with design and craftsmanship. In the hands of skilled craftspeople, this versatile alloy of tin, copper and antimony is transformed into an endless variety of home ware and gifts sold in more than twenty countries around the world. The Visitor Centre takes you back over a hundred years to the founding of Royal Selangor and its inextricable link with the history of Malaysia, to the present day as the world’s largest pewter maker and its expansion into gold and sterling silver.

After the house tour, head into the workshop area and get ready for a fun expression of your creativity. Learn a bit more about the importance of the pewter, fine jewellery, and silver industry to Malaysia before sitting down at your work station. Your guide will provide you with all the tools necessary to create your finished product, including a hammer and wooden mild. Learn the secrets of master craftsmen as you run through a 30-minute session to make your own pewter dish.

Thereafter, head to the second workshop station, to learn the process of casting, polishing, and decorating a  pewter accessory. Here, bring out your artistic side to create an intricate, sparkling pewter dish and at the end of your 60-minute lesson, you will feel like an expert in the pewter-making process and leave with a new pewter accessory of your own.
Finish your workshop with a cool souvenir to show off to your friends and family, as well as a personalized certificate of completion (certificate only for School of Hard Knocks).
At the end of the tour you will be taken back to your hotel safely.

inclusion.item: Separate Guided Workshop of School of Hard Knocks (30 minutes) and The Foundry at Royal Selangor Pewter (60 minutes).
Guided house tour of the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre.
Certificate of completion (School of Hard Knocks only).
Hotel pickup and drop-off (selected hotels within city centre).

Packages.PackageDesc: Hot Spring and Templers Park Waterfall Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Kuala Lumpur Hot Springs and Templers Park Waterfall Tour features stunning Malaysian Rainforest and is only a short drive away from Kuala Lumpur. Whilst in our capital city you shouldn't miss this jungle getaway which is right on our doorstep.

highlights.highlightItem: Templar Park and Selayang Hot Spring day trip.
Soak in four hot pools.
Take a refreshing dip under the waterfall.
Enjoy a picnic lunch in the rainforest.
Hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Take a few hours out of the city and enjoy this 5 hour trip to both Kuala Lumpur Hot Springs and Templers Park. This tour was created to get you out of the hustle and bustle and to see the amazing scenery on our doorstep. You can enjoy the therapeutic feeling of visiting the natural hot spring and then we will take you to the natural surroundings of Malaysia's rainforest at Templers Park.

The Templers Park rainforest with a millions of year’s history is a great place to relax and enjoy the flora and fauna around you. You will feel the peace and chorus of the jungle and can enjoy a dip in the waterfall and a picnic lunch by the water.
As we head back into the city you will refreshed and recharged from your out of town experience.

inclusion.item: Entrance Fee to Selayang Hot Springs and Templers Park.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Children must be accompanied by an adult.

Please bring along another set of dry clothes for change and also Towel.
Wear Flat Walking Shoes and bring along insect repellent.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Shore Excursion from Port Klang Cruise Terminal

PackageDetails.overview: Join this full-day tour depart from Port Klang Cruise Terminal (the north or south port) to explore Kuala Lumpur city before you return to your ship. This tour has been carefully concocted for cruise guests and will covers virtually a visit to KL Tower, Batu Caves, Little India, photo shoots at Twin Towers, Malaysia Independent Square and Royal Selangor Clubhouse. A delicious lunch on banana leaves will be served.

highlights.highlightItem: Private Kuala Lumpur shore excursion with a personal guide.
See the city from KL Tower and the Petronas Twin Towers.
Visit the temple at Batu Caves.
See Independence Square (Dataran Merdeka) and the Royal Selangor Clubhouse.
Stroll through Little India and enjoy a local lunch.
Covered by Viator's worry-free policy: guaranteed on time return to your ship.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: At 8-9:30am, you will be meeting and greet at the cruise terminal which located 25miles (40km) from the city of Kuala Lumpur. You will catch a bird’s eye view of the city from KL Tower before we proceed to Batu Caves.

At Batu Caves, you will climb 272 steps into the Temple of Hindu Deity Lord Subramaniam who is honoured during a festival called Thaipusam every year in January/February.  His 140 feet gold painted statue is mesmerizing. Ladies need to be appropriately dressed to enter the temple.
Next would be a visit to the Independent Square where Malaysia got her independence, St Mary's Cathedral and the Royal Selangor Clubhouse where cricket was once popular.

After a short walk in Little India, lunch would be served on banana leaf.  Eating on banana leaves is a custom that dates back thousands of years; however its benefits are still relevant today. After lunch, we will visit the Twin Towers for a free and easy, shopping and photo shoots before departing for the cruise terminal at 3pm.

Worry-free Shore Excursion: We will ensure your timely return to Port Klang for this activity. In the rare event your ship has departed, we will arrange for transportation to the next port-of-call. If your ship is delayed and you are unable to attend this activity, your money will be refunded. See our terms and conditions for full details.

Children must be accompanied by an adult Infant seats are available on request if advised at time of booking.
Refunds will not be issued if tour/activity is missed due to late or non-arrival of cruise ship.
Dress code is smart casual.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Shore Excursion Mah Meri Sea Gypsies Cultural Village with Coconut Wine and Lunch

PackageDetails.overview: Be immersed in the historical traditions of Malaysia during a private shore excursion to a ‘kampong,’ a typical indigenous village. When your ship pulls into the cruise terminal, be chauffeured by your own personal guide who shares insightful commentary. Witness the lifestyle of the Meri Meri people, taste coconut wine, take an herb garden tour and enjoy a typical Malay lunch at a family home. Round-trip transport from Kuala Lumpur’s Port Klang is included.

highlights.highlightItem: Lunch included.
Led by a local guide.
Family friendly.
All entrance fees included.
Snacks and Beverages included.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

images.imageCaption: Mah Meri Sea Gypsies Cultural Village

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: At 8am, you will be meeting and greet at the Cruise Terminal in Port Klang where all cruise ships usually dock. An allowance of 2 hours is given for meet and greet due to dock congestion. Depart to a quaint village and meet the indigenous Senoi tribe of aborigines the Mah Meri who were sea gypsies depending on fish agriculture and now excel in wood carvings depicting rich mythological meanings with spiritual connections. Still remaining 2,000 of them to keep their culture going.The village guide will show us around not forgetting the Rumah Moyang Ancestral Home where food and drinks are offered to the ancestors in return for protection from evil. A simple wood carving and origami waits.
At 11:30am visit a coconut plantation to watch the tapping of coconut wine (toddy), a practice copied from India. It has an alcohol content of 4% and a health drink.

We then proceed to a typical Malay home for an herbal garden tour led by the owner and a delicious home cooked lunch will be served. After lunch, we will drive past scenic houses on stilts with photo shoots along the way. We will stop by at a coconut wine shop for some exotic snacks with a cup of toddy.
Around 4pm, we will depart to cruise terminal.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Selangor Firefly Tour including Seafood Dinner

PackageDetails.overview: Firefly Park Resort Bukit Belimbing in Kuala Selangor,Malaysia. Is the only place in this region where you can witness the sight of millions of fireflies flashing in synchrony, often referred to as the “Eighth Wonder of the World”. It is one of the must visit place of interest (POI) in Malaysia. You will be taken on a boat ride along the Selangor River where the fireflies inhibit around the branches of the “Berembang” trees along the riverbank. Here, up to thousands of fireflies may group together on a tree, beginning their display about one hour after sunset. A really bright display lasts for about two to three hours, continuing at lower levels until dawn.

highlights.highlightItem: 4-hour trip to Kuala Selangor with firefly tour and seafood dinner.
See Malaysia's wildlife in a natural environment.
Explore a scenic river.
Enjoy dinner in a fishing village.
Once in a lifetime experience.
Popular choice with kids.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: You will be picked up from Kuala Lumpur City Centre Hotel and transfer to Kuala Selangor that will take approximately 1.5 hours. Kuala Selangor is a small village that well-known for attraction alongside the Selangor River that flows through the village. Here you can find millions of fireflies.

Upon arrival you'll be visiting to Bukit Melawati where Fort Altingsburg is located. The hilltop is capped by a lighthouse surrounded by tall beautiful shady trees which are a haven for local birds, silvered leaf monkeys and long tail macaques.You’ll head to a nearby fishing village for a typical seafood dinner before making your way to Kampung Kuantan.

Around 6:30pm you'll visit to Malay Village which is Kampung Kuanatan, where they will board a boat. Life jackets are provided and the boatman would row the boat along the river. As mentioned earlier, here millions of fireflies present us with a dazzling display of lights flickering in synchronous that resemble twinkling electric lights on a Christmas tree. Definitely you will be bedazzled and the sight will take your breath away!
Once complete the tour, you'll be depart from Kuala Selangor around 8:30pm and back to Kuala Lumpur with sweet memories in the comfort private vehicle.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Children must be accompanied by an adult.
Not wheelchair accessible.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Selangor Tour from Kuala Lumpur with Fireflies Boat Ride and Seafood Dinner

PackageDetails.overview: Get back to nature with a night away from Kuala Lumpur on a visit to Kuala Selangor. Tour a royal burial ground, an ancient fort and a local fishing village—where you’ll also enjoy a seafood dinner filled with fresh catch—and float through mangroves. Witness the wonder of thousands of glittering fireflies as the sun set and evening falls.

highlights.highlightItem: Kuala Selangor Tour from Kuala Lumpur.
Marvel at the beautiful twinkling lights of the thousands of fireflies at night – a truly magical experience!
Explore a royal burial ground and Kota Melawati, an ancient fort Enjoy a relaxing, scenic evening boat ride through the mangroves of Kuala Selangor.
Dine on a fresh seafood dinner at a local fishing village.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your friendly guide and professional driver will meet you at your hotel for this Kuala Selangor Tour from Kuala Lumpur with fireflies boat ride and seafood dinner. Travel by bus northeast of the city to Kuala Selangor. Once the royal capital of the state and home to Kampung Kuantan, this destination is home to one of the world’s largest firefly colonies.

Upon arrival, make your way to Kota Melawati near the mouth of the Selangor River. Venture into the ruins of this ancient fort with your guide and learn about the cannons and other remnants from the 1900s. You’ll also tour the Royal Mausoleum where graves of the first three Sultans of Selangor are buried. Climb the 100 stairs to the top of Selangor Hill and learn about the much-storied execution block.

After that, head to Kuala Selangor Nature Park and gaze up at migratory birds. Keep your eyes peeled for silver-leaf monkeys, rare butterflies and indigenous birds. As the sun sets you’ll head to a nearby fishing village for a typical seafood dinner before making your way to Kampung Kuantan. Set sail on a Malaysian rowboat and take in the quiet beauty that surrounds you as your oarsman rows upstream through picturesque mangroves. Once darkness falls you’ll bear witness to thousands of sparkling fireflies. Your magical boat ride will last between 30 and 45 minutes. Upon completion you’ll head to shore and make your way back to your Kuala Lumpur hotel in the comfort of your air-conditioned vehicle.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
A moderate amount of walking is involved; comfortable walking shoes and an insect repellant are recommended.

Please note that hotel pickup and drop-off service operates only for hotels within the Kuala Lumpur central city limits. Sri Kembangan: Palace of the Golden Horses.
Shah Alam: Holiday Inn Glenmarie, The Saujana, all hotels within the Shah Alam area.
Putrajaya & KLIA: Putrajaya Shangrila, Putrajaya Marriott, Cyberview Lodge, Equatorial Bangi, Pan Pacific KLIA, Concorde Inn KLIA.
Please advise any specific dietary requirements at time of booking.

You’ll also tour the Royal Mausoleum where graves of the first three Sultans of Selangor are buried. Climb the 100 stairs to the top of Selangor Hill and learn about the much-storied execution block.

After that, head to Kuala Selangor Nature Park and gaze up at migratory birds. Keep your eyes peeled for silver-leaf monkeys, rare butterflies and indigenous birds. As the sun sets you’ll head to a nearby fishing village for a typical seafood dinner before making your way to Kampung Kuantan. Set sail on a Malaysian rowboat and take in the quiet beauty that surrounds you as your oarsman rows upstream through picturesque mangroves. Once darkness falls you’ll bear witness to thousands of sparkling fireflies. Your magical boat ride will last between 30 and 45 minutes. Upon completion you’ll head to shore and make your way back to your Kuala Lumpur hotel in the comfort of your air-conditioned vehicle.

Packages.PackageDesc: Monkey Feeding and Firefly Evening Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Join this tour for a unique wildlife experience! Spend time among the Silvered Leaf Monkeys and enjoy up close and personal encounters with them, view the stunning Fireflies as they shimmer and shine in the night, putting on a show just for you, and enjoy a delicious and fresh dinner at a riverside cafe. All the while taking in the beautiful Malaysian scenery surrounding you.

highlights.highlightItem: Close encounter with wildlife.
Comprehensive tour by bus/coach.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your tour will begin with a pickup from your hotel before departing Kuala Lumpur at 4pm for the fishing village in Kuala Selangor. Upon arrival at the Bukit Melawati Hills in Kuala Selangor at approximately 5:30pm, you will visit the lighthouse perched 27m (88.6 feet) above sea level. You will also have the opportunity to come face to face with the adorable Silvered Leaf Monkeys.

The Silvered Leaf monkeys are adorable and friendly animals that live on the Bukit Melawati Hills. These monkeys live on shoots, young leaves and wild fruits. They tend to live in clusters of 6 to 10 and their infants are orange in colour, often turn silver after 3 months.
You will be provided with snacks such as green leaves and fruits to feed to the Monkeys. Prepare for a close encounter with nature at its best as the Monkeys may climb all over you to reach the food!
After this special experience, you will be taken to a riverside cafe for a delicious dinner, all fresh from the fishing village.

After dinner, you’ll catch a boat to watch the fireflies. You must remain quiet, so as not to scare them away. The sparkling lights of the fireflies resemble a Christmas tree. It’s a beautiful, natural phenomenon and also quite rare in this part of the world.

The Fireflies congregate on mangrove trees to feed on nectar. They flash synchronously and the light is produced by a complex biochemical reaction in their light organs situated on the underside of their bottoms.
At approximately 8:30pm you will depart for your hotel in Kuala Lumpur. At 10pm you’ll arrive safe and sound with many new memories to cherish.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Child rate applies only when sharing with 2 paying adults Infant seats are available on request if advised at time of booking.

PackageDetails.overview: Low cost private taxi transfer from Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KUL) to your hotel or address in Banting  city centre.

highlights.highlightItem: Skip the line.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Airport transfer.
All taxes, fuel surcharges and service fees included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Make sure everything for your trip is organized. Our driver will be there when you arrive and ensure your safe and fast transfer to Banting without you having to worry.

You will be awaited by your private driver in the arrival terminal holding in sign with your name on it. When your flight is delayed, do not worry, your driver will monitor your flight and be there when you arrived. He will then help you with your luggage and lead you to the car. Once you and the driver double-checked the location address you provided us with he will take you straight to your destination in Banting. Enjoy the drive past the famous Morib Beach and the Tadom Base while the driver takes you to your destination.

To make sure that your transfer progresses smoothly we ask you to provide us with your flight number and the address of destination in Banting when you confirm the booking. As soon as you booked you will receive a transfer voucher to present to your private driver.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Batu Caves and Temple Afternoon Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: This private tour of Batu Caves and Temple highlights one of Malaysia’s most sacred destinations for Hindus. Travel from Kuala Lumpur in comfort as you make your way to Little India and the iconic caves. You’ll see the ancient art of batik silk dying and watch local artisans creating jewelry at a craft center. Hotel pickup and drop off is included in this private tour through Kuala Lumpur’s Indian heritage, Hindu shrines and artistic roots.

highlights.highlightItem: Private tour from Kuala Lumpur.
Learn about Kuala Lumpur's Indian heritage on a visit to Little India.
Explore famous Batu Caves, home to a magnificent Hindu shrine.
Witness the art of batik silk design and jewelry making at local crafts centers.
Enjoy interesting, informative commentary from your private guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your friendly guide and professional driver will collect you from your Kuala Lumpur hotel for this private afternoon tour of the Batu Caves and Temple. Enjoy the comfort and convenience of private transport as you make your way through the Brickfields neighborhood—commonly referred to as Little India. You’ll wander through this colorful part of the city as you listen to commentary from your guide before making your way to the Batu Caves.

These limestone wonders have deep caverns that protect Hindu deities. Watch monkeys playfully swing from trees around the entrance as you embark up the 272 steps to the top of this famed destination. Hear from your guide why the Batu Caves are considered one of the nation’s most sacred places and gaze out at the incredible views from atop the staircase.

Follow your guide to Gombak, where you’ll tour an arts and crafts center and learn about the art of batik silk dying and watch a jewelry-making demonstration. Your tour ends with private transport back to your Kuala Lumpur hotel after an incredible day exploring!

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Adult pricing applies to all travelers.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Delicious Bak Kut Teh Food Tour in Klang

PackageDetails.overview: Experience Malaysia’s diverse food traditions with a private, half-day food tour to a Bak Kut Teh restaurant in Klang, Selangor from Kuala Lumpur. Meet your guide at your KL hotel, and hear about local food culture and 'meat bone herbal tea soup' as you make the trip to Klang for lunch or dinner. Learn to eat and order like a local as you sample the herbal, rich soup that’s scented with aromatic spices and pork ribs, and enjoy an unforgettable, once in a lifetime meal.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day lunch or dinner trip to a Klang Bak Kut Teh restaurant.
Try a distinctive local food.
Visit the city with an experienced guide.
Learn about Malaysia's food traditions.
Private guide for a more personalized experience.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Join this approximately 4-5 hour amazing food tour at the famous restaurant in Klang, Selangor and taste the delicious Bak Kut Teh (meat bone herbal tea soup). There are a few departure options for the tour: We will departing at 7:30pm on Thursday and Friday tour, and we have another 2 options on Saturday which start at 11am morning and 6pm for dinner.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Kuala Lumpur and heading to Klang. We will arrive at the famous Bak Kut Teh restaurant after an hour ride and you are ready to try the delicious Bak Kut Teh dishes (meat bone herbal tea soup), in both soup and dry type.

The ingredient used to cook the  Bak Kut Teh consist of pork ribs and herbs such as tong kui, some spices include cinnamon, cloves, garlic and star anise. The pork ribs are boiled in the herbs for hours until the meat become tender. The common way of taking Bak Kut Teh is always with Chinese tea and rice.

We spend 1.5-2 hours at the restaurant and rest assured that you will be sinking in your teeth into this delicious local Chinese Hokkien food. You will be transported back to your hotel safely after dinner.

inclusion.item: Professional English speaking local guide and driver.
Hotel pickup and drop-off (KL area only).

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Children must be accompanied by an adult.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Half Day Batu Caves Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Start your excursion with the visit of the Malaysian Batik Cottage as well as a short stop at the Royal Selangor Pewter factory. You will then proceed to the well-known Batu Caves, which has 272 steps to reach the shrine of the Hindu deity Lord Subramaniam and set within an outcrop of lime stone caves.

highlights.highlightItem: Private tour of Batu Caves.
Huff up the steep steps to the enshrined cave.
Discover Hindu traditions and beliefs.
Stop at the Royal Selangor Pewter Factory.
Private hotel transport included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Start your excursion with the visit of the Malaysian Batik Cottage as well as a short stop at the Royal Selangor Pewter factory. You will then proceed to the well-known Batu Caves, which has 272 steps to reach the shrine of the Hindu deity Lord Subramaniam and set within an outcrop of lime stone caves.

The main Hindu festivals are celebrated every year at Batu Cave including 'Diwali' or Deepavali, that celebrate the victory of light over darkness; and also since 1892, the festival of Thaipusam, one of the biggest celebration for Hinduism community from all over the world. During Thaipusam, the procession of the event actually begins from a Temple ('Maha Mariamman' Temple, the oldest one in Kuala Lumpur built in 1873) located in the city centre of Kuala Lumpur, barely a street behind the ever busy China Town.

Batu cave remains the most interesting place outside of India to get a chance to observe and attend to the main celebrations of the Hindu community from India, Australia or Singapore. Hinduism remains a minority religion in Malaysia. An estimated 9% of the total population of Malaysia are ethnic Indians, of whom almost 89% are practicing Hinduism. Indian settlers came to Malaysia in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Many of these came to work as labourers on rubber plantations, while those who were English-educated occupied more professional positions.
This visit is not only a great opportunity to discover more about Hinduism traditions and beliefs, It is also a unique way to learn about the history of Malaysia and understand its multiculturalism.

inclusion.item: Driver/guide only (supplement for separate guide apply and are subject to availability).

exclusion.item: Separate guide for this tour (supplements apply).

Packages.PackageDesc: Pulau Ketam Village Tour from Kuala Lumpur Including Thean Hou Temple

PackageDetails.overview: Discover the laid-back fishing village of Pulau Ketam (Crab Island) during this 8-hour excursion that also includes a short sightseeing tour in Kuala Lumpur. Experience the daily lifestyle of the the island’s locals as you explore this unique community situated above the water line on stilts. Then enjoy a tasty Malaysian lunch before catching the included ferry back to Kuala Lumpur, where you’ll undertake a brief coach sightseeing trip to two of the country’s largest mosque and Chinese temple. Your excursion also includes round-trip hotel transport, a guide and entrance fees.

highlights.highlightItem: Discover the simple lifestyle in the quaint fishing village of Pulau Ketam on this tour from Kuala Lumpur.
See how houses and roads of this rustic community are built on stilts!
Witness daily activities of fisherman and residents Savor authentic Malaysian flavors with lunch at a local restaurant (own expense).
Visit two of Malaysia’s most famous religious landmarks: Sultan Salahuddin Abdul Aziz Mosque and Thean Hou Temple.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Experience both the rural and urban sides of Malaysia during this morning visit to the fishing village of Pulau Ketam, followed by a ferry ride back to Kuala Lumpur to visit the country’s largest mosque and Chinese temple. It’s a great way to get a sense for the unique contrasts of tradition, religion and modern urban areas that make Malaysia such an interesting melting pot.

Begin your trip with a pickup from your central Kuala Lumpur hotel. Pickups will begin prior to 8:45am, so expect details from your tour operator during reconfirmation of the exact schedule. You’ll then proceed on a 1-hour drive to the ferry terminal at Port Klang to catch your boat to the small fishing hamlet of Crab Island (Pulau Ketam).

After arriving on the island, set off on foot to begin your exploration of this one-of-a-kind community built on stilts above the waters of the area’s mangrove swamps. As you walk you’ll witness some of the key differences in daily lifestyle between the city dwellers and the island’s residents. Observe locals as they take a break on their front porches, walk past brightly-colored Chinese temples adorned with statues of marine creatures and spot fishermen as they peel shrimp for consumption in the local restaurants. As you might expect of this coastal city, Pulau Ketam is famous for its seafood, particularly crab.

Stop by a local restaurant to have some lunch (at your own expense) savoring the strong, vibrant flavors of Malaysian cuisine, a culinary style that blends a variety of cultural influences. After your meal, catch your included ferry back to Port Klang, where you’ll begin a short coach sightseeing tour of Kuala Lumpur.

Drive first to the ornate Palace of the Sultan of Selangor before heading to the Sultan Salahuddin Abdul Aziz Mosque. At almost 36 acres (15 hectares) the second largest such mosque in Southeast Asia and the biggest in Malaysia.

Make your final stop of the day at Thean Hou Temple, also among the largest in Southeast Asia. Check out the temple’s complex murals and many decorative details, providing a great example of Chinese artistic techniques. From here you’ll receive a drop-off back at your central Kuala Lumpur hotel.

inclusion.item: Roundtrip ferry tickets between Kuala Lumpur and Port Klang.

Packages.PackageDesc: Rice Fields and Fireflies Tour including Lunch and Dinner from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: This 10 hour tour showcases the local surroundings of Kuala Lumpur. We make a trip to the Sekinchan Rice Field, Sekinchan Redang beach, the Rice Museum and experience the local fireflies. A seafood lunch and dinner is included.

highlights.highlightItem: Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Get up-close to native wildlife.
Travel by boat and see the sights from the water.
Lunch included.
Dinner included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This Sekinchan Rice Field and Kuala Selangor Fireflies Tour starts at 10am from Kuala Lumpur. Our journey starts with a 90 minute drive through the Kuala Lumpur countryside, passing a Palm Oil plantation and a jungle. On the way we stop off at a Chinese temple and a famous wishing tree. We then arrive at the beautiful Redang Beach before heading to Sekinchan for a fresh and tasty seafood lunch. Sekinchan is a well-known fishing village and one of the major rice supplying regions in Malaysia.

After lunch we take you to the Sekinchan rice fields, depending on the time of year the colors of the fields can vary from whether they are in the planting or harvesting season. We then visit the Rice Museum to learn more about the history of this major rice producing area. On our way out of Sekinchan we visit the beautiful Nan Tian Temple and with the sun starting to set we continue to Melawati Hill, a former fort with a antique cannon facing the busy Straits of Malacca.Whilst here it is likely you will encounter the local inhabitant, the Silver Leaf Monkey.

We then proceed towards Kuala Selangor for dinner and your boat ride through the mangroves. Our seafood dinner is served on the riverside and if you are lucky enough to see it the sunset view is amazing. Once dinner has finished and night is upon us we join our boat to view the fireflies. You will be amazed by these mesmerizing fireflies and the area is known to have one of the largest colonies in the world. We then head back to your hotel in Kuala Lumpur.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

AdditionalInfo.info: A moderate amount of walking is involved.
Not recommended for pregnant women.

Packages.PackageDesc: Selangor Full-Day Tour

PackageDetails.overview: In Selangor, there are many attractions and beautiful nature for visitors to discover. This full day tour can be customized based on your choice and led by a professional local tour guide. Join this tour to experience and explore the beautiful and peaceful nature as well as to learn the local culture.

highlights.highlightItem: Small-group tour.
Travel by boat and see the sights from the water.
Scenic air tour.
Led by a local guide.
Vegetarian meal option available.
Snacks and Beverages included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The tour start with the walk at the Forest Research Institute Malaysia (FRIM). It is a good and popular outdoor recreation spot. You can see some people cycling, hiking and picnicking during the weekend.

After a walked at the Forest Research Institute Malaysia (FRIM), we will stop for lunch and then proceed to climb at a limestone hill - the Batu Caves, one of the holiest Hindu temples outside India and located in a spectacular natural setting.

You will move on to one of the tourist favorite place, the Bukit Melawati which located near the mouth of the Selangor River. Historically, Bukit Melawati was important for the survival of the state of Selangor from aggressors of other the states and overseas. At Bukit Melawati, you will be greeted by a beautiful lighthouse called Altingsburg Lighthouse but no one is allow to enter the side.
The star attraction of the Melawati Hill is actually the Silver Leafed Monkeys and Long-Tail Macaques, they are looking for food and climb at every high points but they are not aggressive.
The day ends with a seafood dinner and a boat cruise to see the natural light show of fireflies over the water.

Packages.PackageDesc: Sunway Lagoon Theme Park Day Trip from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy an exciting day trip from Kuala Lumpur that’s filled with family fun. After this wet and wild escape you’ll understand why Sunway Lagoon ranks tops among Malaysia’s amusement and water parks. This detonation is jam-packed with more than 80 attractions and three theme lands. It’s an ideal escape for travelers with children or even just playful adults who are looking to feel like kids again. The tour includes stops at leather and batik factories, as well as the Petronas Twin Towers. Round-trip transportation from your Kuala Lumpur hotel is also included in this day trip.

highlights.highlightItem: Day trip to Sunway Lagoon Theme Park from Kuala Lumpur.
Spend a day of family-friendly fun at one of Asia's top attractions!
Enjoy rides and spills in the park's themed lands: World of Adventure, Wild Wild West, Waters of Africa, Extreme Park and Scream Park.
Go surfing, float in river rapids, and catch street theater and dance performances.
Visit a leather and batik showroom and stop for a photo opportunity at Petronas Twin Towers on the way.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your friendly driver will collect you from your Kuala Lumpur hotel for this Sunway Lagoon Theme Park day trip from the capital. Stop at a leather and batik showroom en route to the adventure land and meet local artisans creating contemporary art using age-old techniques. Stop at the Petronas Twin Towers before arriving at Sunway Lagoon—approximately 30 minutes outside Kulala Lumpur.

Head into the park, where you’ll find some 80 attractions and multiple theme lands to explore: World of Adventure, Extreme Park, Wild Wild West, Scream Park and Waters of Africa. Choose from thrilling rides like Pirates Revenge or the Grand Canyon River Rapids.
Check out the street theater and dance performances taking place in each of the theme areas and keep your eyes peeled for Captain Quack, Sunway’s popular mascot.
Once you’ve had your fill of this favorite Malaysian stop, head back to Kuala Lumpur and return to your central hotel.

inclusion.item: Entrance fees to the following parks: World of Adventure, Wild Wild West, Waters of Africa, Extreme Park and Scream Park.

PackageDetails.overview: Spend a memorable day with your family and kids to Sunway Lagoon Theme Park in Petaling Jaya at your preferred time. The round trip private transfer from your hotel in Kuala Lumpur and Petaling Jaya to Sunway Lagoon is provided. Our vehicle can cater for group or family up to 7 people.

highlights.highlightItem: Family friendly.
Ideal choice for families.
Popular choice with kids.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Magically transformed from the site of an old tin mine and quarry, Sunway Lagoon is one of the Malaysia’s largest theme park. Set amidst beautifully landscaped surroundings, it is a cascade of rides, slides and family attractions of international standard.

The Park contains more than 80 attractions and three theme lands. It’s an ideal escape for travellers with children or even just playful adults who are looking to feel like kids again. The tour includes stops at leather and batik factories and stop for a photo opportunity at Petronas Twin Towers on the way. Round-trip transportation from your Kuala Lumpur hotel is also included in this day trip.

Packages.PackageDesc: The Foundry Workshop Guided Tour at Royal Selangor Visitor Centre

PackageDetails.overview: Royal Selangor Visitor Centre is a one-stop destination to learn, play, shop and eat in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Visitors will discover the rich colonial history behind Malaysian pewter crafting via complimentary guided museum and factory tours. In the Foundry workshop you will be guided through the process of casting, polishing and decorating a pewter accessory by an experienced instructor. At the end of the session, you will take home your own pewter accessory.

highlights.highlightItem: Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Tour is wheelchair accessible.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Royal Selangor Visitor Centre visitors are guided through various tin/pewter exhibits in the museum before proceeding to the factory where they can try out a pewter crafting process. The tour includes a brief look at Comyns' historical archive and the Selberan fine jewellery workshop, the two precious metal brands under Royal Selangor. Workshops on crafting take-home pewter souvenirs are available. There are also photo opportunities with the world’s largest pewter tankard.

inclusion.item: Guided tour of the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre, including the factory to see how pewter is made.
Hotel pickup and drop-off (selected hotels only).

Packages.PackageDesc: 2-Day Taman Negara National Park Adventure and Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Join this 2-day tour for an experience of a lifetime! Enjoy an exciting tour to Taman Negara National Park and the Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary. Let your worries wash away as you delight in a range of activities such as Taman Negara Canopy Walk, Rapid Shooting to Trenggan, and of course Elephant Sanctuary Tours.

highlights.highlightItem: Close encounter with wildlife.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Small group ensures personal service.
All entrance fees included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Day 1 Leave Kuala Lumpur early at 6:00am before embarking on the journey to Kuala Tahan. Enjoy passing through the Kuala Lumpur Countryside and entering the scenic Karak Highway covered by the green jungle and hill on the left and right.

Arrive into Kuala Tahan, where you will be staying in the Kampung House. Proceed to Tea Time at Floating Restaurant by the riverside. Then take water taxi to cross to Taman Negara, start trekking to Teresek Hill to view the highest Mount of Peninsula, GunungTahan.

After this you will proceed to Canopy Walk, the 500+ meters long (1640.41995 feet) hanging bridge build linking from trees to trees for the purpose of studying nature and animals by Malaysia Nature Society and Government effort.

Enjoy lunch at Riverside Floating Restaurant before Rapid Shooting to Kuala Trenggan, be prepared to get wet. Stop by at Orang AsliKampung to learn blowpipe and fire starting skill the primitive way. Bring along some titbit for the Orang Asli Children.
Finish off the day with an evening dinner and night Jungle Walk.

Day 2 Enjoy a nice breakfast before taking some time to relax and immerse yourself in kampong life. Depart Kuala Tahan at 10:00am and head off to Lanchang Town. Today you will taste local fruits along the road and enjoy a picnic lunch. Visit Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary. Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary was set up by Malaysia Nature Society body with Malaysia Government support to rescue and rehabilitate displace and orphanage Elephant. Once they are tamed and matured enough they will be released back into the wild. Take a visit to the Elephant Museum and witness Elephant Feeding and bathing.
We will depart for Kuala Lumpur in the afternoon. Along the way is another famous venue stop, the Batu Caves with its 272 steps up to Limestone Caves.
This tour will test your stamina but you’ll be rewarded with amazing experiences and lifelong memories.

inclusion.item: Hotel pickup and drop-off (if option selected).

Packages.PackageDesc: 2-Day Cameron Highlands Adventure from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Journey outside the city and experience the beauty and peace of rural Malaysia on this two-day trip to the Cameron Highlands. Visit a tea plantation and sample local brews, meet traditional farmers and get a true sense of local life outside Kuala Lumpur. Journey through Tana Rata’s stunning waterfalls and enjoy round-trip hotel transportation.

highlights.highlightItem: Two-day trip to Cameron Highlands from Kuala Lumpur.
Scenic drive through Tanah Rata where you'll pass by waterfalls and fern trees.
Admire the stunning vistas of rolling hills.
Visit a tea plantation and learn about the process of tea curing.
Interact with local farmers as you walk through the vegetable plantations.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This two-day Cameron Highlands Adventure from Kuala Lumpur kicks off with a two-hour driver to Tanah Ratah, following hotel pick up. Enjoy the breathtaking beauty of the Cameron Highlands, where old-school tea plantations dot the rolling hills. You’ll see lush landscapes and thundering waterfalls en route to your tea plantation tour. Learn how this popular beverage is grown, processed and packaged, before sampling cups of steaming local tea.
This tour also includes a visit to a local farm and Sam Poh Temple, where your expert guide will walk you through the Buddhist structure and point out some of its most remarkable features.

inclusion.item: Meals as per itinerary (B=breakfast, L=lunch, D=dinner).
