Packages.PackageDesc: 3 Days 2 Nights Tour to Taman Negara and Cameron Highlands from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Join this 3 days and 2 nights tour trekking through an amazing rainforest, Taman Negara. One of the most popular ecotourism destinations in Malaysia, and see many wildlife such as birds, interesting insects, butterflies and moths. Enjoy a breath-taking views at Cameron Highlands and visit to Tea Plantations, Butterfly Farm, Strawberry Farm, Vegetable Market, the Cactus and Flower Gardens.

highlights.highlightItem: Close encounter with wildlife.
Multi-Day Trip.
Family friendly.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Enjoy fantastic aerial views.
All entrance fees included.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Day 1: Depart from your hotel in Kuala Lumpur around 7am to Taman Negara with approximately 4-hour drive. Upon arrival, we will head to the canopy walkway at 148 feet (45m) in height and 1,673 feet (520m) in length to view various flora and fauna in their natural habitat. This will be followed by jungle trekking where the experienced nature guide will belt out facts and fancies about Taman Negara. Please bring insect repellent, water and comfortable walking shoes. We will return to Floating Cafe for lunch and continue with rapids shooting as the boatman negotiates 7 sets of rapids. You will get a 'chance' to get wet.  Please bring a water proof bag, changing clothes and towel. The boat ride takes us to an aborigine village where you will get to see fire making skills and blowpipe hunting techniques. The Batek tribe live environment friendly and nomadic lifestyle. Around 5pm, we will check in to hotel (3 star), free and easy. 7pm dinner at floating cafe followed by night jungle walk. Bring insect repellent, torchlight with extra batteries, raincoat and help the nature guide in the 'hunt' for lesser animals like mouse deer, insects, spiders, scorpions, wild boar, owls and etc. 10pm return to hotel for a good sleep.

Day 2: After breakfast at 8am, catch a boat to Cascading waterfalls - 45 minutes ride through scenic, mesmerizing calming effect scenery. Bring along swim wear. After lunch at 12pm, check out and depart for Cameron Highlands. Check in our hotel (3 stars) and relax. A signature dish “Hot Pot” will be served at 7pm, and you will return to hotel at 10pm.

Day 3: After breakfast at 8am, catch a 4-wheel drive for the mossy forest tour, cruising along rolling hills to Mount Brinchang. The cool walk will reveal some unique flora as in carnivorous pitcher plant, primitive ferns, wild spices, medicinal and poisonous plants. Visit the oldest tea plantation and factory tour. Tea factory closed on Mondays and Public holidays. Lunch will be served around 1pm and check out. We will visit Butterfly Farm, Strawberry Farm, Vegetable Market, the Cactus and Flower Gardens. At 4pm, we depart for Kuala Lumpur and arriving approximate 5pm, en-route visit Batu Caves before heading back to your hotel.

inclusion.item: Bottled water, breakfast, lunch and dinner.
Hotel pickup and drop-off (in Kuala Lumpur only).

Packages.PackageDesc: 3-Night Cameron Highlands and Penang Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: See the best of Malaysia’s rural highlands on this three-night Cameron Highlands and Penang Tour from Kuala Lumpur. Enjoy round-trip coach transportation from your hotel or airport, as well as luxury accommodation on this memorable journey beyond the urban landscapes. A professional local guide will lead travelers through a tea plantation, the famed Sam Poh Tong cave temple, the historic city of Georgetown and the Kuala Sepetang mangroves. Enjoy an upclose look at the KekLok Si Temple, as well as a traditional trishaw ride on this one-of-a-kind tour that showcases the highlights of this unique nation!

highlights.highlightItem: 3-night tour of Cameron Highlands and Penang from Kuala Lumpur.
Tour a tea plantation and butterfly farm with an informative guide.
Visit the cave temple of Sam Poh Tong and the Pagoda of Ten Thousand Buddhas — Kek Lok Si See.
Lata Iskandar Waterfall, Fort Cornwallis and the Clan Jetties of Weld Quay.
Stop at Khoo Kongsi, a historical Chinese clan house in Penang’s Chinatown Ride a trishaw through Georgetown, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Hotel pickup and airport drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your three-night Cameron Highlands and Penang Tour from Kuala Lumpur kicks off with coach transportation from your hotel or the airport. Enjoy a scenic ride through rural Malaysia, as well as overnight accommodation at the Strawberry Park Resort—home to incredible views and rustic mountain atmosphere. Choose from single, twin or triple-share room options, which all include large private balconies, perfect for relaxing.

In Penang, you’ll enjoy two night’s at the Bayview Beach Resort, just north of Penang Island. The beachfront locale on BatuFerringhi offers a dramatic departure from the rolling hills of Strawberry Park Resort. Enjoy views of Foreigner’s Rock, as well as luxe rooms with private balconies. Accommodation includes tennis courts, fitness center, spa and swimming pool to enjoy at your leisure.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Day 1: Kuala Lumpur – Cameron Highlands Departing around 8:30am with pickup from your hotel in Kuala Lumpur, board your comfortable coach for the 135-mile (220-km) drive to the Cameron Highlands, one of Malaysia’s largest hill stations. Stop along the way to see a cottage industry of local basket weaving, followed by a visit to LataIskandar Waterfall and a native settlement — all accompanied by commentary from your knowledgeable guide. The gentle slopes of the Cameron Highlands, nestled in the northeast side of the Pahang Mountains, boast wonderful scenery amid crisp air and cool temperatures. Situated 5,060 feet (1,542 meters) above sea level, the tableland or plateau is well noted for its tea estates, farmlands, rivers, lakes and orchards. Your day tour here includes a visit to a local tea plantation, tea factory, market and butterfly farm. In the evening, settle in at the luxurious hill resort, enjoying views from the balcony as you sip your tea. Overnight: Strawberry Park Resort in the Cameron Highlands.

Day 2: Cameron Highlands – Penang (B)In the early morning, set off after breakfast for Penang aboard the coach and enjoy the scenic 205-mile (330-km) drive. En route, visit Sam Poh Tong, an impressive cave temple in GunungRapat, said to be the largest in Malaysia. Once you’ve climbed the 246 steps to the top, your guide will point out beautifully carved statues of the Buddha interspersed among the stalactites and stalagmites. Hear the legend of the 19th-century Chinese monk who discovered the cave and learn how the temple was later constructed. Make another coach stop at the royal town of Kuala Kangsar for the opportunity to photograph the stunning golden-domed exteriors of Ubudiah Mosque and Iskandariah Palace. View the former royal residence of Istana Kenangan, which today houses the Royal Museum of Perak. Proceed further to the Kuala Sepetang mangrove forest, the best-managed mangrove forest in Malaysia, serving an important ecological role in protecting the coastline from erosion. Delight in the novelty of walking with your guide through the natural mangrove forest along a boardwalk. As Kuala Sepetang produces the bulk of the nation’s top quality mangrove charcoal, you’ll also visit a charcoal kiln where charcoals are produced. In the late afternoon, you’ll cross over into Penang via Penang Bridge. Spanning eight miles (13.5 km) across, it’s one of the longest bridges in the world! After checking in to your hotel, feel free to relax or explore the nightlife along BatuFerringhi. Overnight: Bayview Beach Resort in Penang.

Day 3: Georgetown, Penang (B)After breakfast, depart by coach from your hotel and embark on a comprehensive sightseeing tour of historical Georgetown, located just 25 minutes away. Your guide will lead you to top cultural attractions in Georgetown, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. View the third longest reclining Buddha figure in the world, followed by a visit to KekLok Si Temple, also known as Pagoda of Ten Thousand Buddhas. Built in 1904, it is the largest Buddhist temple complex in Southeast Asia. Climb the steps to the temple, which includes a magnificent bronze statue of Guanyin, the Goddess of Mercy, and a seven-story pagoda featuring 10,000 alabaster and bronze Buddha statues. Continue by coach to Fort Cornwallis, the landing site of Captain Francis Light when he arrived in 1786 to start the first British colony in Penang. Inside the fort walls there are original structures like the chapel, prison cells, munitions storage, bronze canons and flagstaff belonging to the English East India Company. Then head to the waterfront village of the Weld Quay Clan Jetties, one of the last remaining old Chinese settlements on the island, where you’ll find houses built on stilts along the planks. Driving along Pitt Street, also known as the ‘Street of Harmony,’ view the churches, Chinese temples, mosques and Hindu temples that have stood side by side for centuries in harmonious existence. Visit the intricate KhooKongsi clan house — part of a closely-knit network of Chinese clan associations established in Malaysia since the mid-19th century. Finally, enjoy a breezy trishaw ride, still a popular mode of transport in Georgetown. Pass charming colonial buildings and modern skyscrapers before returning to your hotel to spend the rest of your day at your leisure. Overnight: Bayview Beach Resort in Penang.
Day 4: Penang (B)After checking out of your accommodation, you’ll be transferred to Penang International Airport, located approximately 50 minutes away.

Meals as per itinerary (B=breakfast, L=lunch, D=dinner).

Packages.PackageDesc: 3-Day Taman Negara Adventure from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Take a walk on the wild side and explore one of the world’s oldest rainforests on this 3-day Taman Negara adventure, including 4-star accommodation, meals and transfers. Cruise down the Tembeling River by motor canoe, then get a taste of local life as you pass traditional ‘kampongs’ and take a jungle survival class. Keep a lookout for colourful birds, monkeys, tapir and wild boar as you enjoy a thrilling night hike through the jungle, then get an aerial view during a treetop canopy walk.

highlights.highlightItem: Kuala Lumpur to Taman Negara 3-day trip.
Scenic, two-hour boat trip from Kuala Tembeling to Kuala Tahan.
Walk across the canopy walkway to see the forest from a unique vantage point.
Take a jungle survival class and learn how to survive in the wild.
Keep your eyes out for nocturnal animals on an evening trek.
2-night stay in a 4-star resort hotel and expert guide included.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Day 1: Kuala Lumpur - Kuala Tembeling - Taman Negara (L, D). Depart from Kuala Lumpur for a three-hour drive to the rural town of Jerantut. Here, you’ll stop for lunch and a short rest before proceeding to Kuala Tahan. From here, enjoy a short boat ride to the park headquarters. Along the way on this scenic journey, you’ll see kampongs (Malaysian wooden houses), local fishermen, monkeys and jungle vegetation. Arrive and enjoy your evening of leisure After dinner (included in tour), watch a video presentation giving an overview of Taman Negara and embark on a night jungle walk with park rangers. You’ll explore the jungle from a different perspective and possibly see nocturnal animals. Overnight: 4-star Mutiara Taman Negara Resort or similar.

Day 2: Taman Negara (B, L, D). The itinerary for day two may vary depending on the season and availability of the park facilities. A common activity is to walk along the canopy walkway. The canopy is suspended 82 feet (25 meters) above the ground between massive trees and allows for close-up views of the higher reaches of the forest. After the canopy walk, go on a jungle trek to Teresik Hill. From here, you’ll be able to view Mt Tahan, the highest mountain in peninsular Malaysia, soaring to 7,186 feet (2,178 meters). During the trek, you’ll learn about the fundamentals of jungle survival, jungle ecology and flora identification from your guide. Returning back to the park headquarters on a different trail, you’ll pass Lubok Simpon water hole where you can jump in for a swim. At night, you’ll have the option to participate in an animal 'vigil' at the tree house. However, sighting of animals is not guaranteed. Overnight: 4-star Mutiara Taman Negara Resort.
Day 3: Taman Negara - Kuala Lumpur (B, L). After breakfast, you will take the return journey to Kuala Lumpur.

inclusion.item: Meals as per itinerary (B=breakfast, L=lunch, D=dinner)

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Passengers should bring light comfortable clothing, jungle boots, hat, light raincoat, flashlight, tennis shoes, swimming costumes and sweater.

The visit to Taman Negara is adventurous but suitable for all including children. Passengers traveling with children should be prepared and bring all necessities that are needed by the children or babies, as once inside it is quite isolated.
Accommodations at the 4-star Taman Negara Resort are Malaysian-styled wooden chalets with the following amenities.
Air-conditioner (with individual controls).
Hot and cold shower.
Toiletries.
Prayer mat.
Kiblat sign.
Tea- and coffee-making facilities.
Balcony with a river or forest view.
Mini bar (chalet suites only).
Sitting area (chalet suites only).
Writing desk and stationary (chalet suits only).

Packages.PackageDesc: 4-Day Taman Negara Adventure From Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Delve deep into the Malaysian rainforest on this 4-day Taman Negara adventure from Kuala Lumpur. Spot native nocturnal wildlife during a forest night-walk with your guide. Paddle upstream to Lata Berkoh and test your nerve on Malaysia’s longest suspension bridge. Hike up Teresek Hill to Mount Tahan and enjoy stunning views over the dense forest below. Swim in the Lubok Simpon water hole or spot wildlife from a secret hide. Meet local tribe members at the Orang Asli settlement, then splash through thrilling rapids on a white-water rafting trip.

highlights.highlightItem: 4-day, 3-night trip to Taman Negara from Kuala Lumpur.
Stay three nights at the Mutiara Taman Negara Resort, in the heart of the rainforest.
Take part in various activities offered at the resort, including the popular canopy walk and the night jungle walk.
Learn about the aboriginal lifestyle on a visit to the Orang Asli settlement.
Feel your heart racing while shooting river rapids.
Look for native wildlife like wild pigs, tapirs, sambar deers and more!

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Day 1 (D) - Your trip starts with a three-hour drive from Kuala Lumpur to the river bank at Kuala Tembeling. Here, board a motor canoe for the two-hour ride to your resort. Enjoy the sights and sounds of the rainforest as you cruise along the river. Once settled in, join expert resort guides for a night walk through the rainforest. Try to spot a few creepy crawlies hiding in the dark!

Day 2 (B,L,D) - Today is activity day around Taman Negara – choose from a variety of outdoor experiences that will bring you closer to nature. Take a canoe upstream to Lata Berkoh, where you can go fishing – there are an estimated 300 species of fish in the river! Tackle the longest suspension bridge in Malaysia – more than 1,700 feet (500 meters) – on the canopy walk. Hike up Teresek Hill to Mount Tahan, where you’ll be rewarded with breathtaking views of the park. Go swimming at the Lubok Simpon water hole. Or join park guides on an ‘Animal Vigil’ in a tree house to look for wildlife.

Day 3 (B,L,D) - Connect with aboriginals on a visit to the Orang Asli settlement. Learn about the native culture from local residents and discover their semi-traditional way of life, from playing the blowpipes and hunting with bows and arrows to using medicinal plants and building shelters with bamboo, wood and palm leaves. Later in the day, put on your lifejacket for a thrilling river rapids experience to Kuala Trenggan. As you ride along the river on a wooden boat accompanied by experienced boatmen, you’ll shoot through the many rapids and become quite drenched!
Day 4 (B) - Breakfast ends your Taman Negara experience. You will be taken by boat and coach back to Kuala Lumpur, where you can reminisce about your amazing, one-of-a-kind adventure!

inclusion.item: Meals as indicated in itinerary (B=Breakfast, L=Lunch, D=Dinner).
Land and boat transfer to and from Taman Negara.

Activities offered by the park: night jungle walk, canopy walk, jungle trekking up Teresek Hill, boat cruise to Lata Berkoh for swimming and fishing, rapid shooting at Kuala Trenggan, Orang Asli settlement visit.
3-night accommodation  at Mutiara Taman Negara Resort.
Amenities including air conditioner, Ceiling fan, private bedroom with attached bathroom, Hot and cold shower & Veranda with a forest view.

exclusion.item: Food and drinks, unless otherwise specified.

Please be advised that the following may be needed: light comfortable clothing, jungle boots, a hat, raincoat, comfortable shoes, swimwear, mosquito repellent, sweater. Essentials are contingent upon passenger need.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Elephant Orphanage Sanctuary Day Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Your private tour of the Kuaala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary is certain to be a highlight of any trip to Malaysia. This incredible conservation centre is run by the nation’s Wildlife Society and is tucked away amid tropical forests less than two hours from the capital. You’ll make a stop at Deer land Park en route to the sanctuary and learn from your expert local guide why protecting these gentle giants has become the life’s mission of this unique sanctuary. Some travellers may even have the chance to interact with tiny elephant babies—sure to be a once-in-a-lifetime experience!

highlights.highlightItem: Private tour of Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary (also known as the Elephant Orphanage Sanctuary) from Kuala Lumpur.
See Indonesian deer at Deerland Park and enjoy scenic views of plantations.
Learn about the lifestyle of nomadic people on a visit to an aboriginal settlement.
Get up close to majestic elephants and hear about the center's efforts to rehabilitate these rescued animals.
Enjoy complimentary lunch and soft drinks.
Expert private guide ensures an enriching and exciting experience.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your friendly guide and professional driver will collect you from your Kuala Lumpur hotel to start this private Elephant Orphanage Sanctuary Day Tour from the capital city. Make a stop at Deerland Park en route to the sanctuary, where you’ll watch Indonesian deer prance through the Malaysian countryside. Your guide will offer insight and history about the nomadic lifestyle of those living in the aboriginal settlement you visit before you make your way to your destination.

Travel through dense rainforest and lush tropical foliage where you’ll emerge at the Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary. Known also as the Elephant Orphan Sanctuary—this unique destination is located just an hour and a half from Kuala Lumpur but feels like a lifetime away. Your tour of the grounds kicks off with an informative video that details the preservation efforts taken by the Malaysian Wildlife Society to protect these gentle giants. Learn how passionate professionals have created a natural environment to nurse elephants back to health before returning them to the wild. Watch as these gray beasts roam the camp and listen as your private guide explains how trained professionals feed and care for the animals. Tuck into a Malaysian lunch from a popular restaurant, or packed to carry. Afternoon tours offer a chance to bathe baby elephants if river conditions allow. (Please note: this optional activity is not included in the tour price and must be purchased at the sanctuary. Bathing does not take place when water levels are high.) After a memorable day getting up close to nature, you’ll travel back to your Kuala Lumpur hotel in the air-conditioned comfort of your own private vehicle with memories (and pictures) to last a lifetime.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Adult pricing applies to all travelers.
Baby elephant bathing and feeding activity is available in the afternoon and can be purchased at the sanctuary.
Baby elephant bathing is subject to cancellation when water level of the river is too low.
Please note: When Deerland Park is closed on Fridays, there will be a longer stop at the aboriginal settlement.

Packages.PackageDesc: Elephant Sanctuary Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Learn about Malaysia’s indigenous culture and watch elephants feed and bathe at an elephant sanctuary with a full-day trip from Kuala Lumpur. Visit a local village to get a glimpse of everyday life for Malaysians, and then continue to the sanctuary to meet the elephants. Watch the creatures being fed and bathed, and learn how the sanctuary protects the elephant population. NOTE: In monsoon season some or all elephant activities may be cancelled if the river is above a safe level.

highlights.highlightItem: Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Lunch included.
Get up-close to native wildlife.
See native wildlife in their natural environment.
Popular choice with kids.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: After being picked up from your hotel, you will embark on the 2 hour long journey to the Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary. The Elephant Sanctuary is located along the East coast Expressway between Kuala Lumpur and the city of Kuantan.
Upon arrival you will be taken to the Aboriginal Settlement where you can meet some friendly locals and soak in the Malay culture.
After this you will be led to the elephants. You will be able to witness the elephants being fed and bathed as well as going about their usual activates.
The Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary cares deeply about the well-being of the Elephants and it shows. To minimize stress on the elephants, visitors can only view the elephants 2 times a day.
This is a fantastic experience for families. Kids will walk away from this tour with an appreciation for elephants for the rest of their lives.
Once the day is complete, you will be taken back to your hotel.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Infant free of charge, no seat.
A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.
All transfers and half/full day tours – NO refund for cancellation received within 24 hours’ notice.

Packages.PackageDesc: Fireflies Tour in Cherating

PackageDetails.overview: Join the one-hour boat tour to see the firefly and discover the local nature in Cherating. You will be charmed with the beauty of the fireflies in the trees. Your passionate guide will help make you have an amazing experience by calling them flying above the boat. This is a fun learning experience for both adults and children.

highlights.highlightItem: Close encounter with wildlife.
Popular choice with kids.
Ideal choice for families.
Family friendly.
See native wildlife in their natural environment.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Before embarking on the boat, you will have a briefing about fireflies and our safety measures. You will then take the river cruise at about 8pm, when it's pretty dark. You will travel down the river and the leader will shine his torch towards the trees and with that 100's of fireflies will slowly fly towards the boat.
The leader will also share with you all about the behaviour of fireflies, watching the little lights glide across the water to the boat is almost mystical.
Join this tour and have a wonderful night with your family and kids!

Packages.PackageDesc: Full Day Cameron Highlands Tour

PackageDetails.overview: This full-day tour to Cameron Highlands start at 7am and you will be pick up and drop off to Kuala Lumpur. This tour led by a professional English speaking tour and driver. The most interesting destination that you will be visited are Tanah Rata Town, Strawberry Farm, Brinchang Temple, vegetable farm, wet market, BOH tea plantations and tea making factory. Simple breakfast, lunch and tea break are included in this package. The entrance fee to Cactus Valley is also included. Come and join this tour to enjoy a beautiful scenery and wonderful greenery.

highlights.highlightItem: Full-day tour to Cameron Highlands, from Kuala Lumpur.
Tour the BOH tea plantation.
Pick fresh strawberries and stop at a vegetable market.
Visit the towns of Brinchang and Tanah Rata Stop at the Buddhist Sam Poh Temple.
See the cactus collection at Cactus Valley.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Cameron Highlands was named after the discoverer William Cameron in 1885, a British government Surveyor who came across, 'A fine plateau with gentle slopes', while he was researching through dense jungle on a mapping expedition. Creating a hill station in the area was first voiced in 1888 by Sir Hugh Low, a Perak resident who propose the idea it might be a suitable place for a retreat and farmland. Cameron Highlands was a heaven for the British who were stationed in Malaya as it provided relief from the hot and humid tropical climate of the lowlands.

Cameron Highlands stands at 1524 meters (5000 feet) above sea level, enjoys a cool climate, with temperatures rarely higher than 25°C and low than 10 °C. In 1929, John Archibald Russell, who was the son of a British administrative officer started a tea plantation which is now the famous BOH Tea Plantation. BOH stands for Best of Highland. The other tea plantation was established in 1932, by the Shuparshad family and known as Bharat Tea Plantation in Cameron Valley brand. You will have chance to learn and understand the tea processing.

Cameron Highlands is the nation's prime producer of fresh vegetables as well such as cabbage, chili, cauliflower, broccoli and tomatoes. The strawberries and flowers are successfully cultivated and are the main export to Singapore. You can also self-pluck your strawberry from the tree.

Cameron Highlands is the smallest district in Pahang, nestled between the State of Perak and State of Pahang, covering an area of 443 square kilometers. It is positioned close to the border to the north. It is made up of 3 main township at different elevations. The first town you'll see coming from the South is Ringlet, followed by Tanah Rata and Brinchang. There are few small town such as Tringkap, Kuala Terla and Kampung Raja which going towards Northern part of Malaysia.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.

Packages.PackageDesc: Full Day Taman Negara Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Taman Negara is a 130 million years old rainforest that is home to many threatened mammals such as tigers, elephants, tapirs, rhinoceros, and sun bears. It is also home to 14,000 plants and flowers, 300 bird species and 238 freshwater fish species. The tour is about trekking in the beautiful rainforest to learn about the amazing flora and fauna. You will enjoy an exhilarating boat ride to visit the aborigine people – who are slowly but surely being assimilated into society. Learn about what’s being done to protect and preserve flora and fauna and its ecosystem with its rivers, waterfalls, secret caves, mountains, rolling hills and lush greenery – some of which you will view on the boat ride. Let your adventurous side take-over during the challenging 2 hour rainforest trek!

highlights.highlightItem: See native wildlife in their natural environment.
All entrance fees included.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Lunch included.
Led by a local guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will start early with a 7.00am pick up from your centrally located Kuala Lumpur hotel. We will then embark on the three and a half hour long drive to Kuala Tahan. Along the way you can enjoy the scenery of Kuala Lumpur.
Upon arrival, at approximately 10:30am, the fun will begin. Enjoy some packed snacks at the forest.
Gets your adrenaline pumping with the Canopy Walk! It is the longest canopy walkway in South East Asia with a bird's eye view of stunning scenery of the world's oldest rainforest.
Enjoy trekking to the Teresek Hills. The experienced nature guide will belt out facts and fancies of the varied flora in Taman Negara. He will uncover secrets and taboos of the forest.
Let out your inner-adventurer at the Rapids Shooting. Rapids shooting are a thrill, as the boatman negotiates 7 sets of rapids. It is a take-home experience as there is a 'chance' to get wet.

Immerse yourself in the culture with the Aborigine village visit. The 'orang asli' are of the batek tribe who have been living environment friendly lives. The rainforest is their supermarket where they get their life's necessities. A fire making and blowpipe demonstration is the order of the day.
Be sure to come with good walking shoes, insect repellents, and a change of clothing.
At approximately 4pm we will return to Floating Café for some lunch and freshening up before departing for Kuala Lumpur.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Children must be accompanied by parent.
Dress appropriately.
Not recommended for participants with heart complaints or other serious medical conditions.
Due to uneven surfaces, this tour is not recommended for those with walking disabilities or using a wheelchair.

Packages.PackageDesc: Full-Day Cameron Highlands enroot Free Batu Caves Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Cameron Highlands is a hill resort at 1,500 meters above sea level with temperatures from 10 - 25 degrees Celsius. It was discovered by a British surveyor Mr William Cameron in 1885. The area is known for its farmlands, tea plantations, orchards, nurseries, waterfalls, rivers, lakes, wildlife, mossy forest, and its local people. Come and find out more on this fabulous tour that gives you a real insight into this area.

highlights.highlightItem: Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.
All entrance fees included.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: 7.00am: After breakfast at your hotel we depart for the Cameron Highlands. On the way we will visit; Cascading waterfalls - The waterfalls cascade into a narrow stream where locals go for a cool dip. The nearby shops sell souvenirs, tribal handicrafts, strange herbs, aphrodisiacs and tropical fruits. Aborigine village - Learn how the locals use the rain forest for their daily foods. You will also get to experience some local traditions.

1130am: We stop for lunch and then continue our tour visiting; Tea plantation visit - The boh tea plantation was founded by a British businessman Mr J A Russell in 1929. Today boh owns 3 tea estates with 8,000 acres of an undulating, vast carpet of greenery.  The tea plantation works closely with the WWF (World Wildlife Fund) and the MNS (Malaysian Nature Society) to help in the conservation of our elephants and orangutan population. A factory tour is also available  everyday except on Mondays.  Butterfly Farm & Insectarium - is a secret paradise where 5,000 butterflies dance on ferns and scented flowers. The landscaped gardens, exotic plants, fresh water turtles and insects are stunning. Strawberry Farm - a do-it-yourself handpick experience of fresh strawberries. Vegetable and fruits market  - take a stroll to see the various vegetables and fruits grown in the Cameron Highlands. Cactus & flower garden - a wide range of cactus in various shapes and sizes and beautiful flowers that thrive in the Cameron Highlands due to its conducive weather.
5.00pm: We start our return journey back to Kuala Lumpur and your hotel arriving at approximately 8pm.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
A moderate amount of walking is involved.

Packages.PackageDesc: Genting Highlands Day Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Get out of the city for a day of entertainment and fun with this excursion to Genting Highlands. The popular theme park and hill resort is home to a $D cinema casino, splash pool and plenty of games and rides---including Southeast Asia’s fastest and longest cable car. You’ll enjoy six hours of free time to explore all of the highlights of Malaysia’s largest casino and resort.

highlights.highlightItem: Genting Highlands day trip from Kuala Lumpur.
Enjoy a scenic drive to the Titiwangsa Mountains.
Take a ride on the Genting Skyway, Southeast Asia’s fastest and longest cable car
Visit the world-class casino, shops and restaurants.
Enjoy family-friendly fun at the indoor and outdoor theme parks.
Choose from more than 50 rides, including Asia’s only skydiving simulation.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your friendly and professional driver will collect you from your Kuala Lumpur hotel and transport you on an hour-long journey through the scenic hillsides of Malaysia on your way to Genting Highlands, the nation’s largest casino resort. This Genting Highlands Day Tour from Kuala Lumpur take you through the picturesque Titiwangsa Mountains, some 6,118 feet (1,835 meters) above sea level.

Upon arrival, take a trip on the 2-mile (3 km) Genting Skyway. As you make your way to the resort you’ll bear witness to panoramic views of mountains and jungles. Depart the Skyway and enjoy six hours of free time to explore the resort and casino at your leisure.

Travelers can also opt to enjoy the Getting Highlands indoor and outdoor theme parks (own expense), where over 50 rides, a Rainforest Splash Pool and a 4D cinema insure a day filled with entertainment and fun for the entire family. Your guide will offer advice and insight into the resort’s wide array of options, including restaurant recommendations, directions and details on the 80 shops that line the grounds.
After a day of entertainment, head back to the Getning Skyway and hop aboard your air-conditioned coach for the trip back to Kuala Lumpur and your center-city hotel.

inclusion.item: Cable car ride to Genting Highlands.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Please note that hotel pickup and drop-off service operates only for hotels within the Kuala Lumpur central city limits. If you are staying at the following hotels, please either make your own way to a hotel in central Kuala Lumpur or contact the local tour operator after booking to arrange pickup service for an additional fee (contact info will be provided on your confirmation voucher).

Greater Kuala Lumpur: Le Meridien, Hilton, Cititel, Boulevard MidValley, Pearl International, Eastin Hotel Petaling Jaya, Crystal Crown, Armada, Holiday Villa Subang, Grand Dorset Subang, Petaling Jaya Hilton, Sunway Lagoon, One World Damansara.
Sri Kembangan: Palace of the Golden Horses.
Shah Alam: Holiday Inn Glenmarie, The Saujana, all hotels within the Shah Alam area.
Putrajaya & KLIA: Putrajaya Shangrila, Putrajaya Marriott, Cyberview Lodge, Equatorial Bangi, Pan Pacific KLIA, Concorde Inn KLIA.
A moderate amount of walking is involved; comfortable walking shoes and a hat are recommended.
Please note that entrance fees to theme parks are not included and are payable on the day of travel; total fee is approximately US$40 to US$50.
Passengers below 21 years old are not allowed into the casino; a collared shirt must be worn for the casino.

Kindly be informed that Genting Theme Park and some of the rides located in First World Indoor Theme Park will be closed until the end of 2016. Rio Float, Reindeer Cruiser, Mini Train, Busy Bugs, Circus Ride, FunLand, Genting Bowl, SnowWorld, Vision City and Funtasy World Video Games Park will remain open as usual.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your friendly and professional driver will collect you from your Kuala Lumpur hotel and transport you on an hour-long journey through the scenic hillsides of Malaysia on your way to Genting Highlands, the nation’s largest casino resort. This Genting Highlands Day Tour from Kuala Lumpur take you through the picturesque Titiwangsa Mountains, some 6,118 feet (1,835 meters) above sea level.

Upon arrival, take a trip on the 2-mile (3 km) Genting Skyway. As you make your way to the resort you’ll bear witness to panoramic views of mountains and jungles. Depart the Skyway and enjoy six hours of free time to explore the resort and casino at your leisure.

Travellers can also opt to enjoy the Getting Highlands indoor and outdoor theme parks (own expense), where over 50 rides, a Rainforest Splash Pool and a 4D cinema insure a day filled with entertainment and fun for the entire family. Your guide will offer advice and insight into the resort’s wide array of options, including restaurant recommendations, directions and details on the 80 shops that line the grounds.
After a day of entertainment, head back to the Getning Skyway and hop aboard your air-conditioned coach for the trip back to Kuala Lumpur and your centre-city hotel.

inclusion.item: Cable car ride to Genting Highlands.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Please note that hotel pickup and drop-off service operates only for hotels within the Kuala Lumpur central city limits. If you are staying at the following hotels, please either make your own way to a hotel in central Kuala Lumpur or contact the local tour operator after booking to arrange pickup service for an additional fee (contact info will be provided on your confirmation voucher).

Greater Kuala Lumpur: Le Meridien, Hilton, Cititel, Boulevard MidValley, Pearl International, Eastin Hotel Petaling Jaya, Crystal Crown, Armada, Holiday Villa Subang, Grand Dorset Subang, Petaling Jaya Hilton, Sunway Lagoon, One World Damansara.
Sri Kembangan: Palace of the Golden Horses.
Shah Alam: Holiday Inn Glenmarie, The Saujana, all hotels within the Shah Alam area.
Putrajaya & KLIA: Putrajaya Shangrila, Putrajaya Marriott, Cyber view Lodge, Equatorial Bangi, Pan Pacific KLIA, Concorde Inn KLIA.
A moderate amount of walking is involved; comfortable walking shoes and a hat are recommended.
Please note that entrance fees to theme parks are not included and are payable on the day of travel; total fee is approximately US$40 to US$50.
Passengers below 21 years old are not allowed into the casino; a collared shirt must be worn for the casino.

Kindly be informed that Genting Theme Park and some of the rides located in First World Indoor Theme Park will be closed until the end of 2016. Rio Float, Reindeer Cruiser, Mini Train, Busy Bugs, Circus Ride, FunLand, Genting Bowl, Snow World, Vision City and FantasyWorld Video Games Park will remain open as usual.

Packages.PackageDesc: Genting Highlands Day Tour

PackageDetails.overview: The Genting Highlands, a hill resort in Malaysia equipped with hotels, theme park and entertainment attractions, bring in millions of visitors annually to experience the chill, where the temperature can get to as low as 10 degrees Celsius! This approximately 6 hour day tour will take you up to the cool, crisp mountain air about 6000 feet (1.8288 kilometers) above sea level. Join this tour with your family and friends to create fantastic experience and have fun at the theme parks! (Note: Cable Car service not operational from 4th Apr-7th Apr 2016 due to maintenance service. Transport will be provided to Genting Highlands Hotel).

highlights.highlightItem: 6-hour excursion to Genting Highland resort.
Play in the snow, bowl, and visit the resort's exciting attractions.
See an important Buddhist shrine.
Ride a cable car to the summit.
Ideal choice for families.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: A scenic drive through the hillsides from the Kuala Lumpur city center to Genting Highlands will take approximately 60 minutes, and depending on the traffic condition.

Upon arrival at the bottom of the theme park, you will stop at cable car station and take a skyway cable car ride up to the summit of Genting. (Note: Cable car close due to maintenance service.Transport will be provided until Genting Highlands Hotel).
You will visit to Genting Bowl which is located at First World Hotel and has 28-lane for you and your family to enjoy a game of bowling. The glow in the dark bowling is operating from 6pm daily.

On the way to the peak of Genting Highlands, a must see heritage site - the Chin Swee Cave Temple. The temple was constructed over 18 years with a foundation dug from solid bedrock, modern machinery was eschewed because of steep terrain.

Experience snow and chill in Snow World, the biggest winter wonderland in Malaysia. The temperature is around -6 degree celsius, and it is a fun place for snow. There is a slide inside where you can ride in the float and then slide down. It is a good experience for you to have taste of how the others who are living in the winter season. The jacket, gloves and boots are provided by the staff.

Ripley's Believe It or Not! is a chain museum worldwide, showcases more than 500 exhibits from the astounding collection of oddities by Ripley. Most of them are recreations but some of the items are the original stuff. It will take approximately 45-60 minutes for you to completely walk throughout the whole museum.

For an equally unforgettable experience, you will walk through the gates of the Haunted Adventure. The staff wearing bizarre outfit will scare you to death at the ticket counter, and definitely not for the faint-hearted! This 10-minute walk in darkness is filled with unexpected surprise, sounds and figures. Recommend this for group of friends who are looking for a little evening excitement!

exclusion.item: All theme parks, shows and exhibition center entrance fees.

Operates in all weather conditions, please dress appropriately Infant free of charge, no seat.
Minimum 2 adults.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary Pahang is Malaysia Premier Elephant Conservation Center. Nature and wildlife lovers now have the opportunity to get up close with these big animals and directly contribute to the course of Elephant Conservation in Malaysia. Join this 1 day Tour which conveniently starts from Kuala Lumpur.

highlights.highlightItem: Small-group tour of Kuala Gandah Elephant Conservation Centre.
Learn how rangers rehabilitate and relocate wild Asian elephants.
Stop by Batu Caves to explore the Hindu shrines Enjoy a picnic lunch and fruit tasting.
Travel by minibus, round-trip from KL hotels.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary is Malaysia premier Elephant Conservation Center and easily accessible for nature lovers. Visitors are allowed to come into close contact with one of the world’s most majestic creatures. Situated approximately two hours from Kuala Lumpur city center. The early history was set up by Malaysian Wildlife Society, it is the base of operations of the Department Of Wildlife and National Parks Elephant Relocation Team, which assists in the capture and relocation of rogue elephants from across Southeast Asia.

Departing at 9am, our first stop out of the city is at the iconic Batu Caves in Gombak. An important place of worship for Hindu devotees in Malaysia, this natural attraction is made up of a series of limestone caves said to be more than 400 million years old. The towering golden statue of Lord Muruga is regarded as the tallest statue of a Hindu deity in Malaysia. Guarding the entrance of the main cave it glints ethereally against the cloudy sky. Two cave temples called Art Gallery Cave and Museum Cave are also contained in the main complex, as well as a Tamil school, several souvenir shops and vegetarian eateries.

We are then ushered into an air-conditioned audio-visual theater for a 25-minute video documentary on the National Parks Elephant Relocation Team’s conservation activities and programs. The informative presentation allows us to have a better understanding of the work conducted at the center, the duty of the team’s trained elephants and the highly hazardous responsibility of the rangers when they are out in the field conducting wild elephant relocations.

We take a five-minute walk to the elephant enclosure where five rehabilitated elephants are kept. Visitors can feed these elephants by purchasing sugar canes, bananas, and peanuts from a stall nearby. Soon after, the elephants are led towards a nearby river where they are groomed and bathed by professional handlers. For an additional charge, visitors can experience the thrill of bathing with the elephants, all under watchful eyes and careful supervision.

The Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary Tour is a great way to escape the hustle and bustle of Kuala Lumpur city, get back in touch with nature, as well as discover the important roles that the elephant sanctuary play in ensuring the survival and well being of these majestic animals.

inclusion.item: Pick-up and drop off in Kuala Lumpur.
Air-Conditioned Vehicle with Driver/Guide - English Speaking.
Picnic Lunch, Fruit Tasting, Drinking Bottle Water.

exclusion.item: Pick Up and Drop Off outside KL area (additional cost subject to distance from KL City).

Tour will proceed even when it is raining.

No Elephant Rides allowed except feeding and bathing.
A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.

PackageDetails.overview: Join the 90-minute Cherating Mangrove Cruise and experience the amazing wildlife of Cherating River. We have cruises leaving in the morning or evening.

highlights.highlightItem: Choice of morning or afternoon departure.
Close encounter with wildlife.
See native wildlife in their natural environment.
Family friendly.
Ideal choice for families.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Come and join us to cruise along the Cherating River with your family and kids. Cruising Cherating River is a quiet and pleasant way to enjoy Cherating. Before the river cruise, a short safety briefing will be provided, and then our knowledgeable guide will point out interesting flora and fauna to you along the way. You should get to see mangrove trees, lizards, snakes, birds and monkeys. After the cruise, you will be returned to the same departure point.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Day Tour to Elephant Orphanage Sanctuary

PackageDetails.overview: Join this private day tour to the elephant orphanage sanctuary to bath a wild elephant and spend some value time with the biggest animal of the jungle. The tour to Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary is a fantastic experience away from the busy city of Kuala Lumpur.

highlights.highlightItem: Full-day, private tour to an elephant sanctuary from Kuala Lumpur.
Visit the Batu Caves.
Meet and feed orphaned elephants.
Learn about elephant conservation
Private tour is operated with just your party and a guide/driver

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: You will be picked up from your hotel in Kuala Lumpur at 9am and we will head to Kuala Gandah, Pahang. The 2 hour drive from Kuala Lumpur will pass by the iconic Batu Caves in Gombak.

Batu Caves is a massive limestone outcrop, its interiors are home to a Hindu shrine lined with different deities. The shrine itself is located deep inside the high caverns which take 272 steps to reach. You will stop for 30 minutes for opportunity to take photo and you can also see many monkey in the main complex.

Along the journey, you will see some village homes, winding roads and some stalls selling local fruits. We will stop for lunch at 12pm before enter the Kuala Gandah Elephant Sanctuary. You will take 5 minute walk to the elephant inclusion where five rehabilitated elephants are kept for visitors to feed.

You can buy some fruits such as bananas, sugar canes, and peanuts from a stall nearby to feed them. After that, the elephants are led towards a nearby river where they are trained and bathed by a professional handlers. There is an additional charge of RM30 if you would like to experience the thrill of bathing with the elephant.

Finally, you'll be enjoying 20-minute elephant show put on by the dedicated staff of the National Parks Elephant Relocation team. You’ll travel back to your Kuala Lumpur hotel in the air-conditioned private vehicle with some amazing experience that you will remember for your life time.

inclusion.item: Drinking bottle water and local fruit tasting.

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy a comfortable and convenient private transfer from Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) to Cameron Highlands. Your English speaking driver will greet you at the airport and brief you on the journey before taking you off on your way. Commentary about Malaysian history will be provided along the ride.

highlights.highlightItem: Choice of morning or afternoon departure.
Family friendly.
Flexibility to customize your itinerary to your own preferences.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Upon arrival, you will be briefed about the route, track conditions, weather and safety of the journey by a professional English speaking driver before depart to Cameron Highlands. Furthermore, the professional English speaking driver will share with you some history and explanation on the area along the ride.
The ride will starts at North South Highway until you reach Tapah. You will then exit to Trunk Road before ascending through a 45 minutes scenic Tropical Rain Forest Road.
You will pass by Ringlet, Tanah Rata and Brinchang Town, most interesting tourist towns. You can choose to stop at these locations for a break or complete the transfer here.
The entire transfer will take around 4.5-5.5 hours depending on traffic condition and your preferable stop destination.

Packages.PackageDesc: Taman Negara Rainforest Day Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Take a trip to the oldest tropical rainforest in the world, Taman Negara National park on this small group tour. This is a world renowned National Park and is easily accessible from Kuala Lumpur in a day.

highlights.highlightItem: Day trip to Taman Negara National Park from Kuala Lumpur.
Hike a rainforest path and take a canopy walk.
Enjoy lunch and Malaysian tea.
Hotel pickup and drop-off by air-conditioned minivan included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Take a trip to the oldest tropical rainforest in the world, Taman Negara National park. This is a world renowned National Park and is easily accessible from Kuala Lumpur in a day.

We start with an early morning pick-up at your hotel at 6am and it takes approximately 3 hours to get to Taman Negara National Park. It is a scenic drive through the countryside to the National Park. On the way you will see typical Kampung houses and row after row of Oil Palm Plantations. We visit the Gateway Town to Taman Negara National Park, Kampung Kuala Tahan to have a break and drink by the riverside.

We then cross the river by water taxi to the Taman Negara Resort, a 20 minute trek through the jungle takes us to Teresek Hill with far reaching views this is a fantastic viewpoint. You will then do the amazing Canopy Walk which is a highlight for anyone coming to the National Park.

A local sumptuous Kampung lunch is then served at a Riverside Restaurant. After a relaxing lunch and rest we take a longboat ride to enjoy Rapid Shooting to Trenggan. In the later afternoon we head back to Kuala Lumpur. If time permits we will stop off at Batu Caves on the way. This tour includes lunch, fruit tasting and a typical Malaysian tea break.

inclusion.item: Lunch, afternoon tea and bottled water.

Packages.PackageDesc: Turtle Watching at Night in Cherating

PackageDetails.overview: Be mesmerized by the sight of sea turtles lumbering slowly up the white sandy beaches of Cherating to lay eggs. Known to swim great distances, these gentle creatures have chosen beaches near Cherating to come ashore in droves to lay eggs. This is an amazing experience that can be experienced only from May to September, so don't miss it!

highlights.highlightItem: Popular choice with kids.
See native wildlife in their natural environment.
Close encounter with wildlife.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Experience a yearly affair of the sea-faring turtle’s return on the beaches to lay their eggs with us. These nesting grounds are monitored by the Malaysian Fishery Department with rules and regulations, and best periods witness this is from May to September, especially during the high tide. We'll try our best to find turtles, but nature works on its own terms and there is no guarantee of turtle sightings.

Green turtles may grow over one meter in carapace length and weigh between 308-573 pound (140 - 260 kg) . The green turtle is usually olive-brown in colour, it is named for the colour of its fat. The English name is Green Turtle, the scientific one is Chelonia mydas and the Malay Name is Penyu Agar.

Habitat and Ecology of Green Turtles : They are almost exclusively vegetarian and feed on algae, sea grasses and sometimes on sponge. In Malaysia, green turtles nest on sandy beaches of the coast and offshore islands of Peninsular Malaysia, Sabah and Sarawak.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Kota Bharu Full-Day City Tour with Lunch.

PackageDetails.overview: Experience everything that Kota Bharu has to offer on this private day tour. With hotel pickup, transportation, and lunch included, this all-inclusive tour will ensure you see the best of Kota Bharu and its culture.

highlights.highlightItem: Private tour of Kota Bharu.
Sightsee in the city’s cultural zone with stops at museums and memorials.
Visit a batik factory to see how traditional textiles are made.
Admire one of the largest reclining Buddhas at WatPhothivihan.
Practice bargaining skills at Pasar Besar Siti Khadijah.
Learn about the Kelantanese culture with personalized commentary from a private guide.
Enjoy lunch and private hotel transport.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This tour starts with exploring Kota Bharu town and experiencing the unique lifestyles of Kelantanese folk across all generations. See the contrast of the city where the old and newer developing buildings continue to coexist within the city. Next is a visit to the Kota Bharu cultural zone, located in the heart of Kota Bharu Town. This area is the home to many historic buildings and is a major tourist attraction. Here you can visit the War Memorial (Bank Kerapu), Royal Custom Museum, Stone Museum and Old Palace.

Next on this tour is kite-making and we can see how a traditional Malaysian ‘WauBulan’ moon kite is made. To produce it, a lot of patience and skill is required. On the way back to Kota Bharu, we will reach Batik and Songket Factory. Learn how the wonderful traditional textile, songket, is made.

Continuing on we will be stopping by the fishing village. Another highlight of this tour is to watch how fishermen are still using traditional and modern methods to catch fish. See how this community lives in peace and harmony in this tight-knit village where everyone always looks after one another. Proceed to ‘WatPhothivihan’ the longest lying Buddha in Southeast Asia measuring 44 meters (144.357 feet) long, 11 meters (36.0892 feet) high, and 9 meters (29.5276 feet) wide, one of the largest reclining Buddha statues in Southern Asia. You will also learn about a Malaysian Thai village with a population of about 200 people.

Finally, a stop at Central Market (PasarBesarSitiKhadijah), which is managed by energetic traders and is the largest market in town. It’s all here, from produce and local cuisine to handicrafts. One must have strong bargaining skills to get the things cheaper. Proceed to the Cultural Centre and we'll take a look inside Malay Culture and local pastime games. After this visit you will be taken back to your hotel safely.

inclusion.item: Guaranteed to skip the long lines.
Private tour with driver and local guide.

Packages.PackageDesc: 3-Day Formula 1 Malaysian Grand Prix Experience in Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: The hottest race is back in town! Travel to magnificent Malaysia to see one of the hottest races of the 2016 Formula 1 season, the Malaysian Grand Prix. The Malaysia Grand Prix takes place at the Sepang International Circuit, an incredible stadium track that allows you to see almost half of the circuit’s action from any given seating position!

highlights.highlightItem: 3-day Formula One experience in Kuala Lumpur.
Enjoy the trip hassle-free.
Accommodation, tickets and some transport included.
Explore the city at your own pace.
Once in a lifetime experience.

Your K1 Grandstand ticket overlooks the first 2 corners, which is a tight right hand-turn, followed by an immediate left. You will also be able to view the main straight and start to finish line. Your seats are accessed from the Sepang Circuit Welcome Centre.

Packages.PackageDesc: Amazing Night Tour with Tickets to Petronas Twin Tower Observation Deck

PackageDetails.overview: Join this 4-hour Kuala Lumpur tour visit to the dazzling Petronas Twin Towers and explore China Town night bazaar for an unforgettable shopping experience. A quick stop at the Merdeka Square for photography and enjoy a delicious dinner at the local restaurant -Saloma, accompanied by lovely music and stunning cultural dance performance.

highlights.highlightItem: Skip the line.
See the sights illuminated at night.
Enjoy fantastic aerial views.
Enjoy a romantic night including dinner.
Private tour is operated with just your party and a guide/driver.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This fascinating journey begins with a hotel pick up in KL city area and head to an iconic landmarks of Kuala Lumpur – the Petronas Twin Towers. Feel the time freeze all around you, as you gaze down from the height of 1,483 feet (452 meters) at the city of Kuala Lumpur stretched underneath your feet. Don’t forget to take some photos of the night city from the famous Sky Bridge, floating above ground like a magnificent star-ship.

Next, we will move to Chinatown night bazaar for shopping and you will find mixed of old Chinese shops in the narrow streets selling shoes, clothing, gadgets, spices and traditional Chinese dishes. Chinatown offers its visitors a possibility to visit the finest examples of Hindu temples that can be found in Kuala Lumpur – the magnificent Sri Mahamariamman temple and the Chan See Shu Yuen temple among others.

After shopping at Chinatown, you will be taken to the Merdeka Square to enjoy the breathtaking views of illuminated night city.  Being one of the biggest attractions in Kuala Lumpur, the Merdeka Square is an eclectic synergy of modern architectural designs and classic colonial masterpieces. The 200-meter padang (a green field) for years has retained its status as the largest stretch of greenery that can be found in Kuala Lumpur. Capture unforgettable moments on camera as you pass by the majestic buildings of the Royal Selangor Club and St. Mary’s Church.

Enjoy a delicious dinner at one of the most iconic restaurants in Kuala Lumpur, Saloma Theatre Restaurant offers a wide range of traditional Malaysian dishes, followed by a stunning cultural dance performance. A 1-hour show performed by 18 Saloma dancers will not leave anyone indifferent. Don’t forget to try the delicious Malay kampong-style dishes served tiffin style, and the mouth-watering Nasi Goreng Kampung – fried rice with anchovies and loads of Malaysian spices.
Finally, you will be transferred back to your hotel, where you can relax after a night filled with joy and excitement.

inclusion.item: Petronas Twin Tower's observation deck tickets.
Professional English speaking driver and guide.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Packages.PackageDesc: Best of Kuala Lumpur City Tour Including National Museum and National Monument

PackageDetails.overview: Explore the must-see landmarks of Kuala Lumpur during this 3.5-hour guided coach sightseeing excursion. Take in the city’s colonial architecture and modern skyscrapers, as you visit the Malaysian National Museum, the National Monument, the city’s Sultan Abdul Samad Building, the National Mosque of Malaysia (Masjid Negara), King’s Palace (Istana Negara) and take some photos at the Petronas Towers. Along the way you’ll hear insightful commentary from your guide about the city’s architecture and history, and browse for Malaysian crafts at the Cocoa Boutique and Kuala Lumpur Craft Centre. Your excursion also includes round-trip transport from your hotel.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day tour of Kuala Lumpur's must-see attractions and landmarks.
Visit the National Monument, the National Museum and the Sultan Abdul Samad Building to discover the history, culture and modern civil affairs of the city.
Take memorable photos at the Petronas Twin Towers, King's Palace and the National Mosque of Malaysia.
Your friendly, knowledgeable guide will provide interesting and informative commentary about the sites you visit.
Round-trip hotel transport by comfortable, air-conditioned coach included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Discover the wealth of architectural and historical highlights of the Malaysian capital of Kuala Lumpur during this 3.5-hour sightseeing trip by air-conditioned coach. If you’re looking for an introduction to the many highlights of Kuala Lumpur, including its famous Petronas Towers, this is a great place to start.

Begin your day with hotel pickup around 8:45am, with some pickups starting before this time. The local service provider will verify your exact schedule when your booking is reconfirmed. Over the course of your ride aboard this coach bus, you’ll get a sense for the unique blend of historic colonial architecture and sleek 21st-century skyscrapers that give this Southeast Asian metropolis its one-of-a-kind charm.

Make your first stop at the world-famous Petronas Towers, certified among the tallest buildings in the world. Take a few photos of these remarkable structures, admiring their sleek, spaceship-like exterior. The Towers’ modern design serves as a marked contrast to the historic Indo-Moorish architecture that once characterized this city’s colonial period.

Head next to the Kuala Lumpur Craft Centre, where you can explore exhibits on Malaysian handicrafts and shop for items like batik (dyed cloth), intricately-carved pottery, rattan (a type of palm) using traditional motifs and a variety of baskets. You’ll also visit the Cocoa Boutique, featuring highlights from Malaysia’s rapidly growing cocoa industry, where you can shop for delicious chocolate gifts like chilli chocolates, fruit-flavoured chocolates and a variety of milk and dark chocolate treats.

Continue your excursion at the King’s Palace (Istana Negra), a sprawling complex where you can check out the intricately-designed metalwork of the compound’s gates, which display the insignia of Yang di-PertuanAgong, a former Malaysian monarch.

Proceed next to the National Monument, a sculpture celebrating the country’s fight for independence from the British government during the mid-20th century. Your coach will then drive you to the National Museum, where you can wander among the exhibits on Kuala Lumpur’s history, arts, economy and culture set inside a beautiful building that blends both modern design and traditional Malaysian techniques. The Lake Gardens within the Museum complex also offer an intriguing look at Kuala Lumpur’s plant and animal life.

Continue to the National Mosque of Malaysia (Masjid Negara), which many consider a symbol of the country’s aspirations during the heady period following independence in the 1960s. Make your last stop of the day at the Sultan Abdul Samad Building, the location of Malaysia’s Ministry of Information Communications and Culture. Following this last stop you’ll receive a drop-off back at your Kuala Lumpur hotel.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Please note that hotel pickup and drop-off service operates only for hotels within the Kuala Lumpur central city limits. If you are staying at the following hotels, please either make your own way to a hotel in central Kuala Lumpur or contact the local tour operator after booking to arrange pickup service for an additional fee (contact info will be provided on your confirmation voucher).

Greater Kuala Lumpur: Le Meridien, Hilton, Cititel, Boulevard MidValley, Pearl International, Eastin Hotel Petaling Jaya, Crystal Crown, Armada, Holiday Villa Subang, Grand Dorset Subang, Petaling Jaya Hilton, Sunway Lagoon, One World Damansara.
Sri Kembangan: Palace of the Golden Horses Shah Alam: Holiday Inn Glenmarie, The Saujana, all hotels within the Shah Alam area.
Putrajaya& KLIA: PutrajayaShangrila, Putrajaya Marriott, Cyberview Lodge, Equatorial Bangi, Pan Pacific KLIA, Concorde Inn KLIA.
A moderate amount of walking is involved; comfortable walking shoes and a hat are recommended.

Packages.PackageDesc: Dinoscovery and Aquaria KLCC Admission with Round-Trip Transfer

PackageDetails.overview: Marvel over some of the world’s most awe-inspiring creatures, both past and present, on this unique 4-hour tour of Kuala Lumpur’s Aquaria KLCC and Dinoscovery by Dinosaurs Live. First journey back to the dinosaur age and learn all about the prehistoric creatures through interactive exhibits and animatronic displays. Next, venture beneath the ocean at the huge aquarium, complete with an underwater tunnel, touch pools and piranha-feeding displays. This tour includes admission to both attractions, round-trip transfers and around four hours to explore both independently.

highlights.highlightItem: Admission to Dinoscovery by Dinosaurs Live and Aquaria KLCC.
Pretend to be a paleontologist on a scavenger hunt for dinosaur bones during Dino Quest.
Learn about the Age of Dinosaurs with more than a dozen life-size, animated displays.
Observe tiger sharks, seahorses, piranhas, otters, electric eels and more.
Visit streams, coastlines, flooded forests and open sea via numerous exhibits.
Includes round-trip hotel transport.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet your driver upon hotel pickup in the morning or afternoon and transfer to Avenue K Shopping Complex. Here, gain admission to Kuala Lumpur’s latest family attraction, Dinoscovery by Dinosaurs Live.

Travel 250 million years back in time to the Mesozoic era and learn about the Age of Dinosaurs at this interactive exhibition with more than 15 life-size animatronic dinosaurs. See how the prehistoric beasts moved and hear them roar as you learn about their habitat and the climate conditions that contributed to their extinction.

This sprawling, 13,000-square-foot (1,208-square-meter) space is packed with numerous educational and entertaining activities, suitable for the entire family. Dino fans can watch a short documentary in the 3D cinema, climb a 16-foot (5-meter) wall to peek into a pteranodon’s nest, or be a paleontologist searching for unique specimens like a triceratops’ footprint during a scavenger hunt called Dino Quest.

Next, depart to Aquaria KLCC for the ocean discovery portion of your tour, where you can explore the mysteries of the sea without having to leave the city. Lovers of aquatic life will enjoy a visit to this gigantic aquarium, situated in the basement of the Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre.

Reputed to be one of the largest aquariums in the world, Aquaria KLCC covers more than 5,000 square feet (465 square meters) and showcases nearly 150 species of fish from various parts of the world. The highlight of Aquaria is a 295-foot-long (90-meter) transparent underwater tunnel that you can walk through.

Delight in watching sand tiger sharks, 6.5-foot-long (2-meter) arapaimas, coral fish, seahorses and many more. See piranhas, otters and other sea creatures hand-fed daily at a feeding show. Other attractions include snakes, geckos and poisonous dart frogs. (See complete exhibit list under Itinerary below).
When your time is up, your driver will meet you and transfer you back to your hotel.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Rocky Shore Touch Pool: Observe and feel a sea cucumber, horseshoe crab, gentle bamboo shark and more.
Electric Zone: Learn how animals like the electric eel, electric catfish and elephant-nose fish defend themselves by discharging electricity.
Streams: Visit jungle streams, home to land and aquatic animals such as alligator snapping turtles and Asian small-clawed otters.
Flooded Forest: Be greeted by the radiant glow of thousands of silvery scales of fish swirling within a tubular tank.
Coast: Discover how a mixture of freshwater and saltwater in estuaries provides many nutrients for marine life.
Oceanarium: The vastness of the open sea and the entrancing rhythm of life there are re-created here with giant stingrays, green sea turtles and more.
Weird & Wonderful: Walk into the darkness to see delicate and mysterious marine creatures like sea jellies and seahorses.
Glass-Bottom Boat: Take a seat on a simulated boat deck of the Explorer II and discover the wonders that can be seen at ocean reefs.

Packages.PackageDesc: Eat Like a Local: Kuala Lumpur Hawker Center and Street Food Tour by Night

PackageDetails.overview: Get a taste of Malaysia’s finest foods on this guided, 3- to 4-hour, small-group walking and riding tour around Kuala Lumpur. Stop by three or more street vendors and hidden-gem restaurants off-the-beaten path to sample the best Malaysian cuisine. Learn about Malaysian customs and culture and visit food spots like mamak stalls and round-the-clock hawker centers (open-air food courts). All food tastings, including beverages, and any necessary transportation are included.

highlights.highlightItem: 3- to 4- hour food tour in Kuala Lumpur.
Experience KL's lively food culture at one or two of its popular hawker centres.
Sample street food from local food stalls and discover hidden gems with an expert guide.
Learn about Malaysian customs as you meet friendly locals Try Malaysian delicacies from at least three different vendors/restaurants – and feast on as much as you can eat!
Enjoy air-conditioned transport between all food stops.
Small-group tour limited to 4 people ensures a personalized experience with your guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet the guide and the rest of the small group at the Taman Paramount Light Rail Transit (LRT) station in Petaling Jaya. Hop aboard a comfortable, air-conditioned vehicle for a quick trip to a Kuala Lumpur neighbourhood of the guide’s choosing to begin this evening food tour.

One possibility would be the Bangsar area, boasting a wide variety of food spots like mamak stalls with traditional Tamil-Muslim cuisine, plus South Indian banana-leaf restaurants and Malay warungs, or small, family-owned restaurants offering both local and Western food.

Also, visit some of the food stalls in a round-the-clock hawker center (an open-air food court) in Petaling Jaya, or head to Brickfields to see some of their South Indian restaurants and Chinese coffee shops serving traditional Chinese fare like dim sum.

Allow the knowledgeable guide to make the selections of local favourites. Try dishes like nasilemak (coconut rice with chili paste, anchovies, peanuts and vegetables; stir-fried Chinese noodles; Indian breads with chicken, fish and mutton curry; desserts like ondehondeh (rice balls with palm sugar and coconut shavings).

inclusion.item: Round-trip transport between original meeting point and tour location.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Please advise any specific dietary requirements at time of booking.
A minimum of 2 people and a maximum of 4 per booking is required.
Please note that this food tour is a non-halal tour.

Packages.PackageDesc: Experience Malaysia: Authentic Malaysia Cooking Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Experience the best of Malaysian cuisine on this 6-hour Malaysian cooking tour in Penang. Browse the stalls at a food market in the fishing village of TelukBahang with your guide. As you explore, admire the fresh fruit, seafood and vegetables on display and learn how different ingredients are used in Malaysian cooking. Discover tropical spices and herbs at Penang’s Tropical Spice Garden, and gain insight into Malaysia’s spice-trading history. Afterward, roll up your sleeves and prepare some of the country’s favourite dishes yourself during a hands-on cooking lesson.

highlights.highlightItem: 6-hour Malaysian cooking class in Penang.
Search for fresh ingredients at the market in Teluk Bahang.
Learn the art of Malaysian cuisine with an expert chef.
Discover the many culinary influences of traditional dishes.
Cook a delicious lunch in the Tropical Spice Garden.
Hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Small-group class limited to 8 ensures a personalized experience.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Experience the diversity of Malaysian cuisine as you learn to prepare traditional dishes, using rich flavours and spices from a fusion of cultures, including Malay, Chinese and Indian. After hotel pickup by minivan, travel with your guide and small group to TelukBahang, a friendly fishing village located on the north-western tip of Penang Island. Meaning 'Heat Wave Bay,' its name refers to the high temperature of the sea breeze that flows onto shore.

Visit the local market where villagers seek the day’s fresh ingredients each morning, such as fish, vegetables, dry goods and fresh cuts of meat. Around the corner you’ll find stalls selling fresh fruit to complete the nutritional needs of many households living within the area. Your guide will enlighten you about the secrets to Malaysian cuisine and its varied dishes that appeal to a wide range of palates.

Then head to Penang’s Tropical Spice Garden and explore the spice terraces with your guide. View more than 100 varieties of tropical spices and herbs used in flavourings as well as medicines and dyes, and retrace the historical route of the spice trade. At the cooking school, located on sloping land within the garden's natural setting, join expert local chefs and learn how to cook several authentic Malaysian dishes.

During this hands-on lesson, your small group prepares your own meal from scratch, using traditional mortars and pestles to grind fresh spices and herbs like lemongrass, ginger, curry leaves, garlic and shallots — all harvested straight from the garden! Learn about their culinary features from your instructors, who make Malaysian cooking a fun and unforgettable experience. Afterward, enjoy your yummy lunch with your fellow cooking enthusiasts before returning by minivan to your hotel.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

Packages.PackageDesc: Full-Day Kuala Lumpur City Tour including Petronas Towers and Batu Caves

PackageDetails.overview: Explore and admire the beauty of several iconic buildings that represent Kuala Lumpur on this fantastic full-day tour. Ascend the world renowned Petronas Twin Towers and walk on the tallest skybridge in the world, climb 272 stairs at Batu Caves to seek 'enlightenment', buy souvenirs from Central Market, enjoy a nice photo session at National Monument, and visit the King Palace and Independent Square to finish a memorable day.

highlights.highlightItem: Full day tour of Kuala Lumpur's highlights.
Visit Petronas Towers, the Batu Caves and city landmarks.
Capture unforgettable images of a colorful city.
Learn about Malaysia's history and culture.
Great overview of the city, perfect for first-time visitors.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: After being picked up from your hotel, your driver/guide will show you the charms of the Malaysian capital that are only known to the locals. You’ll have photo stops at King’s Palace, Independence Square, and at the famous Petronas Twin Towers!
Head up to the observation deck of the Twin Towers with your admission ticket, where a guide will provide a briefing about the structure before you take in the spectacular city views.
On the tour you’ll see the National Monument, the National Mosque, and the Old Railway Station. Also enjoy a visit to Batu Caves, home to the world’s tallest statue of Lord Murugan!

Rising nearly 100 meters above ground, the Batu Caves temple complex comprises 3 main caves and a few smaller ones. The largest, referred to as Cathedral Cave or Temple Cave, has a very high ceiling and features an ornate Hindu shrine. To reach the shrine, you’ll need to climb a steep flight of 272 steps.
After visiting the Batu Caves you’ll stop at a pewter art centre, where you’ll have the opportunity to browse for gifts before we take you back to your hotel/chosen drop-off point.

inclusion.item: Guaranteed to skip the long lines.
Entrance tickets to Petronas Twin Tower's observation desk and sky bridge.
All taxes, fees and handling charges.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Child rate applies only when sharing with 2 paying adults.
Infant rates apply provided they do not occupy a seat.
The duration of tour is approximately 8 hours, the exact duration will depend on the time of day and traffic conditions.

Packages.PackageDesc: Half-Day Kuala Lumpur City Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy this wonderful half-day city tour that will give you approximately 4 hours of sightseeing around the fascinating city of Kuala Lumpur. Landmarks you will get to see include the National Monument, the King's Palace, the National Mosque and more! A great way to learn your way around the city and see some of the key attractions in a safe and exciting environment!

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day tour of Kuala Lumpur.
See the city's most important sites.
Visit Petronas Twin Towers and KL Tower.
Tour colonial-era buildings.
Great overview and orientation of the city.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Comprehensive tour by bus/coach.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will begin with a pickup from you hotel lobby. From here you will be taken away in a fully air-conditioned vehicle to see the sites of Kuala Lumpur. Begin by visiting the National Monument that has exhibits of local history, culture and traditions, arts and crafts and a great bronze sculpture erected to commemorate the soldiers who lost their lives during World War II and the Emergency.

You will then make a quick photo-stop at the gate of the King's Palace. From here, you'll proceed to visit the Moorish-style railway station building and the National Mosque, before finally arriving at the imposing Kuala Lumpur Tower. It is the highest tower in Asia and the fourth tallest telecommunications tower in the world.

A drive past the elegant Jamek Mosque, the impressive House of Parliament and the world’s tallest twin towers, the Petronas Twin Towers is also a must. It has all the ingredients to hold the most avid travellers in amazement. Finally, you will be dropped back to your hotel.

PackageDetails.overview: For our discerned travellers, Kuala Lumpur offers plenty of options that cater to those who enjoy traveling in style and comfort. You can now hire for half a day, your own Mercedes Benz S Class with chauffeur inside Kuala Lumpur city centre – whether you wish to see some sights in the capital, go shopping at one of the many high end department stores or seek out a means to arrive with a sense of flair. This distinguished option will certainly add class to your stay and make an impression wherever you arrive.

highlights.highlightItem: Family friendly.
