In collaboration with your chauffeur, you have the chance to become extremely flexible to go where you please within the city limits. This luxury option of transportation will not only save you time when in need to tailor your own itinerary; this option skips all waiting times for taxis or looking for the subway, which can be a hassle during rush traffic hours.

The options are vast; swiftly travel from shopping mall to department store, head to Chinatown or getting all the time in the world for taking that perfect shot of the PETRONAS Towers before making a stop at the famed Batu Caves. After exploring Kuala Lumpur, your chauffeur safely brings you back to your hotel (Kuala Lumpur City centre only; Kuala Lumpur International Airport and accommodation outside the city centres are not included) where you can look back at a quality experience, all done at your own pace.

Packages.PackageDesc: Half-Day Private Kuala Lumpur City Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Planning a vacation can be overwhelming—especially with hundreds of Kuala Lumpur scattered around the internet. Shopping around to find the most exciting activities and best deals can take a lot of time. Join this half-day private tour to explore some local attractions in Kuala Lumpur, such as Art Museum, Istana Negara (Gates of the King Palace), National Monument (War Memorial) and much more. There are two departure options: the morning departure at 9am and afternoon tour start at 2pm. The vehicle will stops at the main hotel’s lobby to pick you up.

highlights.highlightItem: Private guide for a more personalized experience.
Great overview and orientation of the city.
Choice of morning or afternoon departure.
Led by a local guide.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Join this half-day private tour to experience the local lifestyle, culture and learn some history in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Chinatown, Kuala Lumpur is the oldest Chinese settlement in Kuala Lumpur. Divided by three parallel streets, Chinatown is well known for street food, daily wears and places of worship. Brickfields are the oldest Indian settlement in Kuala Lumpur and even though it is occupied by local Indians, Hinduism is not the only religion being practiced in this settlement. Ideal location for almost everything Indian.

Istana Negara (Gates of The Kings Palace), the official residence of the ruler of Malaysia. Officiated in 2011, this is a good spot for a photograph with the royal guards and mounted guards. National Monument (War Memorial): A wonderful site to commemorate fallen heroes from the First World War, Second World War and the Emergency Period. View the spectacular 15 metre bronzed monument made by Felix de Weldon.

Perdana Botanical Garden which designed by Alfred Vennings, this gardens now serve as the `Green Lung` of the city. Lovely area to drive or walk through to see the Butterfly Farm, Bird Park, Orchid Garden, Hibiscus Garden and many more interesting sites.

Masjid Negara (National Mosque), officiated in1965, this mosque can accommodate fifteen thousand (15,000) worshipers at any one time. Visit to this mosque is determined by the official time of visit by the mosque authority.

Railway Station and Administration Building (Old Railway Station) was built in 1911 by A.B. Hubback, this building is an architectural wonder of its time. This building and its surroundings will surely transport one back in time.
Independence Square (Merdeka Square) where Sultan Abdul Samad Building, Royal Selangor Club and St. Mary's Cathedral makes up the square.

Visit JadiBatek Gallery (Batik Handicraft centre) to see how a blank piece of cloth is transformed into a masterpiece through the `chanting` process in the hands of a master. Batik is a traditional and official garment of Malaysia. You will also explore the Cocoa Boutique (Chocolate Boutique) where Malaysian chocolate is high quality and comes in many varieties. From chocolate with strawberries, coconut, hazel nut and ginseng, just to name a few.
After complete above sights our guide will drop you at your staying hotel in Kuala Lumpur safely. Please note the hotel pickup and drop-off in Kuala Lumpur city area only.

inclusion.item: Hotel pickup and drop-off in Kuala Lumpur city area only.

Packages.PackageDesc: Half-Day Shopping and Market Exploration Tour in Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Join this half-day tour lead by a professional English speaking guide and get ready to immerse yourself into the bustling life of Kuala Lumpur’s, the biggest markets with streets filled with various vendors, restaurants and shops. Buy cheap Malaysian, Chinese and Indian food and browse through some high-quality goods sold by locals.

highlights.highlightItem: Choice of morning or afternoon departure.
Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Get inside tips from a local Flexibility to customize your itinerary to your own preferences.
Family friendly.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This half-day tour will start shopping and wandering the streets of Chinatown, there’s so much to see and eat. The alleys are packed with food stalls selling a wide range of traditional and local food and goods with relatively cheap. There’s always some sort of bargain and once can master the art of haggling for good deals.

Your trip continues to Brickfields – Little India, one of the oldest settlements in the country. This area is very beautiful as the streets are so colourful and full of Indian shops. You can literally get almost every Indian product here such as Saris, flower garlands, specific and delicious Dosa.

After tasting and shopping at Little India, we will move to Central Market (PasarSeni), another indoor bazaar not far from Chinatown. The place is spacious and offer variety of food, carpets and stones. You will definitely find some good souvenirs and traditional Malaysian stuff here. It is nice to walk around and take in the local ambience.
After the tour, you will be transported back to your hotel in an air-conditioned vehicle.

Packages.PackageDesc: Hit Musical Show MUD: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur Ticket including One-Way Transfer

PackageDetails.overview: A vibrant cultural musical of the history of Kuala Lumpur. Enjoy and experience the theatrical magic, a breath taking sensory feast, and deep in the heart of it: a Malaysian story with a strong emotional connection to the people of yesterday, today, and tomorrow. During a moving 1-hour performance, the excellent cast recounts the story of this major Southeast Asian capital city that started from humble beginnings and has become modern day giant. Price includes admission to the musical and 1-way hotel pickup.

highlights.highlightItem: Admission and one-way transfer to a Kuala Lumpur musical.
Experience Malaysia's history through song and dance.
See a show in a historic theatre.
Learn about local culture.
Family friendly.
Hotel pickup included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: It all began from 1857 until the mining boom of 1880. The glint of tin promised riches and attracted an influx of pioneers from across the Asian region to the muddy junction of the two rivers, Sungai Lumpur (now Sungai Gombak) and Sungai Kelang.

‘MUD: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur’ tells a tale of three young men who made the journey from their village to a small tin mining town to seek their fortune. This heartwarming story is set against historical events of early Kuala Lumpur and weaves through the lives of Mamat, Meng, and Muthiah. Follow their trials and tribulations as they rise above the constant challenges of their new home, signaling the unwavering spirit of our forefathers. The show promises to be a colourful and entertaining multi-cultural experience for all – a lively musical showcasing the rich diversity of the people who built Kuala Lumpur. An inspiring tale of friendship, perseverance and finding joys in a simple cup of teh tarik.

Choose either an afternoon or evening show of MUD: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur at the city’s oldest theater, the PanggungBandaraya. As you leave the air-conditioned theater, note its 16th-century Mughal Empire-inspired architecture. Make your own way back to hotel or alternatively, you can continue to explore on your own.
MUD: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur is a story of achievement, hope, heart, commitment, friendship, strength, and survival, of its people and the city.

inclusion.item: Show ticket for 'Mud: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur' musical.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Shore Excursion: Private Kuala Lumpur City Sightseeing Tour

PackageDetails.overview: See all of the sites while in port on this Kuala Lumpur private shore excursion city sightseeing tour. This full-day experience offers travelers a unique look at the capital of Malaysia, including landmarks, history, culture and food. Enjoy the convenience of private transport to place like the National Mosque, Petronas Twin Towers and King’s Palace. Explore the halls of the National Museum with your private guide who will offer insight and information about all of the artifacts on display. Learn about pewter artwork at the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre and enjoy a traditional lunch all as part of this incredible tour.

highlights.highlightItem: Private Kuala Lumpur shore excursion with full-day sightseeing tour.
Drive round-trip from Port Klang to the capital city with a private and professional guide.
View Malaysian artifacts on display at the National Museum.
Stop for photos of Independence Square, the King's Palace and Petronas Twin Towers, and admire the architecture of the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.
Enjoy a Malaysian lunch at a local restaurant.
Port pickup and drop-off by private vehicle included Covered by Viator's worry-free policy: guaranteed on-time return to your ship.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: When your cruise ship docks prepare for adventure with this private Kuala Lumpur City Sightseeing Tour. Your friendly local guide will collect you from the cruise terminal and transport you in the comfort of a private vehicle through some of the capital city’s most incredible sights.

You’ll have the chance to take photos as a number of buildings that highlight Kuala Lumpur’s unique architectural heritage and Indo-Moorish design, as well as the King Palace and famed Independence Square. Learn how the Malay flag was raised here for the first time in 1957 and see the famed 88-story Petronas Twin Towers as part of this stop.

Follow your guide through the halls of the National Museum, where the history, culture and traditions of this diverse nation come to life. Your guide will share insights and information about the costumes, weapons, instruments and other artifacts that are on display here. Your tour also goes past the Lake Gardens and the National Monument. At the latter, you’ll hear how Malaysia fought for independence in World War II and admire the architecture of the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.

Make a stop at the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre to learn about the art of pewter-smithing. With your free time you can explore the malls and shops before savoring a typical Malaysian lunch and returning to your cruise port.

Worry-free Shore Excursion: We will ensure your timely return to Port Klang for this activity. In the rare event your ship has departed, we will arrange for transportation to the next port-of-call. If your ship is delayed and you are unable to attend this activity, your money will be refunded. See our terms and conditions for full details.

Packages.PackageDesc: KL Tower Observation Deck Admission Ticket

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy sweeping views over Kuala Lumpur from the KL Tower Observation Deck. The enclosed deck provides 360-degree views, and your admission ticket includes a multisensory movie experience at the XD Theater. You can also upgrade your ticket to add a stop at the Open Deck, which perches more than 1,000 feet high at the top of the tower.

highlights.highlightItem: Admission to KL Tower Observation Deck in Kuala Lumpur.
See Kuala Lumpur from one of the highest spots in the metropolitan area.
Enjoy panoramic views from the enclosed deck.
Have fun watching a multisensory movie at the XD Theater.
Upgrade for the Open Deck admission to enjoy views as far as the Genting Highlands and South China Sea.

PackageDetails.why: You'll get amazing views of Kuala Lumpur from the observation decks of this skyscraping tower. There are other attractions in the tower as well, including a rotating restaurant and a replica of a traditional Malaysian village (food and additional activities are at your own expense).

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The KL Tower (aka the Menara Kuala Lumpur) is one of the most iconic sights in Kuala Lumpur and is visible from most parts of the city. It's one of the world’s tallest telecommunications towers, a major tourist destination and a popular venue for special occasions.

The tower sits on a hill, making it appear taller than the city's famous Petronas Towers; KL Tower measures 1,381 feet (421 meters) high while the Petronas Towers measures 1,483 feet (452 meters). With your admission ticket, you may visit whenever you wish during operating hours. Perhaps go to watch the sunset and see lights come on across the sprawling city below.
When booking, choose from the following two admission options.

KL Tower Observation Deck and XD Theater: After arriving at KL Tower, take one of the high-speed elevators up to the fully enclosed Observation Deck, located 905 feet (276 meters) above ground level. The deck circles the entire tower, providing panoramic views of Kuala Lumpur.

Also included is admission to the XD Theater for a 6D-movie experience. Watch the movie while seated in a specially designed armchair that moves in sync with the film. The combination of visual and sound effects, seat movement and other features makes you feel like you're in the middle of the action on screen. There are typically about eight movies that you can watch, and each film runs for about five minutes.

KL Tower Observation Deck, XD Theater and Open Deck: Upgrade your admission to include all of the above plus a ticket to the Open Deck, which perches at the top of the tower, 1,381 feet (421 meters) above the ground. The open-air deck offers a spectacular perspective of the Kuala Lumpur skyline, with views that extend to the Genting Highlands, Pahang and South China Sea.

inclusion.item: Admission to KL Tower Observation Deck and XD Theater.
Admission to KL Tower Open Deck (if option selected).

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur By Night Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Just because the sun goes down doesn’t mean it’s time to sleep. This Kuala Lumpur by Night Tour proves just that. Experience the energy and excitement of this world-class city after dark and stroll through Chinatown and popular night markets with a local guide. Enjoy an international buffet dinner as you watch Malaysian dance performers take the stage, then choose to return to your hotel or continue through the night, dancing until the sun begins to rise.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour Kuala Lumpur night tour including dinner and show.
Stroll through the Chinatown night markets with an informative and friendly guide.
Experience Malaysian cuisine and culture with a buffet dinner and a dance performance.
Hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet your guide and driver at your hotel and enjoy a comfortable coach ride to the start of your Kuala Lumpur by Night Tour. Wind through the eclectic streets of Chinatown, where you’ll have time to comb through stalls and markets selling clothing, perfumes and other specialty goods.

Check out the glittering lights of towering skyscrapers before making your way to Saloma Restaurant, where you’ll tuck into an international buffet of tasty eats including salad, soups, Malaysian specialties and flavours from across the globe, while you watch Malaysian performers take the stage for traditional dance.
When the curtain closes, choose to be dropped at Bintang Walk, where you can wander trendy nightclubs and bars at your leisure, or return to your hotel in Kuala Lumpur.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur City Highlights Tour

PackageDetails.overview: See the best of Kuala Lumpur on this morning or afternoon city highlights tour that showcases top landmarks, attractions and sites. You'll see where Old World meets New World as you follow your guide to the King's Palace and Merdeka Square. Make stops at the National Museum, National Mosque, and other key destinations, plus learn about pewter smithing as you watch local artisans at work. This tour includes round-trip hotel transportation and guarantees a good time!

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour sightseeing tour of Kuala Lumpur's must-see attractions.
Enjoy photo opportunities at the King's Palace, Independence Square and Petronas Twin Towers — the tallest in the world.
Learn about Malaysia's history and culture on a tour of the National Museum and Thean Hou Temple with a professional guide.
Admire the elaborate structures of the National Monument, the National Mosque and the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.
Walk through the Royal Selangor Visitor Center to see flawlessly crafted pewter designs and view crafts at the Central Market.
Select a morning or afternoon tour to suit your schedule.
Includes coach pickup and drop-off at city hotels.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Perfect for first-time visitors, this three-hour tour provides a comprehensive introduction to Kuala Lumpur's famous sights, leaving you with a knowledgeable base for exploring the city at your leisure. Meet your local guide upon pickup from your city hotel in the morning or afternoon, and embark on your narrated tour by comfortable coach.

Head to multiple Kuala Lumpur attractions, making photo stops at the King's Palace — a symbol of Malaysian sovereignty — as well as Merdeka Square (aka Independence Square), which features a panorama of fascinating buildings in an array of architectural styles. Your guide offers informative commentary on the city’s growing skyline, whose ultra-modern structures tower above edifices with Indo-Moorish influence.
Gaze up at the Islamic geometric patterns on the 88-story Petronas Twin Towers, whose multifaceted walls and twin spires contain thousands of steel and glass panels.
Your journey continues with a visit to the National Museum to see historic Malaysian artifacts, from traditional weapons and costumes to modern arts and crafts and musical instruments.

Then, drive past the beautiful Lake Gardens on your way to view the National Monument, commemorating Malaysia's struggle for freedom during World War II. Nearby, admire the modern construction of the National Mosque and the pleasant combination of Eastern and Western architecture of the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.

Visit the six-tiered Chinese landmark of Thean Hou Temple, a grand structure that combines modern architectural styles with authentic traditional design. At the Central Market, browse a variety of local crafts and perhaps have your portrait sketched if time permits.

The final stop on your sightseeing tour of Kuala Lumpur is the Royal Selangor Visitor Center, where you will gain insight into pewter-smithing and see innovative pewter-ware design. Afterward, re-board your coach and end with drop-off at your hotel.

PackageDetails.overview: A must for  first time visitors to Kuala Lumpur.  An interesting tour which unveils the beauty and charm of the old and new Kuala Lumpur . See the contrast of the magnificent skyscrapers and the buildings of the former colonial days.

highlights.highlightItem: Great overview and orientation of the city.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Kuala Lumpur is a busy city with ordered skyscrapers, six-lane highways, colonial architecture and lots of greenery. Home to the Petronas Twin Towers, it is a shopping paradise with some of Southeast Asia’s largest shopping malls, housing the world’s top brands, and street markets where you can get one-of-a-kind items. For any Chocolate fan a must visit is Cocoa Boutique where their products are unique and creative. You can purchase the usual chocolates of milk, white or dark chocolates but if you want something with Malaysian touch, this is the right place to go.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Cultural and Heritage Tour

PackageDetails.overview: This tour will take you through the Heritage Trails of the early cultures in Malaysia and give you a great insight into Malaysia’s multi–cultural society. Note: Not available on Chinese New Year Festival.

highlights.highlightItem: Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Great overview and orientation of the city.
Perfect introduction for first-time visitor’s.
Family friendly.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Apart from the modern sky scrapers in town, there are quite a number of beautiful Heritage Buildings which remain from the British Colonial days that still stand strong in the city. By exploring on foot, you can see many of these buildings that are in the older areas of Kuala Lumpur. Starting at the Central Market (Art-Deco), you can walk towards Independence Square or Dataran Merdeka where the Sultan Abdul Samad Building (SAS) stands majestically and is the largest of the heritage buildings here. Opposite, the English Tudor styled Royal Selangor Club sits facing the SAS Building. Head on over to the old railway station to see a couple more of the Neo Moorish and Mughal designed buildings. In the old city area, many shop houses don the old pre-war structures where you get to see a mix of influences in designs from Grecian-Spanish, neo-Gothic, Victorian and even the American styles that range from 1880s till 1950s.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Food Tour through Chow Kit

PackageDetails.overview: Join a small group tour and venture through one of the biggest wet market to hunt for delicious local food in the district of Chow Kit, Kuala Lumpur. Be hungry for food and knowledge as your local guide will walk you through each step of the way on this food trail. Savor delicious local cuisine which the forefathers of Kuala Lumpur have kept alive as you unveil the history and heritage of Malaysia. Get ready to eat, learn and have fun!

highlights.highlightItem: 4-hour foodie tour of Chow Kit district.
Visit the bustling neighbourhood with a local guide.
Learn about Malay cuisine and culture.
Enjoy Kuala Lumpur's culinary specialties.
Small-group tour ensures a personalized experience.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your 4-hour culinary trail starts at 3.30pm. The small group members will meet the guide at Chow Kit Monorail Station, by a convenient store. You will be learning about the history of Kuala Lumpur as you venture through Chow Kit Wet Market and beautiful pre-war and colonial buildings. You will be stopping by at least 3 food outlets, tasting at least 10 varieties of local and heritage food of Kuala Lumpur.

Your informative guide is born and bred in Kuala Lumpur and loves to share and communicate. It's highly encouraged that you ask questions throughout the tour, and let the guide know if you are dietary restrictions. Your guide would like to ensure that you have a good time and nice experience. Please keep an open mind to try out new things during the culinary trail, and listen to the recommendations from your guide of the best food stalls.
Rest assured that you will be sinking in your teeth into delicious local food. Enjoy a nice, informative food trail experience and stress free day!

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Vegetarian option is available, please advise at time of booking if required.
A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.
A moderate amount of walking is involved.
Tips to enjoy Simply Enak's food tour:
BE HUNGRY, BE OPEN - Make sure you come hungry when you join the food experience and be open to foods introduced by the guide.
WEAR COMFORTABLE SHOES - The food experience tours are normally walking trails. It's advised for guests to wear comfortable shoes during the food experience.
BRING YOUR WATER BOTTLE - Water helps during the tour especially during hot weather. Its very easy to get thirsty in Malaysia.
UMBRELLA AND RAINCOAT - Malaysia's weather can be unpredictable. Please bring your own umbrella or raincoat if its raining or going to rain.
AVOID WEARING WHITE - There's nothing worse than spilling food on a white t-shirt. If you don't mind the stain, you can always wear white.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Heritage Walk

PackageDetails.overview: Join us on a spectacular walk through the historic heart of Kuala Lumpur! For anyone who wants to understand the many facets that make up Malaysia today, start with a stroll through Kuala Lumpur's oldest neighborhood. As you discover the heritage sites of the city, a tin mining settlement that has grown into a thriving metropolis, you'll also hear stories of what brought Chinese and Indian immigrants, the trades they practiced and their traditions and beliefs, many of which endure today. Sample a variety of authentic foods and see where different communities worship. Eat with locals, experience the places they live and pray and fall in love with a city and a people!

highlights.highlightItem: Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Vegetarian meal option available.
Led by a local guide.
Small-group tour.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This tour offers the perfect opportunity to learn about Kuala Lumpur’s history and culture. This tour has been designed to appeal to anyone aged 11 and over who consider themselves foodies or culture buffs.
Your day will begin at 9am at the Be Tourist Information and Service Center, Central Market Annexe.

On this tour, you will experience hearing tales of the first Chinese and Indians in Kuala Lumpur, shop at the Central Market (Pasar Seni), visit Chinatown, be inspired by the Sin Sze Si Ya Temple, marvel at the Sri Mahamariamman Temple and also be able to enjoy eating delicious authentic Malaysian food.
The tour will end at 1pm at Lebuh Ampang.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur International Airport Departure Transfer

PackageDetails.overview: Depart from Kuala Lumpur with this reliable and convenient shared transportation service. Your professional driver picks you up at your Kuala Lumpur hotel and transfers you directly to Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KUL) by air-conditioned minivan. This efficient and economical transportation makes the perfect ending to your vacation, and it operates seven days per week, 24 hours per day.

highlights.highlightItem: One-way private transfer from the Kuala Lumpur International Airport to your Kuala Lumpur city hotel.
Experienced and friendly driver.
Enjoy efficient and comfortable transportation in Kuala Lumpur.
Transfer services operate 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: At the pre-designated time, your professional driver meets you in the lobby of your Kuala Lumpur hotel. As you head out to your air-conditioned vehicle, receive assistance with your luggage and enjoy plenty of storage space for suitcases.

Avoid the hassle of finding a taxi or carrying your bags on public transport and relax as your driver safely transfers you to Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KUL). You’ll arrive with plenty of time to check in and catch your flight.

When booking, you will need to provide the details for your flight and Kuala Lumpur hotel. Within 24 hours, your transfer will be confirmed and you will be provided with a travel voucher. Simply present the transfer to the driver upon arrival. Approximately 24 - 48 hours before your departure, you must reconfirm exact pickup time and place (the local contact number will be provided on your travel voucher).

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur International Airport Plaza Premium Lounge

PackageDetails.overview: Take a break from the rigors of travel at Kuala Lumpur International Airport with a 3-, 6- or 12-hour lounge pass. Choose from the Satellite Building and/or Departure Hall in Kuala Lumpur's international terminals. Then take full advantage of the luxury facilities and VIP service. Get caught up with work at a high-speed internet workstation or in a conference room. Select from an extensive food and beverage menu. Relax and enjoy spacious sofa seating, watch a movie, get a neck and shoulder massage — even grab a quick shower, if desired.

highlights.highlightItem: Relax in the Plaza Premium Lounge at Kuala Lumpur International Airport or KLIA2 before your departure.
Choose a pass that is valid for 3, 6, or 12 hours.
Take advantage of the Plaza Premium Lounge’s luxury services.
Two locations to choose from: Kuala Lumpur International Airport or Kuala Lumpur International Airport Terminal 2 (KLIA2).

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Whether traveling via first class or economy, take a deserved break from the rigors of traveling at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport. Visit the Satellite Building in Kuala Lumpur's international terminal or the Departure Hall in KLIA2 for VIP treatment with a lounge pass good for three, six or 12 hours. Enjoy quality service, relaxation and comfort.

Relax in an impressive 7,500-square-foot lounge, complete with sofa seating,that can comfortably accommodate up to 215 passengers. The view of the runway is spectacular from here. There is also a VIP room, a full-service bar, a widely varied food and beverage menu, workstations with available Wi-Fi internet, newspapers and magazines, in-house movies, freshly brewed coffee/tea, espresso, cappuccino and more.
Also, enjoy a relaxing neck and/or shoulder massage or rejuvenate with a shower, if desired.

inclusion.item: 3, 6 or 12 hours to utilize the facilities of the lounge (depending on option selected).
Use of shower facilities (no shower facilities in KLIA2).

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

The Plaza Premium Lounge is located in the restricted area of the departure level of the airport. You must pass through security and immigration first prior to gaining access to the lounge; an on-going boarding pass MUST be presented by all passengers before entering the lounge.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur International Airport Arrival Transfer

PackageDetails.overview: Insure an easy arrival with this Kuala Lumpur International Airport Arrival Transfer. Skip the headache, hassle and expense of finding a local taxi or navigating public transportation and opt for the air-conditioned comfort of a comfortable coach. Your friendly and professional driver will meet you at the airport upon arrival and transport you to your Kuala Lumpur hotel. It’s the best—and easiest—way to kick off your Malaysian holiday or business trip. This popular arrival option is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

highlights.highlightItem: One-way shared private transfer from Kuala Lumpur International Airport or Low Cost Carrier Terminal (LCCT) to your Kuala Lumpur hotel.
Enjoy the ease of having a professional driver and door-to-door service.
Get comfortable in your deluxe minicoach with air-conditioning, generous leg room and luggage storage.
Transfers services are available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This Kuala Lumpur International Airport Arrival Transfer erases the challenges and hassles of arriving in a new and foreign city. That’s because your friendly and professional driver will be waiting for you upon arrival with a name placard and comfortable mini-coach to transport you in air-conditioned comfort to your hotel of choice in Kuala Lumpur. It’s the perfect way to skip taxi lines and avoid the stress of navigating a new land. Book in advance with your flight arrival and hotel accommodation details. Your transfer will be confirmed within 24 hours of booking and you’ll receive a voucher to present to your driver.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Nature Tour: Orchid Garden, Butterfly Park and Bird Park

PackageDetails.overview: Discover Malaysia’s vibrant wildlife even in the heart of the city on this 3.5-hour of Kuala Lumpur’s natural wonders, including hotel pick-up. Admire the vivid blooms of the Kuala Lumpur Orchid Garden; get up close to colorful butterflies at the Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park, then spot rare birds at the Kuala Lumpur Bird Park.

highlights.highlightItem: Retreat to three natural sanctuaries right in the heart of metropolitan Kuala Lumpur.
Take a guided tour of the enchanted and colourful Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park.
Discover a massive, vibrant, diverse family of orchids at the Kuala Lumpur Orchid Garden.
Spot and identify native and exotic birds at the Kuala Lumpur Bird Park.
Learn about Malaysia’s natural environments and ecosystems from your guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: You’ll be picked up from your Kuala Lumpur hotel in the morning by your friendly and knowledgeable guide and taken past the city’s busy streets to three natural sanctuaries, starting at the Kuala Lumpur Orchid Garden.

Tour the garden to see 3,000 species of orchids, 800 of which are native to Malaysia. This huge collection includes hybrid and exotic species of flowering plants and colorful blooms that thrive abundantly in this 2.5-acre (1-hectare) floral paradise. You’ll be awed as you explore the garden and feast your eyes on these vibrant creations.

Next, head to the beautiful and lush Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park, comprised of more than 15,000 plants to give it the look and feel of a real rainforest . See nearly 6,000 inhabitants of more than 120 species of butterflies, and at at the nursery, learn about the life cycle and mating habits of these graceful insects. Don't miss the museum, where you'll gain an even deeper insight into these creatures.

Finally, visit the largest enclosed aviary in Southeast Asia, the Kuala Lumpur Bird Park, which lies on a sprawling 8 acres (3 hectares) of verdant valley terrain. Here, you’ll see more than 5,000 native and exotic birds. Spot and identify the many types of these feathered beauties with the help of your guide.
After your amazing nature experience, you’ll be taken back to your hotel.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Please note that hotel pickup and drop-off service operates only for hotels within the Kuala Lumpur central city limits. If you are staying at the following hotels, please either make your own way to a hotel in central Kuala Lumpur or contact the local tour operator after booking to arrange pickup service for an additional fee (contact info will be provided on your confirmation voucher):

Greater Kuala Lumpur: Le Meridien, Hilton, Cititel, Boulevard MidValley, Pearl International, Eastin Hotel Petaling Jaya, Crystal Crown, Armada, Holiday Villa Subang, Grand Dorset Subang, Petaling Jaya Hilton, Sunway Lagoon, One World Damansara.
Sri Kembangan: Palace of the Golden Horses.
Shah Alam: Holiday Inn Glenmarie, The Saujana, all hotels within the Shah Alam area.
Putrajaya & KLIA: Putrajaya Shangrila, Putrajaya Marriott, Cyberview Lodge, Equatorial Bangi, Pan Pacific KLIA, Concorde Inn KLIA.
A moderate amount of walking is involved; comfortable walking shoes and a hat are recommended.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Petronas Twin Towers Exploration Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Petronas Twin Towers, is a not to be missed attraction in Kuala Lumpur and has unforgettable views of the city, especially at night. Approximately 4-6 hours, this tour is led by a professional local guide and includes visit to Petrosains Discovery Centre, the Art Gallery and allow time for shopping at the KLCC.

highlights.highlightItem: 4- to 6-hour guided tour of KL's Petronas Towers.
Explore the iconic structures with a local guide.
Visit a museum, art gallery, mosque and boutiques.
Enjoy the flexibility of a private tour.
All entrance fees included.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This tour can take between 4-6 hours depending on how much you want to see. For anyone with limited time this tour allow you to see best of the KLCC area. We visit the world famous iconic Petronas Twin Towers which are the World’s tallest Twin Towers. The views here in daylight or night time are unforgettable.

We explore, Petrosains – The Discovery Centre, which is located within the tower. This modern and contemporary centre will allow you to touch, feel and manipulate the scientific exhibits on display. Enjoy the interactive feature of Petrosains’ exhibits which offer visitors a constructive learning experience. The state-of-the-art design of the centre is complemented by thematic props, three-dimensional images, simulation effects and spectacular recreations with realistic visual and sound effects. Whether you are with children or on your own you are sure to enjoy this interactive experience.

We then ascend Petronas Twin Towers to the Skye Bridge and proceed to observation desk at 86th floor. You will witness the beauty of Kuala Lumpur city from 360 degree angles. This is Asia best plan city and offers breathtaking panoramic views. The duration of the visit to the towers is around 45 minutes and there is a small souvenir shop for you to buy gifts.

We move on to the Petronas Art gallery which is a must for any art lover, whilst a short trip to 'As Syakirin Mosque' is worthwhile and located near the KLCC park area. This mosque area is 21 Hectares and around 10,000 peoples can pray at any one time. This mosque is like 'a jewel' in the park due to its beautiful architect and strategic location.
You will then be given around 45 minutes, shopping lovers can enjoy shopping from world's best brand outlets or families may prefer to visit Aquaria KLCC.
We will then return you to your hotel.

inclusion.item: Admission ticket of Petronas Twin Tower's Sky bridge and Observation Desk.
Admission ticket of Petrosains Discovery Center.
Hotel pick up and drop off.

PackageDetails.overview: Avoid the long queue for a taxi after a tiring flight and enjoy this perfect return transfer to your hotel from the airport that includes complimentary tickets to the famous Petronas Twin Towers on arrival! Your departure will also be hassle free as you head to the airport in a comfortable air-conditioned coach, reflecting on your amazing holiday in peace!

highlights.highlightItem: Choice of several departures throughout the day.
Pickup from a centrally located meeting point.
Skip the line.
Small group ensures personal service.
All taxes, fuel surcharges and service fees included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Upon your arrival at the airport, a friendly local representative will greet you at the arrival hall before taking you to the shuttle and transfer you to your hotel. Relax in the air-conditioned vehicle as you will be safely taking to your destination.

Upon your departure, enjoy a hassle free transfer from your hotel to the airport. You will be picked up from your hotel lobby at an agreed time. This service is certainly the ideal solution for those who wish to travel in fast and comfortable way.

This package also includes complimentary tickets to the famous Petronas Twin Towers! All you need to do is express your desired time slot to visit the towers via email and the tickets will be passed to you immediately on your arrival at Kuala Lumpur International Airport. Have fun and enjoy your holiday in Malaysia!

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Shore Excursion: City Highlights

PackageDetails.overview: When your cruise ship docks in Kuala Lumpur, discover top attractions with ease on this 6-hour  Kuala Lumpur city sightseeing tour. Enjoy a 1-hour sightseeing drive through Kuala Lumpur and see famous landmarks including the PETRONAS Towers and the National Mosque of Malaysia. Admire Royal Guards on horseback at the King's Palace and gain insight into Malay heritage. Discover Malaysian cultural artefacts at the National Museum and enjoy a moment of tranquillity at Lake Gardens. Numbers are limited to six people on this small-group shore excursion, ensuring a personalized experience.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day Kuala Lumpur shore excursion with city sightseeing.
Relax on the scenic drive from Port Kelang to the capital.
Stop to photograph Independence Square, the King's Palace and PETRONAS Twin Towers.
Visit the inside of National Museum.
Pass the architectural marvels of the National Mosque and Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.
Port pickup and drop-off included Covered by Viator's worry-free policy: guaranteed on-time return to your ship.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet your local guide at Port Kelung after your cruise ship docks at the terminal. You’ll embark on a 1-hour scenic drive to Kuala Lumpur and explore the modern metropolis during your shore excursion. Start your sightseeing tour of Malaysia’s capital with several photo stops at prominent landmarks, noting the contrast between ultra-modern monuments and their Indo-Moorish counterparts. See Royal Guards on their horses in front of the King's Palace, and observe the Malay flag, first hoisted in 1957 at Independence Square. Then marvel at the PETRONAS Twin Towers, which climb 88 stories toward the sky!

Visit the National Museum, which exhibits Malaysian cultural artefacts on display, en route to Lake Gardens — a city refuge and recreational park. Established in 1888, the park features a maze of sculpted gardens amid freshwater ponds and fountains. Finally, view the National Mosque of  Malaysia, a modern design built of reinforced concrete, and admire the mix of Eastern and Western architecture of the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.
Complete your half-day tour with the return scenic drive to the cruise port, where your guide drops you off in time for your departure.

Worry-free Shore Excursion - We will ensure your timely return to Port Kelang for this activity. In the rare event your ship has departed, we will arrange for transportation to the next port-of-call. If your ship is delayed and you are unable to attend this activity, your money will be refunded. See our terms and conditions for full details

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

Packages.PackageDesc: Kuala Lumpur Tour including Petronas Twin Towers

PackageDetails.overview: An exciting 4 hour tour for you to explore Kuala Lumpur on this perfect itinerary. Go up the Twin Towers and enjoy magnificent views of city, walk on the sky bridge and observation deck and admire interesting structures across the city. Our tour also includes a tour around the city stopping for photo opportunities at the National Monument, the National Mosque, the old courthouse and the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station. Finish off your tour enjoying the views from the Kuala Lumpur Tower observation deck. This is a great way to get a quick view of Malaysia's capital city.

highlights.highlightItem: 4-hour city sightseeing tour in Kuala Lumpur.
Check out the ornate architecture of the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.
Pass by the King's Palace, Merdeka Square, Selangor Club and Titiwangsa Lake Gardens.
Get photo ops at the National Monument and Merdeka Square, and hear the history of Malaysian independence.
Admire the six-tiered Thean Hou Temple, a landmark Chinese temple.
Includes tickets to the Skybridge and observation deck at the Petronas Twin Towers and the Menara KL.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This four-hour tour provides a brief introduction to Kuala Lumpur's famous locations, and allows time to explore the city at leisure. You will meet your local driver/guide upon pick-up from your city hotel in the morning and embark on your guided, narrated tour in our comfortable air-conditioned vehicle.

Visit the various Kuala Lumpur attractions, making photo stops at any location you prefer. All you need to say “Pull Over” and the driver/guide will be more than happy to accommodate. The tour will take you to the King's Palace, a symbol of Malaysian sovereignty, as well as Merdeka Square, which features the world’s tallest free standing flag pole nestled between the old courthouse and the famous Selangor Club built Victorian style architecture.

Look up at the perfectly symmetrical twin structure of the 88-story Petronas Twin Towers, the multifaceted steel walls and twin spires built as an integral part of the structure are strengthened by the sky bridge. The building was designed by the world renowned Argentinian American Cesar Pelli. Enjoy breath taking views of the city from the twin towers bridge and then from the observation deck.

Then, proceed along the beautiful Lake Gardens on your way to view the National Monument, commemorating Malaysia's struggle sacrifice made during World War II and the Malaysian Parliament House. Don’t forget to stop and admire the modern construction of the National Mosque and the pleasant Moorish architecture of the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.

You will also visit the six-tiered Chinese landmark of Thean Hou Temple built to match some of the temples in Mainland China, a grand structure that never fails to impress tourists with its architecture. The final stop and drop off point of your sightseeing tour of Kuala Lumpur is the KL towers and you will be pleased to know that your entrance ticket for the observation deck is included in this tour.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.
Tickets for Sky bridge and observation desk of Petronas Twin Towers.
Guaranteed to skip the long lines at Petronas Twin Towers.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Dress code is smart casual.

A minimum of 2 people per booking is required. Subject to favorable weather conditions. If canceled due to poor weather or any unforeseen circumstances , you will be given the option of an alternative date or full refund.
In case if you do not wish to take tour at 9 am, please contact your local supplier 72 hours before tour if they can arrange the tour afternoon or evening time.

Packages.PackageDesc: Lotus Leaves Painting in Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Unleash your inner artist during a 3-hour lesson on painting lotus leaves. Use leaves of various sizes to create each masterpiece of colour for your home or office; these acrylic paintings make lovely souvenirs, gifts and delightful conversation pieces about your time in Kuala Lumpur. This small-group workshop runs with a maximum of five students per class to ensure personalized attention from your instructors, who offer materials and guidance.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour painting workshop in Kuala Lumpur.
Spend time painting on lotus leaves in harmonizing colours.
Materials including acrylic paints, canvas, packaging and DIY varnishing kit are provided.
Small-group class is limited to five students.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Simple painting techniques will be demonstrated to get you started and your friendly facilitators will be right there with you; providing guidance at any moment you need throughout the workshop. Don’t fret over making mistakes because the beauty of lotus leaves painting is that you can simply do them over. So let loose your inhibitions and set the infinite palette of your imagination free.

Experiment with colours fearlessly and watch as every brush stroke unfolds a beautiful new layer into something stunning that is uniquely yours.  Rest assured that you’re in good hands with our facilitators who will provide you with everything you need in terms of guidance and tools. You will be completely at ease during this fun and highly interactive workshop.

Lotus leaves painting is about the harmonization of colours and tones, so here are some helpful tips given during the lessons. Please feel free to bring photos, books, items or materials that you feel may help your colour creativity during the workshop. We will be on hand to prompt you in the right direction!
You will have a choice of various sizes of canvases and all you need to do is choose which size you would love to paint on at the beginning of the workshop.

inclusion.item: Painting apparatus, acrylic paints, apron, light refreshments, packaging for the canvas and DIY varnishing kit.

Packages.PackageDesc: Malaysian Cultural Night in Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: See the illuminated sights of Kuala Lumpur at night on this 3-hour sightseeing tour that showcases Malaysia’s rich cultural heritage. Experience the cosmopolitan city with a knowledgable guide, including a walk past fruit vendors and hawker stalls at the Chinatown (Petaling Street) night market. See ancient Hindu traditions on a visit to Sri Mahamariamman Temple and finish with a cultural show while you feast on a dinner buffet at a Malay restaurant.

highlights.highlightItem: Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Ideal choice for families.
See the sights illuminated at night.
Buffet dinner included.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This evening tour takes you to the open air bazaar of ChinaTown, a Hindu Temple and a sumptuous Malay cuisine accompanied with a cultural show. At the first stop The Sri Maha Mariamman Hindu Temple, the smell of burning jasmine, incessant chantings of Hindu priests and intricate carved deities combine to give a real mystical aura and a lasting impression of this religion. We then head to the Open Air Bazaar of Chinatown, take a stroll through this night market, where the locals engage in hectic bargaining for merchandises spread across the streets. Later, we proceed to a Malay restaurant for buffet dinner and cultural show. Help yourself to a buffet dinner where a sumptuous variety of local dishes and delicacies await you.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Infants free of charge, no seat.
A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.
Shorts, sleeveless shirt and slippers are not allowed.
All transfers and half/full day tours – NO refund for cancellation received within 24 hours’ notice.

Packages.PackageDesc: MUD: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur' Musical and Guided Walking Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Experience of the history of Kuala Lumpur as you watch the the hit musical 'MUD: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur.' During a moving 1-hour performance, the excellent cast recounts the story of this major Southeast Asian capital city that started from humble beginnings and has become modern day giant. Gain even more insight into this story after the show on a brief walking tour of nearby Dataran Merdeka (Independence Square) that reveals even more detail about Malaysia's history and architectural landmarks. Includes admission to the musical, hotel pickup and drop-off, walking tour and guide.

highlights.highlightItem: Show ticket for 'Mud: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur' musical, followed by a walking tour.
Learn how Kuala Lumpur grew from mining town to metropolis Enjoy the professional cast’s vibrant song and dance performances.
Admire the Indian Mughal-inspired architecture of Malaysia’s oldest theater, Panggung Bandaraya.
Take a 1-hour guided walking tour to nearby Independence Square after the show.
Marvel at the ornate Sultan Abdul Samad Building, Royal Selangor Club Complex and Kuala Lumpur Railway.
Choose either an afternoon or evening show.

PackageDetails.why: You'll feel the energy of the cast members, who put their hearts into this performance. Afterward, the walking tour builds on the story told in the musical, showing you exactly where the city took shape, including the spot where the Malaysian flag was first raised in 1957.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Choose either an afternoon or evening show of MUD: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur and enjoy door-to-door transfer service from your hotel in Kuala Lumpur to Malaysia’s oldest theatre, the Panggung Bandaraya.

Watch the story of the founding of Kuala Lumpur unfold, starting in 1880 when three young men move from their villages to a small tin-mining town at the confluence of two muddy rivers. Along with an excellent cast, the musical provides captivating dance, music, costumes and set design that reflect various Malaysian folk art traditions. The show runs for approximately one hour; afterward the cast members often come out to meet the audience for photo ops.

As you leave the air-conditioned theater, note its 16th-century Mughal Empire-inspired architecture. Then take a one-hour walking tour with an expert guide to Dataran Merdeka, the public square where the country marked its independence from British rule in 1957 and raised the Malaysian flag.

Stroll past key landmarks such as the Sultan Abdul Samad Building, a masterpiece of British colonial architecture. Then check out the former National History Museum, the Royal Selangor Club Complex, St Mary's Anglican Cathedral, Kuala Lumpur City Gallery and Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.

Expect to walk at an easy pace for less than one mile (about one km) with your guide before your driver returns you to your hotel. Alternatively, you can continue to explore on your own and make your own way back to your hotel.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
A small amount of walking is involved.
Please wear comfortable walking shoes.
Minimum of 2 passengers required.

Packages.PackageDesc: One-Way Low Cost Private Arrival Transfer from Kuala Lumpur International Airport to Kuala Lumpur City

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy a private airport transfer from Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KUL) to Kuala Lumpur city. Avoid the lines for taxis and confusion caused by language barriers or public transportation.

highlights.highlightItem: Skip the line.
Airport transfer.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
All taxes, fuel surcharges and service fees included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Sit back and relax while our driver leads you the way and assists you with your luggage. You will not have to worry about any details on how to get to your location in Kuala Lumpur.

You will be awaited by your private driver in the arrival terminal holding in sign with your name on it. When your flight is delayed, do not worry, your driver will monitor your flight and be there when you arrived. He will then help you with your luggage and lead you to the car. Once you and the driver double-checked the location address you provided us with he will take you straight to your destination in Kuala Lumpur. Enjoy the drive past the famous Petronas Towers and the iconic Merdeka Square while the driver takes you to your destination.

It is important that when you book you provide us your flight number and the address of destination in Kuala Lumpur to ensure that your trip proceeds without any problems. Once you booked you will receive a booking confirmation in the form of a travel voucher to present to your private driver.

inclusion.item: Meet and greet service (pick-up on arrival with name sign).
30 minute waiting time (in case of flight delay).

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Full-Day Tour of Kuala Lumpur City and the Batu Caves

PackageDetails.overview: Join this private full-day Kuala Lumpur city and countryside tour to explore historical buildings and some of the most popular attractions such as National Mosque, King Palace, Independence Square, Old Railway Station, Batu Caves, Lake Garden, National Monument, Parliament House and Royal Selangor. The trip will include a photography opportunity at the Petronas Twin Towers, the tallest twin towers in the world. Please note: the tickets for this attraction are not included in this tour.

highlights.highlightItem: Full-day, private tour of Kuala Lumpur's highlights.
Visit landmarks, the Batu Caves and local workshops.
Get an inside look at life in the city.
Learn about local crafts Great overview, perfect for first time visitors.
Private guide for a more personalized experience.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Join this full-day private tour to experience the local lifestyle, culture and learn some history of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Despite the growing skyline of a modern metropolis, Kuala Lumpur has always been charming and full of character. You will see the PETRONAS Twin Towers, the world tallest twin towers, The King's Palace (Istana Negara) a symbol of Malaysian sovereignty, the Independence Square (Merdeka Square) and the National Museum (Merdeka Square).

You will drive past the Lake Gardens (Perdana Botanical Gardens), where you can find over 5,000 birds flying freely and accustomed to being around people. View the National Monument, National Mosque (Masjid Negara), and the Old Railway Station (Railway Station and Administration Building).

Next, you'll move on to the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre to appreciate the Malaysian pewter arts, followed by a short drive through Little India. Malaysia's official Little India in Brickfields used to be a simple residential neighbourhood just outside Kuala Lumpur, but now has transformed into a colourful community with stores and restaurants along the streets.

After the trip through Little India, you'll arrive at the Batu Caves. This natural phenomenon is a massive limestone outcrop, with its interiors home to a Hindu shrine lined with different deities. The shrine itself is located deep inside the high caverns which take 272 steps to reach. Last stop is a local Malaysian Batik centre to see how the fabric is being designed and printed.

inclusion.item: Hotel pickup and drop-off (selected hotels only).

exclusion.item: Petronas Twin Towers Sky bridge tickets.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Child rate applies only when sharing with 2 paying adults.
Group discount is available for group size of 2, 4 or more.
A maximum of 15 people per booking.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Half Day Tour of Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: On this half day private tour you will visit the National Mosque or in Malay the Masjid Negara, which is the most distinguished mosque in KL. Another must see is the Tugu Negara or War Memorial where we honour those who perished in the war. You will also pass the Moorish-styled Federal Court, the old Railway station which is a striking piece of Mohammedan architecture, the Tudor-styled Cricket Club and the King’s Palace. Visit the Thean Hou Temple situated in Robson Heights, which is the home to patron Goddess Thean Hou of the Hainanese community. This striking six-tiered temple is regarded as one of the biggest Chinese temples in South East Asia.

highlights.highlightItem: Private 3-hour Kuala Lumpur city sightseeing tour.
Hear commentary on KL’s eclectic architecture from a personal guide.
Visit the National Mosque (Masjid Negara) and the National Monument (Tugu Negara).
Explore Thean Hou Temple, home to the patron goddess of the Hainanese community.
Hotel pickup and drop-off by private vehicle included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: For short or long term visitors in Kuala Lumpur this is perfect opportunity to visit landmarks of Kuala Lumpur city. On tour we will take you to some of most important sightseeing attractions.
First of all we will drive to the National Mosque also known as Masjid Negara.

We will continue to the Tugu Negara the National Monument, this sculpture was erected to commemorate those who gave lives in Malaysia's fight for independence against the Japanese occupation during WWII and the Malayan Emergency.

Later we will take you to explore the Cricket Club. While on the tour you will also be taken to visit other landmarks including the Moorish-styled Federal Court, the old Malaysian railway station and the King's Palace. Time permitting we will also visit a handicrafts centre.
Finally we will visit the Thean Hou Temple situated in Robson Heights before returning you to the hotel.

exclusion.item: Transfers from and to airport, sea/river ports, train stations that are located inside or outside of the city centre and others are NOT included in the service and supplements will applied.
Transfers from and to hotels and resorts that are located outside of the city centre are NOT included in the service and supplements will applied.

Infant rates apply provided they do not occupy a seat.
Adult pricing applies to all travellers excluding infants.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Half-Day Kuala Lumpur Photographic Tour including Tickets to Petronas Twin Towers and KL Tower

PackageDetails.overview: Kuala Lumpur is a city you can admire all day long as it is full of wonderful places and picturesque sights. This tour gives you a chance to see and photograph some of the most iconic places and take in breath-taking sceneries and views from the top of Petronas Twin Towers.

highlights.highlightItem: Skip the line.
Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Private tour is operated with just your party and a guide/driver.
Choice of several departures throughout the day.
Flexibility to customize your itinerary to your own preferences.
Perfect introduction for first-time visitors.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Prepare yourself for a half day filled with lots of photographic opportunities as you start your tour from the Petronas Twin Towers once you get onto the observing deck of the famous Sky Bridge. Watch as the city stretches below glittering in the sunlight with all its skyscrapers, palaces and museums.

King’s Palace, or the Istana Negara, is a place like no other. Hundreds of photographers visit it each year to capture the magnificent beauty of this rich-looking mansion and its spectacular architecture. Reminiscent of the England’s Buckingham Palace, it has two guard posts that change every hour. The Merdeka Square is one of the biggest architectural jewels of Kuala Lumpur located in the centre of the city. You have the opportunity to take some pictures of modern buildings mixed up with colonial masterpieces in the centre of the square.

A trip to the Lake Gardens can become a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the busy city. Wander the tracks and trails as you take in all the greenery and freshness of a well-kept park. Don’t forget to photograph the picturesque Orchid Gardens and the National Monument, a symbol of Malaysian freedom, which is located nearby. You will stop by the Old Railway Station to take dozens of pictures as this spectacular structure draws the attention of both locals and tourists with its splendid architecture.  Built by colonial architects, this stunning structure strikes its visitors with intricate details in the design, splendid arcs, verandas and vast balconies. The Kuala Lumpur Tower is another significant sight you’ll capture on your camera. It rises high above the city line and provides one of the most breath-taking views you have ever experienced. Climb the staircase or use an elevator as you go up at the height of 421 meters to enjoy the sight. Built in 1995, this tower can boast a sparkling dome made of glass, which shines brightly when the sun hits it.

Thean Hou Temple is a historical sight you simply cannot miss. Built on top of a picturesque hill, this ancient temple is an eclectic mixture of Daoism, Buddhism and Confucianism, which reflects in its peculiar architecture with red pillars, dragons and prayer rooms. The temple is dedicated to the Goddess of Mercy; it also has a Thean Hou shrine and sculptures representing the Astrological animals. You can even have a fortune-reading here!
As the tour comes to its end, you will be transported back to your hotel safely.

inclusion.item: Entrance tickets to Petronas Twin Towers and Kuala Lumpur Towers.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Kuala Lumpur Layover Tour: City Sightseeing with Airport or Hotel Drop-Off

PackageDetails.overview: Make the most of your layover in Kuala Lumpur with this private city sightseeing tour. Enjoy a full day of all the highlights, like Petronas Twin Towers, the Craft Cultural Complex and the National Museum. Enjoy the expertise of a private guide and the luxury of transport in a private vehicle. This tour includes the flexibility to plan your own itinerary based on time and interest and hotel or airport drop-off is included.

highlights.highlightItem: Full-day private layover tour in Kuala Lumpur.
Visit top attractions in the city centre with a private guide.
Take photos of the Petronas Twin Towers, Royal King’s Palace and Sultan Abdul Samad Building.
Try your hand at batik at the Kuala Lumpur Craft Cultural Complex.
See cultural displays on exhibit at the National Museum.
Round-trip airport transport by private vehicle included.
Choose a customized itinerary with optional hotel drop-off.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: A long layover doesn’t have to mean wasted time thanks to this private Kuala Lumpur layover tour that includes city sightseeing and airport or hotel drop off. Enjoy the luxury of private transportation and a friendly local guide on a tour that’s personalized to meet your expectations, interests and time constraints.

You’ll stop at the Petronas Twin Towers—the world’s tallest, and one of Kuala Lumpur’s must-see landmarks. Take photographs of this 88-story building that’s constructed from some 55,000 glass panels and stainless steel beams.

Gain a deeper understanding and appreciation for local artisans on a visit to the Craft Cultural Complex, where handmade items from across the country are proudly displayed and available for purchase. Your guide will show you the impressive cultural exhibits and detail characteristics that help to distinguish works in one region from another. Meet resident artists and participate in hands-on experiences on this tour highlight.

Next you’ll check out the Royal King’s Palace, known by locals as Istana Negara before making your way to the National Museum. This gem of a destination will unlock the history, wildlife and traditions of Malaysia and your guide will offer insight into the artifacts on display as you wander the galleries.

This tour will take you past the National Mosque and Railway Administration Building, as well as to Independence Square, where you’ll see the country’s first flag proudly displayed. Your private tour and memorable day ends with hotel or airport drop off, depending on your travel plans.
Itinerary:
subItem: Option 1: Round-trip airport transport After your layover tour, return to Kuala Lumpur International Airport for your onward flight

Option 2: Airport pickup and hotel drop-off Your tour concludes with drop-off at your hotel for your overnight layover in Kuala Lumpur. When you're ready for your departing flight, make your own way to the airport

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Please note: This private sightseeing tour of Kuala Lumpur can be customized to your interests; please list any special interests you have (e.g. art, architecture, history, culture, shopping) at the time of booking to alert your guide, so that he or she can better prepare for your private tour.
At time of booking, you MUST include the following flight details:
subItem: Arrival and departure date and time

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
To accommodate for flight check in and security procedures, plus any potential traffic congestion, a minimum layover of 8 hours is required.
Please confirm your flight details with the tour operator once the tour is confirmed.
The tour can either start from Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) or Low Cost Carrier Terminal (LCCT).

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Kuala Lumpur Orientation Day Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Join this full-day private tour exploring Kuala Lumpur lead by a professional English speaking driver/guide and get some local inside tips. This approximately 8 hours tour in Kuala Lumpur is a great opportunity to experience and learn the local lifestyle, history and culture which makes by multiple ethnic groups. There are two departure time for this tour, 9am and 12pm. You will be picked up by the driver at your hotel lobby in Kuala Lumpur or Petaling Jaya 15 minutes prior to the departure time.

highlights.highlightItem: 8-hour private tour of Kuala Lumpur attractions, led by a personal driver-guide.
See the Petronas Twin Towers, National Monument and National Mosque of Malaysia.
Stroll through the Lake Gardens (Perdana Botanical Garden) and Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.
Explore the central market, Chinatown and Little India.
See statues of Hindu gods at the Batu Caves.
Hotel pickup and drop-off by private vehicle included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: You will be picked up from your hotel lobby located in Kuala Lumpur or Petaling Jaya and head to the Petronas Twin Towers building, a distinctive icon universally associated with Kuala Lumpur. The 88-floor towers have a facade of steel and glass that distinctly reflect images of Islamic Art. Designed by a South American architect, the base of Twin Towers houses a shopping mall and the Malaysian Philharmonic Orchestra.

You will then visit Lake Gardens (Perdana Botanical Garden), with some beautiful trees, man-made waterfalls and playground. We will stop at a war memorial the National Monument. It is a huge bronze statue, muscular in nature, with warriors defending the wounded and fallen.

National Mosque (Masjid Negara), a magnificent structure that is a unique embodiment of modern Islamic art with stunning traditional elements . We will explore Kuala Lumpur Railway Station, a lovely majestic palace once nearby the National Mosque.

Chinese Thean Hou Temple, built in the classic style of Mainland China. Being one of the oldest and greatest temples in Southeast Asia, this landmark attracts millions of tourists from across the globe each year.

If you are more into shopping than sightseeing, you can easily omit any of these places and go for a fascinating journey into the depth of Central Market, where you can spend your time looking through artwork, souvenirs, and batik masterpieces. Chinatown, filled with countless Chinese shops is an ideal place to hunt for everything from cheap spices to gadgets. Little India is a small Indian island inside the bustling streets of Kuala Lumpur.  Here you can try fantastic Indian dishes, look for bright saris and enjoy the glittery stalls filled with trinkets and jewellery of all kinds.

The second most desired visiting place in Kuala Lumpur is the Batu Caves. Dedicated to Lord Murugan, this Hindu shrine holds a magnificent 155ft (47meter) statue erected in his honor. 272 stairs lead to the massive Temple Cave with a spectacular 328ft (100meter) high ceiling. The cave is filled with statues of Hindu gods and intricate paintings illuminated by the holes in the rock of the ceiling.

It is also possible to visit the Royal Selangor Pewter Factory and Visitor Centre where one can delve into the process of pewter manufacturing and learn about its properties, while enjoying the fascinating pewter museum located on the premises of the factory.
You will dropped off back to your hotel after finishing the tour.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.
Professional English speaking guide and driver.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
The tour and itinerary may change or cancel without prior notice due to unforeseen circumstances (If any). You will be advised of the change as soon as possible or receive a full refund.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Malaysian Cooking Class

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy a memorable introduction to Malaysian cuisine with this private 5-hour cooking class in Kuala Lumpur, including hotel pick-up. Discover the rich flavours and unique techniques that make up Malaysia’s diverse cuisine, as you cook a range of traditional dishes under the expert eye of a professional chef. Learn tips and tricks to recreate your favourite recipes back home, and then test your creations as you tuck into a delicious home-cooked lunch.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day private cooking class in Kuala Lumpur.
Prepare Malaysian specialties with an expert chef.
Learn about ingredients that comprise traditional dishes.
Discover the cultural influences and culinary heritage of Malay cuisine.
Enjoy a delicious meal for lunch.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The distinctively varied dishes of Malaysian cuisine appeal to a wide range of palates. You’ll discover the secrets to making diverse dishes in your 5-hour hands-on cooking class. After hotel pickup in Kuala Lumpur, join an expert chef in the kitchen and immerse in the delectable flavors of traditional Malaysian gastronomy.

When you arrive, let your instructor demonstrate cooking techniques and discuss the rich culinary heritage of this diverse country. Learn to prepare several traditional dishes, using fresh ingredients and spices with Malay, Chinese, Indian and Baba influences.

Whether you’re a novice or a pro in the kitchen, you’ll gain knowledge about Malaysian home cooking and hospitality. Your chef provides guidance on every step as you create your menu. After your cooking lesson, taste the delicious plates for lunch.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking, unless booked within 3 days of travel. In this case confirmation will be received within 48 hours, subject to availability.
No vegetarian option available.
Please be ready at least 15 minutes prior to departure time.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private One-Way Kuala Lumpur Airport Arrival Transfer

PackageDetails.overview: Pre-book your private one-way arrival transfer from Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA1 or KLIA2) and transport you to your selected hotel in Kuala Lumpur or Petaling Jaya areas. You will be greeted by our guide at the arrival hall and enjoy a comfortable ride in our air-conditioned vehicle. Please note this is a private transfer group price.

highlights.highlightItem: Airport transfer.
Private tour is operated with just your party and a guide/driver.
Choice of several departures throughout the day.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This private budget transfer service will take you to your next destination in comfort. We serve both Kuala Lumpur International Airport KLIA1 and KLIA2 and a private transfer either to the Kuala Lumpur city or Petaling Jaya area.

Our English speaking driver will meet and greet you at your arrival terminal exit gate. He will make your booking easy and transfer relaxed. With space for up to 7 passengers we can also cater for larger groups or families. Take the stress out of airport transfers and book in early with our dedicated and responsible drivers to get you there on time.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Duration of transfer is depend on traffic conditions.

Each traveller is allowed a maximum of 1 suitcase and 1 carry-on bag. Oversized or excessive luggage (e.g. surfboards, golf clubs or bikes) may have certain restrictions, please inquire with the operator prior to travel to confirm if your excess luggage is acceptable.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Kuala Lumpur Rainforest and Canopy Walkway Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy a private tour of the Malaysian Rainforest and learn about the flora and fauna that call this incredible ecosystem home. Wander through shaded trails and arboretums, like the Dipterocarp arboretum, and pay a visit to the Bambusetum, where your guide will offer insight and education about the 30 species of local bamboo that call the forest home. You’ll experience the thrill of walking above the trees on a canopy tour and see the remains of an historic Orang Asli settlement.

highlights.highlightItem: Private three-hour morning tour of Kuala Lumpur's lush rainforest.
Your own private English-speaking guide.
Rainforest canopy walk above the treetops.
See the remains of an old Orang Asli settlement.
Hotel pickup and drop off.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your private tour of Kuala Lumpur Rainforest and Canopy Walkway Tour kicks off with hotel pick up. Enjoy the luxury of an expert guide and private vehicle as you make your way to the Forest Reserve Institute of Malaysia (FRIM). Spread across some 1,528 hectares of land, FRIM is home to a diverse range of wildlife, plants and ecosystems.

Your knowledgeable guide will highlight the flora and fauna of this stunning natural landscape and walk you through what remains of an old Orang Asli settlement. Revel in the calm tranquility of waterfall views and trickling rivers that wind through the forest.

More adventurous travelers can add on one of the four jungle treks, which wind through spectacular scenery and impressive forests. Choose from Keruing Trail, Engkabang Trail, Salleh Trail or Rover Track. Wander through shaded arboretums, where your guide will point out some of the 30 species of bamboo that live in the forests. Enjoy an incredible canopy walk, high above the treetops. Please note, the canopy walk is accessible to only 250 travelers per day and is closed for maintenance on Mondays and Fridays. Your rainforest walk ranges from 45 minutes to one hour depending on the trail.

AdditionalInfo.info: Adult pricing applies to all travelers.
Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Please note: Canopy Walkway will be temporary closed starting from July 7 to August 11, 2014 for maintenence purposes and Eid Ul-Fitr celebration, and from October 3 to 7, 2014 for Eid Ul-Adha celebration.
