Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour : Kuala Lumpur Grand Full-Day Tour including Lunch

PackageDetails.overview: This full-day Kuala Lumpur sightseeing tour showcases the best of the city. Experience the energy of Independence Square, revel at the height of the Petronas Twin Towers, wander the halls of the National Museum and sample traditional fare during lunch at a local restaurant. Explore the streets of Little India and the stalls of the local craft center before enjoying a guided tour of Batu Caves Hindu temple—one of the city’s architectural masterpieces!

highlights.highlightItem: Private 8-hour sightseeing tour of Kuala Lumpur's top attractions with an expert guide.
Snap photos of Independence Square, the Petronas Twin Towers and the King’s Palace.
Visit the National Museum, National Monument and National Mosque.
Note the blend of Eastern and Western architectural styles at the Old Railway Museum.
Explore Little India and the spectacular Batu Caves Enjoy a typical Malaysian lunch at a local restaurant.
Stop at local craft centres to admire their elegant pewter arts and batik textile design.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your private Kuala Lumpur grand full-day tour including lunch begins with pickup from your city-centre hotel. Enjoy the luxury of travel in an air-conditioned mini coach as you make your way through the streets, stopping at Petronas Twin Towers, the King’s Palace and Independence Square. Snap photos of these popular spots while you listen to your friendly guide share history and insight into the famed landmarks’ significance.

Spend some time wandering the galleries of the National Museum, where ancient artefacts, handicrafts and weaponry are on display. Journey past the Lake Gardens and take in the sight of a spectacular respite in the city of Kuala Lumpur’s hustle and bustle.

The grand tour also includes stops at the National Monument, which pays homage to those who died during World War II, as well as the National Mosque. Your guide will point out the stark architectural contrasts between this and the Old Railway Station as you make your way to the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre.

After enjoying an informative tour and learning more about the ancient art of pewtersmithing, head to a local restaurant to enjoy a traditional meal of Malaysian flavours. With a satisfied stomach you’ll head into the Brickfields where you’ll follow your guide through the colourful streets of Little India.

After you’ve experienced the energy and excitement of this popular neighbourhood, make your way to the famed Batu Caves where you’ll see an impressive gold statue of Lord Murugan towering some 140 feet  (42.7 meters) high. Climb the 272 steps to the top of the hill where you’ll find a stunning Hindu shrine, incredible views, and one of Kuala Lumpur’s most favoured destinations for travellers.
Your guide will stop at a traditional batik centre on your return trip to the capital city. You’ll learn how this ancient textile art is made using wax and dye before the tour ends at your hotel.

inclusion.item: Hotel pickup and drop-off (airport pickup and drop-off not available).

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Adult pricing applies to all travelers.

Please be advised that between January 16, 2014 to January 18, 2014, the Batu Cave will be replaced with visit to Central Market. Due to an expected massive crowds of Hindu devotees during Thaipusam Festival 2014.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: KL Tower Revolving Restaurant Buffet Dinner and Central Market Night Tour

PackageDetails.overview: See the breathtaking sites of Kuala Lumpur from the top of Asia’s tallest tower and experience dinner with a view in the revolving restaurant on this private, 3.5-hour tour. Stroll through Kuala Lumpur’s famous Central Market, one of the city’s most popular attractions. Then head to the observation deck of the KL Tower, one of the tallest towers in the world. Enjoy a buffet dinner with a breathtaking, panoramic night view of the city in the tower’s revolving restaurant. Hotel pickup and drop-off included.

highlights.highlightItem: Private 3.5-hour buffet dinner and market tour in Kuala Lumpur.
Enjoy a delicious buffet dinner at the KL Tower's revolving restaurant.
Stroll through Central Market for curious souvenirs with a fun and knowledgeable private guide.
See panoramic night views of Kuala Lumpur.
Hotel pickup and drop-off by air-conditioned private vehicle included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: After a downtown Kuala Lumpur hotel pickup, visit the famous Central Market, one of the city’s most popular attractions and the centrepiece of Malaysian culture, heritage, arts and crafts. The market is located at Jalan Tun Tan Cheng Lock (Foch Avenue) and the pedestrian-only section of Jalan Hang Kasturi (Rodger Street). Shop the wide selection of Malaysian handicrafts and souvenirs and have a portrait sketched by local artists in less than 15 minutes.

Then drive to the KL Tower and take a high-speed elevator to the top for a view of the city and beyond from the observation deck. At 421 meters (1,381 feet), it ranks as the tallest tower in Asia and one of the tallest towers in the world. Stop at the revolving restaurant for a delightful buffet dinner with a breath-taking panoramic view — a perfect way to cap offs a perfect evening in Kuala Lumpur.

inclusion.item: Buffet dinner at Kuala Lumpur Tower.
All taxes, fees and handling charges.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking, unless booked within 7 days of travel. In this case confirmation will be received within 48 hours, subject to availability.
Please advise any specific dietary requirements at time of booking.

This tour may not be running during holidays or festival seasons (Chinese New Year days, Valentines day, Mother & Father's Day, Merdeka Eve, New Year's Eve, Near Years day, Fasting Month of Ramadon, etc).
Please note that any hotel pickup request other than the selected hotels will be subject to extra fee, which you will be required to pay upon pickup.

Please be advised the dress code if smart-casual. Please refrain from wearing singlets, unkempt or tattered T-shirts, shorts, flip flops and sooty runners. Collared shirts and long pants are preferred.
Please be advised that management may refuse entry if the attire standards are not met.
Supplement for window seat table: RM50.00 per table (subject to availability).

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Cultural Night of Kuala Lumpur with Dinner and Show

PackageDetails.overview: Join this night excursion and get experience the nightlife of Kuala Lumpur. You will visit the famous night bazaar of china town for bargains and sights.  Then take a short tour to Sri Mahamariamman Temple and Petronas Twin Towers for photography. Enjoy the delightful array of local Malay cuisine where you will enjoy a traditional Malay culture performance.

highlights.highlightItem: See the sights illuminated at night.
Get inside tips from a local.
Dinner included.
Family friendly.
All entrance fees included.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The tour will starts by visiting the bustling night market in Chinatown and try your skills at bargaining. Chinatown is still one of the liveliest meeting points of the city with its stalls and its restaurants spread over several small streets. You will also see the Sri Mahamariamman Temple, one of the most ornate Indian temples where you may even get to see a Hindu wedding if you are lucky.

After experiencing the hustle, bustle and excitement of Chinatown and the Sri Mahamariamman Temple you really have been showcased the cultural diversity of Malaysia. We then go to a local restaurant and you will be served a delicious Malay dinner.

After dinner you will enjoy a traditional Malay cultural performance. A photo-stop at the Petronas Twin Towers, the famous twin skyscrapers in the heart of Kuala Lumpur City Centre . The towers are illuminated during the evening hours - scenery which will make you stand in awe for the sophistication of its architecture. You will be transported back to your hotel after the tour.

inclusion.item: Private tour with local guide and driver.
Hotel pickup and drop-off from centrally located Kuala Lumpur hotels only (supplements apply for hotels outside Kuala Lumpur City Centre).

exclusion.item: Hotel pickup and drop-off at centrally located hotels only. A surcharge per tour will be imposed for pick-up other than from city hotels (such as Cititel Midvalley, The Gardens, Boulevard, Hilton Kuala Lumpur at KL Central, Le Meridien, etc.). Confirmations of surcharges for hotels will be advised upon confirmation of hotel pickup and drop-off.
Transfers from and to airport, sea/river ports, train stations that are located inside or outside of the city centre and others are NOT included in the service and supplements will applied.

A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.
Supplements apply for separate guide on the tour.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Ipoh Old Town Food Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Swap the bustle of the capital for the charming colonial town of Ipoh on this full-day tour, including round-trip train transport from Kuala Lumpur. Make the most of your private guide and flexible itinerary as you take in the highlights of the historic centre on foot. Marvel over landmarks like Kellie’s Castle and the Perak Tong temple, then discover the town’s gastronomic heritage as you browse the markets and sample an array of street food and authentic Malay dishes.

highlights.highlightItem: Full-day private food and cultural heritage tour of Ipoh.
Travel round-trip by train from Kuala Lumpur with a knowledgeable private guide.
Walk to hawker stalls, food courts and markets for food tastings with authentic Malay dishes.
Delight your senses with curry noodles, barbecued fish and aromatic white coffee.
See colonial landmarks such as the Ipoh Railway Station, Ipoh Town Hall and the Birch Memorial Clock Tower.
Visit Kellie’s Castle and Perak Tong, a Buddhist temple in a limestone cave.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet your guide at KL Central railway station in Kuala Lumpur and board an express train to begin your full-day tour. The 2.5-hour train ride takes you north to Ipoh; once a thriving commercial centre during the tin-mining boom of the 19th century, the charming town now serves up local favourites at food stalls, food courts and restaurants. Start your culinary adventure with a stroll through Ipoh’s streets in search of breakfast. Follow your guide on foot and savour the best food available, from Ipoh sar hor fun (rice noodles served with sweet sauce) to melt-in-your-mouth kaya puffs (flaky pastry filled with egg jam).

On a short heritage walking tour, visit historical buildings constructed during the British colonial era. See landmarks such as the Ipoh Railway Station, the stately Ipoh Town Hall — built across the street in 1916 — and the Birch Memorial Clock Tower.

Take a break and sip a cup of Ipoh’s freshly brewed, aromatic white coffee before heading 3 miles (5 km) north of town to Gunung Lang. This recreational park features a gorgeous lake situated amid limestone outcroppings. Located a short distance away is Perak Tong, a cave temple that houses more than 40 Buddha statues, including a 42-foot-high (13-meter) centrepiece. If you climb the 385 steep steps to the top you’ll be rewarded with stunning views of the surrounding countryside — a photographer’s heaven!
Stop by Kellie's Castle to see the unfinished mansion perched atop a hill where it was built on a former rubber estate in Perak, before returning to Ipoh for lunch.

Continue your food tour on a walk to local markets and hawkers stalls, feasting on Malay dishes served up with white rice. Enjoy favourites such as barbecued fish marinated in a savoury sauce; chilli chicken; locally grown vegetables authentically cooked using coconut, shrimp or chilli paste; curry noodles; barbecued pork; dim sum; and fried green onions. After tasting some sweet treats such as cendol — a traditional dessert made from shaved ice, coconut milk, green starched noodles and sugar — stop by a nearby pamelo farm to sample this citrus fruit native to Southeast Asia.

Visit a kacang putih factory to sample a variety of these popular snacks, including fried beans, crispy tapioca chips and murukku (savoury, crunchy twists made from rice), which are original to Ipoh and shipped worldwide. Learn how the industry began in the 1940s from just six families who settled in the city from South India.

Your final stop is the Ipoh Central Market (Pasar Besar Ipoh), located at the UTC (Urban Transformation Centre). Walk through this local wet market for a look at food stalls, from produce vendors to fish mongers, before returning to Kuala Lumpur by train, accompanied by your guide.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Kuala Lumpur City Highlights Morning Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy all the highlights of Malaysia’s capital city on this private tour of Kuala Lumpur. Check out the National Museum, National Mosque, the Kuala Lumpur Railways Station, the King’s Palace and other important landmarks around the city. Your informative guide will offer insight and history as you take in the wonder of this unique destination where old meets new. Your tour concludes with a stop at the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre, where you’ll learn about the art of pewter smiting.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour morning tour of Kuala Lumpur's must see attractions with knowledgeable private guide.
Take photos of the King's Palace, Independence Square and the Petronas Twin Towers.
Visit the National Museum and stroll through the Lake Gardens.
Learn about the significance of the National Monument, the National Mosque and the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.
Hotel pickup and drop-off and transport by air-conditioned vehicle included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Experience the best of Malaysia on this three-hour private morning tour of Kuala Lumpur City Highlights. Explore the streets of this charming destination where old world meets urban contemporary with your expert local guide. Learn about the distinctive features of Indo-Moorish architecture as you tour city sites like the Petronas Twin Tower, King’s Palace and Independence Square.

Your guide will offer plenty of insight and historical context as you explore the halls of the National Museum. From there, you’ll make your way to the Lake Gardens and the National Monument, which commemorates those who lost their lives in World War II.

You’ll also learn about the incredible architecture of the National Mosque and Kuala Lumpur Railway Station. Your tour concludes at the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre, where you’ll get an insider’s look at the art of pewter smiting. This memorable morning tour includes hotel pick up and drop off.

Adult pricing applies to all travellers.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Kuala Lumpur Nature In The City Tour including Butterfly Park

PackageDetails.overview: Get close to nature without leaving the city on this private 3-hour from Kuala Lumpur, including hotel pick-up. Spot colorful birds at the Kuala Lumpur Bird Park, then surround yourself with majestic butterflies at the neighboring Butterfly Park. Finish with a visit to the vibrant Orchid and Hibiscus Garden, where you can marvel over 5,000 different flower varieties from all around the world.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour tour of Kuala Lumpur's Nature Theme Parks with fun and knowledgeable private guide.
Enjoy the flashes of color as you walk inside the Butterfly Park.
Stroll through the tranquil Bird Park, Hibiscus Gardens and Orchid Farm.
Hotel pickup and drop-off and transport by private, air-conditioned vehicle included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: On this private guided sightseeing tour you will visit the living tropical Nature Theme Park, situated in the heart of Malaysia's bustling capital city, Kuala Lumpur. Begin with the Bird Park and witness how over 600 birds of 60 local and foreign species adapt to a semi-natural, man-made environment.

Then, follow your guide for an educational exploration of nature and environment outside the jungle - the colourful and beautifully landscaped Butterfly Park - a kingdom with splendid haven of hundreds of vividly colored, free flying butterflies and other insects.
Finally, visit the Orchid and Hibiscus Garden to see over 3,000 species of orchids from all over the world and more than 2,000 varieties of hibiscus. End your tour with drop-off at our hotel.

PackageDetails.overview: Skip the lines at the airport waiting for a taxi and enjoy a hassle-free arrival in Kuala Lumpur with this private transfer service. A professional driver greets you at either terminal at Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KUL) so you can relax on the journey to your hotel. Travel by air-conditioned minivan seating up to six passengers. En route, you can opt for a complimentary 45-minute side trip to Putrajaya for photo ops of Malaysia’s federal administrative capital.

highlights.highlightItem: Choice of several departures throughout the day.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Why do you want to waste your time searching or waiting for a taxi after a long tiring journey ? We are here to provide you a safe and relaxed transfer from or to Kuala Lumpur International Airport.

After your safe landing at airport / hotel our representative will meet you at International arrivals or at your hotel lobby and will lead you to our brand new 9 seater Toyota Hiace. Our highly experienced driver will drive to your destination and if the flight landing time is between 9:00am to 4pm then he will give you a short trip for 45 minutes to the lush green city of Putrajaya. This will give the opportunity for a photo stop at the Prime Minister house, Putra Mosque, Putrajaya Lake, Prime Minister Office at Perdana Putra and Seri Wawasan Bridge.

After this side trip we continue to your final destination. On the way you can enjoy our lush green highway surrounded with tall Palm oil tree jungles. From Putrajaya to Kuala Lumpur it will take approximately 45 minutes, subject to traffic.

inclusion.item: Guaranteed to skip the long lines.

Relax as your professional driver safely drives you directly to Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KUL), getting you there with plenty of time to check in and board your flight. This service is available for individuals, couples or small groups, and operates seven days per week, 24 hours per day.

Be chauffeured to or from Kuala Lumpur International Airport.
Travel to or from accommodation in the city centre or outskirts Ride in a comfortable sedan or minivan for up to 7 passengers.
Enjoy reliable and efficient service with a professional driver.

You will not run into problems with our chauffeurs or with the vehicles. We give our customers 100% quality guarantee and we live up to our promises and never let you down. Once we confirm the booking, your car/minivan will be there on time. You will never have to doubt the dependability of our promises.

When you hire us, you will not have to worry about confidentiality related issues either. We maintain the highest level of professionalism and confidentiality with regards to customer information. Your personal details or your booking information will not be shared with any third parties. Packages.PackageDesc: Putrajaya Day Trip from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Get to know the wonders of the garden city of Putrajaya! Explore the amazing landmark city that stretches over more than 11,000 acres. View the beautiful Putrajaya Lake on the Perahu Ride (Lake Cruise), build your knowledge at the Agriculture Heritage Park, be blown away by the impressive Putra Mosque, and be inspired by the Perdana Putra (The Prime Minister’s Office). Putrajaya has so much to offer and this tour will be sure to show you it all!

highlights.highlightItem: 4-hour trip to Putrajaya from Kuala Lumpur.
See the city's most important landmarks.
Visit the seat of Malaysia's government.
Explore an iconic mosque.
Exclusive to Viator.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will begin with a 9:15am pick up from your hotel. You will then be taken on a 50 minute journey via the highway to Putrajaya. Our first stop will be Taman Warisan or Agricultural Heritage Park – a ‘living’ museum fruits, rubber, coca, palm oil, herbs and more! A demonstration on the entire rubber manufacturing process from the time it is tapped and churned out as fully smoked sheets will be shown during the tour.

We will then proceed to the Putrajaya Government Centre – there are numerous new government complexes located in this new township. Get excited to gaze upon the most imposing structure in Putrajaya – the thin, pinkish Putra Mosque! Standing beside Dataran Putra and facing the Putrajaya Lake, it incorporates architectural elements from Turkestan, Kazakhstan and Morocco. Another eye-catching building you will get to see is the Prime Minister’s Office – Putra Perdana. After the tour is complete you will be taken back to your hotel in Kuala Lumpur.

Packages.PackageDesc: Skip the Line : Kuala Lumpur Petronas Twin Towers Admission Ticket with Delivery

PackageDetails.overview: Ascend the twin towers with skip-the-line tickets and admire Kuala Lumpur at 558ft (170m) above ground. Enjoy a panorama view of whole city from observation desk and brace yourself for incredible vistas.

highlights.highlightItem: Great overview and orientation of the city.
Choice of several departures throughout the day.
Enjoy fantastic aerial views.
Skip the line.
Led by a local guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Ascend the 88-story structure, designed to mirror Malaysia’s high-tech ambitions. See the dramatic cityscape of Kuala Lumpur from its tallest building with a skip-the-line ticket to the iconic Petronas Towers.
Start by looking at the interactive displays that showcase the Twin Tower’s journey, from conception to completion. Then, scale 170 meters in an elevator with a futuristic edge.

Ascend higher to Level 86, where the story of Malaysia's vision unfolds among breathtaking views of Kuala Lumpur from the Observation Deck. End your visit by purchasing some unique souvenirs in the gift shop.
Please Note: Sky Bridge is currently closed for renovations and will not be accessible to visitors with this pass.

inclusion.item: Deliver of entrance tickets at your hotel.
Guaranteed to skip the long lines.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.

Your official entrance ticket/s will be delivered to your hotel the evening before your visit. Please present your official ticket/s (not Viator voucher) at the Lower Ground (Concourse) Level, Petronas Twin Towers, Kuala Lumpur City Centre, 50088 Kuala Lumpur. The tour is approximately 45 minutes. Tour is available every hour from 9 am till 8 pm. Tickets are strictly subject to availability and the closest time slot will be chosen if your preferred time slot is not available. The final time slot for entrance will be provided by the host via email 24 hours before the tour. **Important: please check your email for the final confirmed time for ticket purchased**. Please provide your hotel and address to deliver the tickets. Every Monday observation desk and sky bridge will be close.

Packages.PackageDesc: Small-Group Food Trail Walking Tour in Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Experience the tastes and flavors of Malaysia on this culinary walking tour through the streets of Kuala Lumpur. Eat like a local and sample delicious savory and sweet treats as you explore the back streets, alleys and suburbs of this city on foot. Your friendly and knowledgeable guide will explain the Chinese influences on regional cuisine and insure that a wide range of foods is enjoyed. This tour is limited to 12 people, so personalized experience is guaranteed!

highlights.highlightItem: 3- to 4- hour culinary walking tour in Kuala Lumpur.
Sample Malaysian delicacies, Chinese noodles and Indian treats -- enough for a complete lunch!
Feast on Malay street food at a hawker centre in Brickfields.
Explore hidden neighbourhoods like Chinatown and Bangsar with an expert local guide.
Discover Kuala Lumpur’s lively food culture and learn about its culinary heritage.
Stroll on foot and take the Light Rail Transit between food stops.
Small-group tour limited to 12 people ensures personal attention from your guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This whirlwind walking tour of flavours kicks off at the entrance of Bangsar Station, where you’ll meet your friendly local guide for a one-of-a-kind culinary experience. Follow your guide through the backstreets and alleyways of Malaysia’s capital city on this Small-Group food trail walking tour in Kuala Lumpur.

Your small group will make its way through Brickfields, where colourful Indian-influenced architecture and décor hints at the powerful flavours you’ll experience in the cuisine. You’ll enjoy Indian breads, curries and other favourites at the hawker centre South Indian food stalls.  Whether it’s fiery meats or sugary sweet treats, your guide will assist you in interacting with local sellers to insure you’re able to sample whatever you fancy.
After your time in Brickfields, make your way to Chinatown, where you’ll enjoy traditional dim sum, stir-friend noodles and lime juice in a neighbourhood as filled with energy as it is with flavours.

Your tour ends at a traditional coffee house where you’ll sit with your guide and fellow travellers and debrief on the day. Learn more about food and cultures and get recommendations for dinner as you relax with your group before you walk to Petaling Street to say goodbye.

inclusion.item: Round-trip transport between original meeting point and tour location.

Packages.PackageDesc: Templer's Park Day Trip from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy nature at its finest with this wonderful tour to Templer's Park. Step into a world of peace and serenity as you trek through the beautiful jungle surroundings. Let the soothing forest sounds take you away from the worries of the world. Take in the sight of the gorgeous waterfall which is located 25 km north of Kuala Lumpur. Be sure to bring a good camera so you can capture the beauty forever. This is the perfect tour for people looking to bask in the wonders of nature and get away from the noise of the city.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day tour from Kuala Lumpur to Templar’s Park.
Enjoy the freedom to explore at your own pace.
Spend time away from the city's hustle and bustle.
Swim, walk and bird-watch in a tranquil setting.
Fun experience, perfect for families.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will begin with a hotel pick up at 9:15am. From there you will be taken to the inspiring Templar’s Park.

A Tropical paradise, Templar’s Park is a great spot for bird watching and jungle trekking. Not only does it offer a picturesque setting with a towering attraction near its edge, namely the million-year-old limestone hill Bukit Takun, Templar’s Park is also a convenient escape from the burdens of urban life. The Kanching Waterfalls, also known as the Templar’s Park Falls are found here.

In addition to the jungle trails and picnic spots, there are also cool, clear pools for you to take a dip. Templar’s Park offers peace, quiet and relaxation with its fresh air and breath-taking beauty.
You will have 3.5 hours to enjoy the paradise that is Templar’s Park and once time is up you will be taken back to your hotel.

Packages.PackageDesc: Transit Tour: Kuala Lumpur including Petronas Towers

PackageDetails.overview: Are you at Kuala Lumpur International Airport for a 6 or more hour transit? Let a local representative structure a tour for you to cater for the duration of your short stay! The tour will begin with an airport pickup and then you will be taken on a short trip to Putrajaya (the Federal capital of Malaysia). You’ll be given a city tour the will include the famous sky bridge and observation desk of Petronas Twin Towers! Don’t worry about missing your flights because we will bring you back to the airport safely and on time.

highlights.highlightItem: Customizable layover tour from Kuala Lumpur International Airport.
Experience the best of the city with a private guide.
Spend a hassle-free day seeing the sights Explore Malaysia's culture and history.
Overview of the city, perfect for first-time visitors.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The tour will begin with a warm welcome at Kuala Lumpur International Airport. You will be taken to Putrajaya, the Administrative Capital of Malaysia. Enjoy a wonderful hour long stay at Putrajaya, seeing sites such as Putarajaya Lake, Pink Mosque, Prime Minister Office and Seri Wawasan Bridge.

The journey will continue to Kuala Lumpur, which is only a 45 minute drive from Putrajaya. You will be taken to see the incredible Petronas Towers. Look up and marvel at the perfectly symmetrical twin structures. The towers are an impressive 88-stories tall and have multifaceted steel walls and twin spires built as an integral part of the structure strengthened by a sky bridge. The building was designed by the world renowned Argentinian American Cesar Pelli. Go up the Twin Towers and enjoy magnificent views of city, walk on the sky bridge and observation deck.

The tour will then proceed on to the beautiful Lake Gardens. On the way you can view the National Monument, commemorating Malaysia's struggle sacrifice made during World War II and the Malaysian Parliament House. Don’t forget to stop over and admire the modern construction of the National Mosque, the pleasant Moorish architecture of the Kuala Lumpur Railway Station.
You will also visit the six-tiered Chinese landmark of Thean Hou Temple built to match some of the temples in Mainland China, a grand structure that not fail to impress you.
Once this is done you will be returned to the airport.

inclusion.item: A short trip in federal capital Putrajaya.
Private city tour in Kuala Lumpur.

Packages.PackageDesc: 2-Day Malacca and Port Dickson Beach Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Get to know the unique, UNESCO listed city of Malacca with this overnight city tour! Malacca was listed as a UNESCO city due to its rich heritage and history with numerous influences that have affected the culture, architecture, and religions of the city. These influences were Portuguese, Dutch, Japanese, British, Chinese, Arabian, and Indian. Join this tour for the chance to immerse you in the diverse culture, seeing sites such as St Peter's Church, Stadthuys, Cheng Hoon Teng and more!

highlights.highlightItem: All entrance fees included.
All taxes, fuel surcharges and service fees included.
Fully narrated tour.
Led by a local guide.
Breakfast included.
Lunch included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Day 1: Your day will start with a pickup from your hotel. We will depart for Malacca at 9:00am. On arrival, visit the oldest Catholic church St Peter's Church, the Dutch Square called Stadthuys where the Dutch Governor and his entourage lived. It is now a museum, Christ church is located within this vicinity.
Visit the oldest Chinese temple - Cheng Hoon Teng which professes 3 doctrines namely Taoism, Confucianism and Buddhism.
Take a stroll through the famous Jonkers' Street - the street of antiquities for shopping of little handicrafts for souvenir keeping.

Lunch will be a signature dish called Baba Nyonya - a unique cuisine with a mixture of Chinese and Malay. Proceed to the A Famosa - the Portuguese built Fort which was destroyed by the Dutch during their reign.
At 3:00pm we will depart for the beach and check into a nice beach hotel. The beach and swimming pool beckons. Enjoy the rest of you day relaxing there.
Day 2: Enjoy breakfast at the hotel and free leisure time to explore until 12 noon . Here you have the option to be transferred to either the airport or back to Kuala Lumpur.

Packages.PackageDesc: 2-Day Private Tour of Malacca from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Discover traditional culture and colonial heritage in Malaysia on this private 2-day tour of Malacca from Kuala Lumpur. Visit palm oil and rubber plantations with your private guide. Spend time in a local village to learn of local customs and heritage, and enjoy free time to explore bustling Malacca at your leisure. Admire top attractions including Stadthuys and the Porta de Santiago, and climb St Paul’s Hill for fine views over the beautiful Strait of Malacca. Visit the town’s oldest functioning Taoist temple and delve into Chinatown’s vibrant Jonker Street.

highlights.highlightItem: 2-Day tour of Malacca with a private guide.
Learn about Malacca's Portuguese and Dutch influences on a guided city walking tour.
Visit St Paul's Church, the Porta de Santiago fortress, the Stadthuys and the Chen Hoon Teng Taoist temple.
Stroll along Jonker Street to browse shops and sample local foods.
Enjoy your guide's informative commentary about the sites you visit.
Relax on a scenic drive through the countryside and stop at Morten Village to witness old Malay customs and traditions.
Overnight accommodation, transportation and hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Day 1: Kuala Lumpur – Malacca.

To begin your 2-day tour, you will be picked up from your Kuala Lumpur hotel for a 2-hour (approx.) drive to Malacca. Your guide will take you first to the outskirts of Malacca to discover what life is like outside the main town. Listen to your guide’s knowledgeable commentary as you pass by rubber and oil palm plantations, paddy fields and quaint Malay villages (kampongs) with houses built on stilts. Stop at Morten Village, a typical Malay kampong that still displays old Malay customs, such as constructing houses on stilts Arrive in Malacca and check into your hotel. Afterward, the rest of the night is yours to explore Malacca at your leisure or relax in your hotel.
Overnight: Equatorial Hotel or similar in Malacca.
Day 2: Malacca - Kuala Lumpur (B).

After breakfast, your private guide will take you on a walking tour of the city center rife with historical monuments. Visit Stadthuys, known as the Dutch Square, as it was built in 1650 by Dutch occupants. Walk past Porta de Santiago, one of the surviving gates of the historic A’Famosa Portuguese fortress. Walk up St Paul’s Hill for a panoramic view of the Strait of Malacca and the old town of Bandar Hilir. Atop the hill, see the ruins of St Paul’s Church, lined by 17th-century Dutch tombstones.

Follow your guide on a 15-minute walk to Cheng Hoon Teng, Malacca's oldest functioning Taoist temple, with prayer halls boasting rich decors. Then, stroll along the lively pathways of Jonker Street in the heart of Chinatown, where vendors are selling various souvenir items and local delicacies.

At your guide’s suggestion, choose to have lunch at a local restaurant (own expense) in any of the towns you pass on your way back to Kuala Lumpur. You’ll arrive back at your hotel in Kuala Lumpur by late afternoon or early evening.

inclusion.item: Transport by air-conditioned minivan or coach, depending on group size.
Meals as per itinerary (B=breakfast, L=lunch, D=dinner).

Packages.PackageDesc: Full Day: Heritage Tour of Malacca from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Come and experience the charms of old Malacca. This UNESCO World Heritage site preserves the rich multi-layered history of the city, from the Portuguese, Dutch and British traders to the Malays who mixed with Indian and Chinese immigrants forming the unique cultures and communities. Architecture of many traditions mixes with lively living heritage and local delicacies, making a visit to Malacca truly unforgettable.

highlights.highlightItem: Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Snacks and Beverages included.
Vegetarian meal option available.
Led by a local guide.
Small-group tour.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Malacca (or Melaka in modern Malaysia) has always been a strategic crossroad between east and west. When the Sultanate of Malacca fell to the Portuguese in 1511, it became the first European outpost on the Straits of Malacca. Over the centuries, the Dutch replaced the Portuguese and the British replaced the Dutch, while the port's key role in trade across Asia brought immigrants from China and India, as well as Malays. Chinese and Malay traditions merged to form what is known today as Baba Nyonya culture; Indians and Malays formed the Chitty community.

Each group maintains its own beliefs and traditions and a vibrant blending of cultures that is typically Malaccan. The city is host to Malaysia's oldest Chinese and Hindu temples and the country's oldest Catholic Church.

Other highlights of the tour include the grand Baba Nyonya houses along Heeren Street and Jonker Street's quaint storefronts, the Dutch architecture of Stadthuys or “Red” Square and the sites of St Paul's Church and the A Famosa fort, both of which date back to Portuguese times.

The tour also features Malacca's living heritage, the traditional trades that endure despite the city's rapid modernization. You'll also enjoy the unique flavours of delicious Malaccan food along the old streets of the city.

PackageDetails.overview: Overview Important Info Hotel Pickup This private full-day tour of historical Malacca from Kuala Lumpur was designed with history buffs in mind. The flexibility and personalization of a private guide means you can explore Malaysia’s oldest trading port with convenience and ease. Gain a deeper understanding of how the Portuguese, Dutch and English influenced the state of Malacca as you explore the streets. Sample local cuisine and regional flavours with a traditional lunch before you return to Kuala Lumpur in your private, air-conditioned vehicle.

highlights.highlightItem: Explore colorful and old trading port of Malacca on this private full-day tour from Kuala Lumpur.
Your own English-speaking guide.
Walk through the ruins of St. Paul's Church.
Visit the oldest Chinese temple in Malaysia, Cheng Hoon Teng.
Lunch at a local restaurant.
Hotel pickup and drop off.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The colorful and historic port town of Malacca is located roughly two hours south of Kuala Lumpur. This private full-day tour of historical Malacca transports you from one of the nation’s biggest cities to its third smallest state for a whirlwind cultural experience. Follow your expert local guide on a private tour through the trading ports that have existed through English, Dutch and Portuguese rule. Learn about the role this port played in commerce as your guide shares insight and history throughout the tour.

You’ll visit St. Paul’s Hill, where panoramic views of the historic state and the old town of Bandar Hilir prove th perfect photo op. Get an up-close look at the Portuguese Fort de Santiago and the ruins of St. Paul’s Chuch, as well the Dutch tombstones that line the grounds.

Once you’ve taken in the sites, head to a local restaurant with your guide where you’ll enjoy a savory lunch (included) of regional specialties that blend Chinese and Malay flavors. Wander along Jonker Street and comb through some of the unique shops before making your way back to Kuala Lumpur. En route to your hotel, you’ll make a stop at the Cheng Hoon Teng temple—the oldest Chinese temple in the country. This unique destination offers incredible views of Kampong Kling, a nearby Malay village.

Packages.PackageDesc: Historical Malacca Full-Day Tour from Kuala Lumpur including Lunch

PackageDetails.overview: Visit historic Malacca City, the capital of the Malaysian state of Malacca, on this guided, full-day sightseeing tour from Kuala Lumpur. Visit some of the most popular top sites in this UNESCO World Heritage City, like the 16th-century, Portuguese St. Paul’s Church and A Famosa fortress, Christ Church, the Stadthuys in the Red Square and much more. Enjoy a traditional Malaysian lunch and explore Jonker Street, the centre street of Chinatown. Hotel pickup and drop-off and any necessary entrance fees are included.

highlights.highlightItem: Day trip to Malacca from Kuala Lumpur.
Walk up St Paul's Hill and visit the ruins of St Paul's Church.
Get panoramic views of the Malacca Strait and Bandar Hilir.
Savor a typical Nyonya lunch in a local restaurant.
Stroll through antique row of Jonker Street and take in the bustling street market.
Learn the history of this important colonial port from your knowledgeable guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: After a Kuala Lumpur hotel pickup, travel approximately two hours south in a comfortable, air-conditioned motor coach for a full day of sightseeing in Malacca City on the Malay Peninsula's southwest coast.

Begin with a visit to the Stadthuys, a historical landmark structure located in the heart of Malacca City in the Red Square. Then take in a panoramic view of Malacca City and the surrounding region from the top of St. Paul’s Hill, which features historic St. Paul’s Church, the oldest church building in Malaysia and Southeast Asia and part of the Malacca Museum Complex.

Enjoy a traditional Malaysian lunch at a local eatery, then follow the guide to Jonker Street, the center street of Chinatown. Once renowned for its antique shops, Jonker Street now features clothing and craft outlets as well as restaurants.

Finally, visit the A Famosa fortress, which is among the oldest surviving European architectural remains in southeast Asia, and stop at Cheng Hoon Teng, a Chinese temple practicing the Three Doctrinal Systems of Taoism, Confucianism and Buddhism.
The tour ends with a return trip to Kuala Lumpur.

Packages.PackageDesc: Historical Malacca Day Trip from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Take a step back in time with this fascinating tour of the historical city of Malacca. Malacca city is a UNESCO World Heritage site. Founded in 1400, Malacca was once one of the greatest trading ports in Southeast Asia. With strong Portuguese, Dutch, and British influences, Malacca is now left with rich heritage and a unique mix of architectural styles. Visit the street of Harmony where you can view the oldest Chinese Temple and Hindu Temple in Malaysia. Walk through the ruins of St Paul’s Church where St Francis Xavier was once buried. Malacca is unlike anything else and you will not want to miss a visit to this amazing, historical city.

highlights.highlightItem: Full-day tour to Malacca, from Kuala Lumpur.
See the biggest Chinese cemetery from the 17th century located outside of China.
Learn the story behind the fortress A’Famosa (Porta De Santiago).
Stroll around Red Square where the Dutch administrative headquarters once stood.
View religious sites including Cheng Hoon Teng Temple, Christ Church and the ruins of St Paul’s Church.
Relax during lunch at a popular local restaurant.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will begin with a 9:30am departure from your Kuala Lumpur hotel. The journey to Malacca is about 2 and a half hours but there will be a short stop for refreshments along the way.

Upon arrival, you will see St Peter’s Church – the oldest Christian church still in use in Malaysia, built in 1710. You will then drive past the largest 17th century Chinese cemetery outside of China, located at Chinese Hill (Bukit China). There will be a short stop at the foothill so you can view the Sultan's Well before driving through the Portuguese Settlement. You will proceed to view the famous gateway Porta De Santiago and the ruins of St Paul’s Church which is lined by 17th century Dutch tombstones.

Next on the list is the Red Square - the salmon pink Dutch administrative building which today houses the Malacca Museum and some other government offices. You will then be taken to see Christ Church.

After Christ Church you will enjoy a delicious lunch at a local restaurant. After your lunch, you will be taken to visit the Adobe of the Green Merciful Clouds (Cheng Hoon Teng Temple). Cheng Hoon Teng Temple is the only temple where you can find 3 major doctrines of local Chinese belief under the same roof – Taoism, Buddhism and Confucianism.
After all of this, you will be given the opportunity to take a stroll along Malacca’s antique street which ends by the banks of the Malacca River.

PackageDetails.overview: Join this private day trip to Malacca city, an approximately 2-hour drive from Kuala Lumpur. You will learn and discover the city with a rich trading history and multicultural heritage. Visit to the popular attractions such as St. Paul’s Church, Stadthuys, A Famosa and tasting variety of local food at Jonker Street.

highlights.highlightItem: Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Private tour is operated with just your party and a guide/driver.
Great overview and orientation of the city.
Family friendly.
Step back in time on a history tour.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The trip starts with pick you up at your hotel lobby around 9am and head to the Malacca city.

After about 2-hour drive, you will reach our first tourist attraction, Stadthuys. A lovely old and well preserved building with a Dutch historical past located in the heart of Malacca  city.You will find many trishaw awaiting and transporting tourists around, and a great place to take photos.
Then, we will move on and take a panoramic view of the city and surrounding from the top of St. Paul’s hill, which features the historic of St. Paul Church.

After a break for lunch (at your own expense), you will follow our guide to explore Jonker Street located in Chinatown. The Jonker Street is Malacca’s epicentre and you can find many antique shops, clothing, craft outlet as well as restaurants. You can try an authentic and delicious Malacca dessert “Chendol” (shaved ice with green jelly noodle, red beans, palm sugar and coconut milks).

A Famosa fortress, it is part of Malacca’s treasure and it is among the oldest surviving European architectural remains in South-East Asia. We will stop at Cheng Hoon Teng, a Chinese temple practicing the Three Doctrinal Systems of Taoism, Confucianism and Buddhism.
The tour ends with a return trip to Kuala Lumpur with estimated 2-hour drive subjects to traffic situation on the highway.

inclusion.item: Professional English speaking driver and guide.
Transportation in the air conditioned vehicle.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Full Day Malacca Tour including Lunch from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: This full day tour starts in Kuala Lumpur and brings you to Malacca which was once colonized by the Portuguese, Dutch, British and the Japanese during their occupation over a period of 400 years. Visit the Dutch Square with the pink colored Stadthuys, Christ Church, Clock Tower and the Queen Victoria Fountain. You will also see the Cheng Hoon Teng temple, which is the oldest functioning Chinese temple in Malaysia that was founded in 1645. The Porta De Santiago, the Gate to the Portuguese fortress La Formosa, built in 1511, the St. Paul’s Church where St. Francis Xavier was once buried and many more interesting sites would also be worth a look. After a local lunch, you will have time to stroll around the Jonker Street, famous for its Malaccan antiques before returning to your hotel in Kuala Lumpur.

highlights.highlightItem: Full-day private tour of Malacca, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Visit historic landmarks such as Cheng Hoon Teng Temple, St Paul’s Church and Kampung Kling Mosque.
View the oldest Hindu temple in Malaysia.
Enjoy lunch with traditional Peranakan dishes.
Hear personalized commentary from the driver-guide.
Hotel pickup and drop-off by private vehicle from Kuala Lumpur.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Journey by road from Kuala Lumpur to the historic city of Malacca and spend the day exploring this UNESCO World Heritage site. In the morning visit the delightfully named Harmony Street, home to the Cheng Hoon Teng Temple, which is the oldest Chinese temple in Malaysia; the Kampung Kling Mosque; and the Hindu Sri Poyyatha Vinayagar Moorthi Temple.
Your next stop will be the city’s historic Square of Malacca that is lined with fine examples of Dutch colonial architecture.

Later this morning your group will head up to the top of the hill to witness the panoramic view over the city, before visiting the cultural Portuguese Square, which plays host to a number of food stalls and restaurants.

You will have the opportunity to sample a traditional Peranakan lunch, which is a unique combination of Malay and Chinese cuisine. The day’s exploration concludes with some time spent wandering along Tun Tan Cheng Lok – a narrow road lined by ancient shop houses before returning back to your hotel in Kuala Lumpur.

PackageDetails.overview: Join this private day trip to Malacca from Kuala Lumpur to explore the heritage buildings and learn some history back in time when the Portuguese, Dutch and British were in power with their type of living quarters and culture. You will be picked up from the hotel lobby in Kuala Lumpur city area and head to Malacca at 9am, it will take approximately 2-hour drive. Lunch is included and you will be transported back to your hotel after the trip.

highlights.highlightItem: Lunch included.
Private tour is operated with just your party and a guide/driver.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.
Family friendly.
Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Great overview and orientation of the city.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This trip starts with a pickup at your hotel lobby located in Kuala Lumpur city area around 9am. We will then depart to Malacca city, it will take approximately 2-hour drive. Upon arrival, the first stop is St. Paul hill/ Ruins of St.Paul. St. Paul's Church is a historic church building in Malacca, Malaysia that was originally built in 1521, making it the oldest church building in Malaysia and Southeast Asia. We will have a quick stop at open tomb of St. Francis Xavier.

Next is the Stadthuys (an old Dutch spelling, meaning city hall) is a historical structure situated in the heart of Malacca City, the administrative capital of the state of Malacca, Malaysia in a place known as the Red Square. The Stadhuys is known for its red exterior and nearby red clock-tower. It was built by the Dutch occupants in 1650 as the office of the Dutch Governor and Deputy Governor.

Visit to Christ Church, an 18th-century Anglican Church in the city of Malacca, Malaysia. It is the oldest functioning Protestant church in Malaysia and is within the jurisdiction of the Lower Central Archdeaconry of the Anglican Diocese of West Malaysia.

We will then move on to the Malacca River, which flows through the middle of Malacca City in the Malaysian state of Malacca, was a vital trade route during the heyday of Malacca Sultanate in the 15th century.

Jalan Tokong Besi in Chinatown is also called Harmony Street because Temples and Mosques of the three main religions of Malaysia are located peacefully in the same small street. Then, you will visit a Hindu Temple (Sri Poyatha Moorthi Temple) is the oldest Hindu temple in Malaysia and one of the oldest functioning Hindu temples in Maritime Southeast Asia. Located in the state of Malacca, the temple is one of the few existing Chitty temples in Malaysia.

The Malacca Chinese Mosque is a Chinese-style mosque in Krubong, Malacca, Malaysia. The mosque is the third Chinese-style mosque in Malaysia after the ones in Kelantan and Perak. You will explore the Cheng Hoon Teng temple (a Chinese temple) practicing the Three Doctrinal Systems of Taoism, Confucianism, and Buddhism. You will be able to try variety of local food, shop and see the different local good at The Jonker Walk (Malay: Persiaran Jonker) is the Chinatown street of Malacca. Finally, a visit to Heeren Street is 18th-century Dutch-period residential house was restored as a model conservation project.
After complete above sights our guide will drop you at your staying hotel in Kuala Lumpur safely.

inclusion.item: Private tour with professional and experience English speaking guide.
Round-trip transfer from your hotel lobby in Kuala Lumpur city area only

Do not worry about finding your way to the taxi’s while carrying a big luggage as your private driver will be waiting for you in the arrival terminal holding  a sign with your name on it. While driving you can enjoy the rural and urban areas of Port Dickson and might pass by the famous Tanjung Tuan Forrest or the iconic Cape Rachado Lighthouse.

Packages.PackageDesc: 4-Day Highlights of Malaysia Tour from Kuala Lumpur to Penang

PackageDetails.overview: This is a comprehensive 4 day tour covering highlights of Malaysia and is perfect for anyone with limited time. Stay at 3-4 star hotels with meals included. We start from Kuala Lumpur and head out to the Taman Negara National Park. Taman Negara is a tropical rain forest with a 130 million year history! Activities include a canopy walk through the rain forest, trekking and a visit to an ethnic aborigine village deep in the forest. Our second day takes us up to the Cameron Highlands, well known for its cooler temperatures with tea plantations, flower gardens, fruit orchards and stunning waterfalls. Our last and final stop is in Penang, known as the pearl of the Orient with some of the best beaches. Penang is also a food haven with lots of activities and places to visit.

highlights.highlightItem: Free drinks included.
Hotel pickup included.
Lunch included.
Vegetarian meal option available.
Fully narrated tour.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.
Once-in-a-Lifetime Experience.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Day 1 - Kuala Lumpur to Taman Negara, staying at a 3 star hotel available at that point of time. Taman Negara National Park 1938 is a 130 million years old tropical rain forest with plenty of animals like tigers, elephants and tapirs to see. There are over 14,000 flowering plants and 300 different species of birds. The objective of the park is to protect and conserve the eco system with its rivers, waterfalls, secret caves, rolling hills with lush greenery. 7.00am: Depart for Taman Negara. 10.30am: On arrival we do the canopy walkway, trek up Teresek hills, enjoy some snacks in the forest and then get into a boat for rapids shooting and visit an aborigine village to watch their fire making and blowpipe techniques. 4.00pm: Return to floating cafe for lunch and check in to hotel. 7.00pm: Dinner at a floating cafe followed by a night jungle walk. 10.00pm: Back to the hotel.

Day 2 - Taman Negara to the Cameron Highlands, staying at a 3 star hotel available at that point of time.  Cameron Highlands is a hill resort with temperatures from 10 - 25 degrees celcius. Camerons is known for its farmlands, tea plantations, flower nurseries, fruit orchards and waterfalls. 8am: Check out and depart for the Cameron Highlands. 12pm: Lunch followed by a Cameron Highlands tour, viewing tea plantations, a strawberry farm, butterfly farm, insectarium, cactus and flower gardens, vegetable and fruit market. 5pm: Check in to hotel. 7pm: Dinner, the 'hot pot' - a signature dish in the Camerons suits well for the cold weather. 10pm: Back to hotel.

Day 3 - Cameron Highlands to Penang, staying at a 3 star hotel available at that point of time.  The island was founded by Sir Francis Light in 1786 and is now known as the pearl of the orient. Penang is a beautiful island listed as a UNESCO site and has many historical sights to be visited. The main town is Georgetown which was a multi cultural heritage and trading port. Penang is also well known as a food haven. 8am: Depart for Penang and take a ferry ride into the island. Visit the clan jetty - a picturesque fishing village with wooden houses on stilts and planked walkways built over water.   1pm  Lunch and visit the KhooKongsi - a clan house temple. Then take a trishaw ride to Fort Cornwallis through Georgetown to feel the heritage rich city,  then proceeding to the 33 meters long Reclining Buddha. 5pm: Check in to hotel. Free and easy. End of tour.
Day 4 - Penang 12pm: Check out and continue your own journey.

Packages.PackageDesc: 4-Day Penang Heritage Tour with Malaysian Cooking Class

PackageDetails.overview: Uncover Penang’s rich colonial heritage with a 4-day tour of UNESCO-listed Georgetown, including accommodation and hotel pick-up. Ride a trishaw around Georgetown’s colonial centre; explore the vibrant shops and street food stalls of Little India and Chinatown; and admire architectural wonders like KhooKongsi, Pinang Peranakan Mansion and Fort Corwallis. Finally, discover the fragrant spices and unique Chinese and Peranakan influences of Malaysian cuisine with a cooking class at the Tropical Spice Garden Cooking School. This small-group tour is limited to six people for a personalized experience.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-night Penang tour including UNESCO-listed Georgetown.
Take an authentic trishaw ride past colonial landmarks and stroll by colorful shops in Little India.
Explore Fort Cornwallis and the Pinang Peranakan Mansion with historical commentary by an informative guide.
Visit KhooKongsi, a Chinese clan house in Penang’s Chinatown.
Learn to prepare Malaysian cuisine in a hands-on cooking class using savoury flavours from the Tropical Spice Garden.
Includes airport pickup and drop-off.
Small-group tour limited to six participants ensures a personalized experience.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Enjoy your choice of single, twin-share or triple-share accommodations on this 3-day tour of Penang and the UNESCO-listed capital of Georgetown. Your stay includes three breakfasts plus a cooking lesson with lunch and one dinner at a restaurant.

At Cititel Hotel Penang, furnished guest rooms are equipped broadband internet access, an electronic safe, a LCD TV with selected satellite channels and essential toiletries, among other amenities that make it a comfortable stay.
Please note: A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Day 1: Penang - After pickup in Penang, you’re transferred to your hotel for check-in, and then the afternoon is free to spend at your leisure. In the evening, join your guide to explore the streets of Georgetown on a slow ride by trishaw, which takes you past historical buildings of the colonial era. Learn about Penang’s rich architectural heritage as you coast past UNESCO-listed landmarks all the way to Little India. Enjoy a stroll through Little India, a bustling enclave teeming with shops selling traditional wares, saris and handicrafts. Then proceed by coach to a hawker center where you can buy famous Penang dishes like satay (skewered and grilled meat served with sauce) and char koayteow (a stir-fried noodle dish) for dinner. Overnight: Cititel Hotel or similar in Penang.

Day 2: Penang (B, L, D) - After breakfast at your hotel, head out in the morning to a wet market and take in the heady scent of fresh herbs and cooking spices like curry leaf, coriander and tamarind before your cooking class begins. Upon arrival at the Tropical Spice Garden Cooking School, settle in at your custom-built workstation, tucked away in a secluded corner of the gardens, surrounded by jungle, where you can catch a glimpse of the Andaman Sea. An experienced chef introduces you to Malay, Indian or Peranakan (also called Nyonya) cuisine — a combination of Chinese, Malay and other influences that create a unique blend of tangy and spicy flavours. Under the guidance of your professional instructor, learn to concoct refreshing beverages and cook local favourites from scratch, such as nasilemak (a coconut milk–based rice dish), assamlaksa (a fish-based soup) and tandoori chicken. Engulfed in a cloud of fragrant aromas, enjoy the fruits of your labour as lunch is served on the Pavilion. After your meal, relax over an activity-free afternoon before you meet up with the group for dinner at a restaurant featuring the best of authentic Penang Peranakan cuisine. Overnight: Cititel Hotel or similar in Penang.

Day 3: Penang (B) - After your morning breakfast, set off on a Georgetown sightseeing tour of UNESCO World Heritage sites. Your guide takes you on a drive through Penang’s historical downtown, featuring prominent landmarks of interest. Your first stop is in Chinatown at KhooKongsi, a magnificent clan house surrounded by terrace houses and shops. Once part of a network of Chinese clan associations established during the mid-19th century in Malaysia, the traditional building showcases intricate woodwork of master craftsmen. After learning about this architectural heritage from your guide, head to Pinang Peranakan Mansion, built at the end of the 19th century. Following decades of neglect, the stately home was restored to its former glory and now incorporates an eclectic style of Chinese wood-carved panels, English floor tiles and Scottish ironworks. As you tour the opulent heritage home with more than 1,000 antiques on display, hear about the lifestyle and customs of the Peranakans, a prominent community also known as Straits Chinese. Next up is Fort Corwallis, established by the English East India Company after the 1786 arrival of Captain Francis Light. Follow your guide on foot around the fort’s perimeter of 10-foot-high (3-meter) walls and head inside for a look at the century-old chapel, prison cells, munitions storage, bronze canons and flagstaff. At the end of your tour, you can enjoy various street arts and further indulge in street food unique to Penang (own expense). Perhaps try curry mee (thin noodles in curry broth) or bite into delicious desserts like ice kachang (shaved ice that includes jelly, red beans and sweet corn). Your afternoon and evening are free to spend as you wish. Select your own choice of cuisine for dinner; perhaps trying Mamak (Indian Muslim), Hainan/Hakka (Chinese), Malay or international dishes (own expense). Overnight: Cititel Hotel or similar in Penang.
Day 4: Penang (B) - Enjoy breakfast and a morning at your leisure until it’s time for your departure. You can get dropped off at your next hotel, if necessary.

inclusion.item: Meals as per itinerary (B=breakfast, L=lunch, D=dinner).

Packages.PackageDesc: 4-Hour Georgetown Food Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Be a part of an exclusive group as you venture through Malaysia's Georgetown Heritage area. Be hungry for food and knowledge as your local Penang-born tourist and food guide walks you through each step of the way on this food trail. Savor delicious local cuisine which the forefathers of Georgetown has kept alive as we unveil the history and heritage of this area. End the food trail by mixing up a cocktail or mocktail with the guide of a bartender. Be ready to eat, learn, drink and have fun!

highlights.highlightItem: Small group ensures personal service.
Free drinks included.
Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The 4-hour heritage and food trail takes place during sundown at 4.30pm. You'll be meeting the guide at St.George's Church along Lebuh Farquhar. You will be learning about the history of Georgetown as the group walks by several historical places and buildings such as the St.George's church, the Goddess of Mercy Temple and Chinese Clan Houses.

The tour will be stopping by at least 3 food outlets, tasting at least 10 varieties of local and heritage food of Georgetown before ending the trail at one of the best cocktail bars in Georgetown. You will be guided by a bartender on how to shake up a cocktail / mocktail, using locally grown spices and ingredients.
5 important steps that you're encouraged to take to make this tour a memorable one:
subItem: Chat up your guide - Your guide is born and bred in Penang and loves to chat and communicate. It's highly encouraged to have a Q&A session throughout the tour, talking about your likes and dislikes. This food trail is for you and the operator would like to ensure that you have a good time.
Be adventurous - Keep an open mind to try out new things as you walk through the core zone of the heritage area of Georgetown.
Come hungry - Be rest assured that you will be sinking in your teeth into delicious local food. This tour won't stop until you are full.
Be involved - Get behind the bar and shake up a cocktail! The cocktail expert will guide you in making a glass of complimentary cocktail which uses local ingredients.
Have Fun - Enjoy the food trail, kick back and relax as you feel at home in Georgetown.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Please advise any specific dietary requirements at time of booking Vegetarian option is available, please advise at time of booking.
if required A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.
A moderate amount of walking is involved.
Tips to enjoy Simply Enak's food tour:
BE HUNGRY, BE OPEN.
Make sure you come hungry when you join the food experience and be open to foods introduced by the guide.
WEAR COMFORTABLE SHOES.
The food experience tours are normally walking trails. It's advises that guests wear comfortable shoes during the food experience.
BRING YOUR WATER BOTTLE.
Water helps during the tour especially during hot weather. Its very easy to get thirsty in Malaysia.
UMBRELLA AND RAINCOAT.
Malaysia's weather can be unpredictable. Please bring your own umbrella or raincoat if its raining or going to rain.
AVOID WEARING WHITE.
There's nothing worse than spilling food on a white t-shirt. If you don't mind the stain, you can always wear white.

Packages.PackageDesc: A Taste of Penang: Small Group Food Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Experience a world of Asian flavours on this 3-hour culinary walking tour in Penang. Visit local coffee shops, spice markets and food vendors with your guide. Admire stalls bursting with fresh fruit, seafood and vegetables, and sample delicious local delicacies such as prawn fritters and rice cooked in coconut milk. Listen as your guide sheds light on Penang’s street-food culture and visit the city’s oldest Indian Muslim restaurant. Numbers are limited to a maximum of 12 people on this small-group tour, to ensure a personalized experience with your guide.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour walking tour of Penang street food, led by an expert guide.
Stop at famed food spots and savor more than a dozen tastings of traditional Malay, Chinese and Indian cuisine.
Visit one of Penang’s oldest Chinese coffee shops and Indian Muslim restaurants for a sense of the city’s diversity.
Learn about the preparation of authentic Penang dishes like flat rice noodles, prawn fritters and deep-fried pork rolls.
Bite into Southeast Asian fruits, such as mouthwateringrambutan and mangosteen, at a produce market.
Explore old city streets and learn about Penang’s preserved heritage sites.
Visit a Penang market to purchase treats to take back home.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet your guide and small group at Soho Free House on Penang Road, and begin your 3-hour food tour of Penang with a traditional Malay breakfast. Walk to one of the city’s oldest Malaysian-Chinese coffee shops, known locally as a kopitiam, where you’ll sample nasilemak (rice cooked in coconut milk) with chili paste and a boiled egg.

While visiting one of Penang’s most popular vendors, sink your teeth into prawn fritters and lobak, a deep-fried, spiced pork roll that’s a delicacy in Nonya cuisine. Then stroll to one of Penang’s oldest markets, overflowing with seafood, fruits, vegetables and dried goods. Sample a variety of preserved fruits and taste seasonal produce such as rambutan, mangosteen, dukong and — if you’re daring enough — durian (known for its strong odor).

Explore historical streets with preserved heritage buildings and hidden back lanes, listening as your foodie guide describes Penang’s diverse street food culture along the way. You’ll have the opportunity to taste specialties like assamlaksa (rice noodles in sour fish soup), char kueyteow (fried flat rice noodles) and murtabak (bread with meat fillings) in Penang’s oldest Indian Muslim restaurant, dating back to 1907. Watch how crullers (fried pastry), called yutiao, are made, and feast your eyes on the array of salted fish at a local vendor in one of Penang’s earliest low-income housing estates.

When it comes time for dessert, dig into a cool bowl of cendol, a serving of ice shavings with green doughy strips and red beans covered with coconut milk. Make sure to try one of the local non-alcoholic drinks: hot tehtarik (pulled tea), lime juice with sour plum, nutmeg juice and more.
Your tour ends at a market, where you can purchase items to take home with you. (Check your country’s import laws to confirm what food products are permitted for travellers).
Please note: A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.

AdditionalInfo.info: Minimum age is 6 years.
Adult pricing applies to all travellers.
A maximum of 12 people per booking.
A moderate amount of walking is involved. Please wear a comfortable walking shoes.

Packages.PackageDesc: Eat Like A Local: Penang Night Street Food Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Indulge your taste buds and eat like a local on this 3.5-hour evening street food tour in Penang. Step off the beaten track and mingle with the locals buying fresh snacks from food hawkers. Stop at four or five food carts with your guide and sample some of the tasty treats Malaysians love. Perhaps taste brown-sugar biscuits, spiced pork rolls or fresh guava, and gain insight into the herbs and spices used. Learn of the diverse Chinese and Indian influences Malaysian street food embraces, and sip refreshing tropical fruit juices.

highlights.highlightItem: Private street food tour in Penang.
Watch night hawkers serve up their best Penang street food.
Indulge in Malaysian cuisine — a cultural fusion of dishes.
Enjoy 15 to 18 tastings at four or five stops Learn about Penang’s culinary history from a knowledgeable local guide.
Travel by comfortable air-conditioned vehicle.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: After you meet your local guide at Prangin Mall in Penang, set out on your 3.5-hour street food tour of Georgetown. Your private party will travel by air-conditioned vehicle to local hot spots bustling with street stalls and food hawkers who roll out their carts at night.

Explore the back lanes of Penang off the beaten track, where you’ll make four or five stops to taste delightful snacks, drinks and desserts. Along the way, listen to your foodie guide describe the street-food phenomenon of Penang.

Infused with a variety of spices, Malaysian food showcases Malay, Chinese and Indian flavours. Try traditional fritters such as prawn, tofu or yam; bite into Penang lobak, a spiced deep-fried pork roll; slurp signature noodles; and sample delicious seafood among other savoury snacks.

When it’s time for dessert, sink your teeth into a sweet Indian pancake called an apom — deliciously crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Or try a bite-sized kuih, a traditional sweet treat made of sticky glutinous rice. Other delectables available are heowpiah (brown-sugar biscuits), coconut tarts and a variety of tropical fruits: jackfruit, assorted guava, coconut, dragon fruit, rambutan and mangosteen.

Drink it all down with a local favorite, choosing from a variety of non-alcoholic options including lime juice with sour plum, nutmeg juice, Chinese herbal tea, grass jelly, chrysanthemum, winter melon, fresh calamansi lime juice with plain or rose syrup, and more!
Your tour ends with return transport by private vehicle to your starting point at Prangin Mall.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

Packages.PackageDesc: ESCAPE Adventureplay Theme Park Entrance Ticket with One-Way Transport

PackageDetails.overview: Get some fresh air and enjoy a fun-filled day of outdoor activities on this 9-hour trip to ESCAPE Adventureplay Theme Park, an award-winning eco-theme park near Penang. This full-day admission pass grants guests of all ages the chance to frolic among this unique park's range of 16 kid-friendly attractions. Zoom through the trees on the rope swing, fly through a ravine on a zipline, slide downhill in a tubby tube or grab a toy in the on-site playroom. Whatever your child's age or ability level there's a fun activity waiting to be explored. This excursion to ESCAPE also includes one-way transport by minivan from Penang.

highlights.highlightItem: ESCAPE Adventureplay Theme Park full-day admission ticket.
Ride a tube downhill on the Tubby Racer or zipline through the canopy on the Flying Lemur.
Balance above the trees on a ropes course called Monkey Business.
Climb the Gecko Tower and take Atan’s Leap through the air.
Hotel pickup by air-conditioned minivan included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Enjoy a fun-filled day at ESCAPE Adventureplay Theme Park, a family-friendly outdoor adventure center located near Penang, with this admission pass and one-way transport (and optional return). It's a great opportunity for the whole family to bond while enjoying some fresh air and delightful outdoor activities.

Start your adventure with a pickup at your Penang hotel around 9am, continuing by air-conditioned minivan to the theme park. When you arrive, listen to a short safety briefing from the staff, then get ready for good times on the park's many attractions, including the human-powered go-kart, rope swings, playroom and ziplines. (See the full list of the attractions in the Itinerary below) When you get hungry, grab a bite at your own expense from among the park's range of tasty food options.

Continue your visit as long as you wish, making your own way back to your Penang hotel when you're ready. You can also make use of the park's free shuttle service to hotels in BatuFeringgi. A public bus from the park offers another alternative. (see Additional Info for more info).

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: Your day at ESCAPE Adventureplay Theme Park includes the following attractions and much more!

Flying Lemur: Tackle 19 challenging elements, including four ziplines, reaching a height of 98 feet (30 meters). You’ll ride the region’s longest zipline as you soar 456 feet (139 meters) across a ravine!
Atan’s Leap: Leap through the air and experience the exhilaration of a rapid descent as you fall with a safe, featherbed-like landing.
Tubby Racer: Tumble downhill on the back of this tubby tube, or link several tubes together—fun for the whole family!

Monkey Business: Learn to climb like a pro and perfect your balancing skills on this challenging ropes course. There are three levels to try—suitable for monkeys of all ages. (Tots Trail offers a mini ropes course for younger kids).
Tarzan’s Rope: Feel the rush of adrenaline as you swing through the trees and see who can reach the farthest.
Gecko Tower: Choose your own path to the top of this tower as you climb. An auto-belay system will keep you safe in case your gecko feet lose their grip.
Zoom Bug: Kids under 12 can race along with friends on a roller racer go-kart, making high-speed turns with this maneuverable ride.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking, unless booked within 3 days of travel. In this case confirmation will be received within 48 hours, subject to availability.
Minimum age is 4 years.
A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.
Not wheelchair accessible.
The park provides a free shuttle service to hotels in Batu Feringgi.

You can choose to take a public bus 102 line (about a 4-min walk from the park) or 101 line (about a 15-min walk from the park) to return to your hotel from the park. Cost is about MYR3 (about US$1). To George Town -- 2.5hrs. To Batu Feringgi -- 40 min.

Packages.PackageDesc: Experience Penang: Learn How to Make Malaysian Handicrafts

PackageDetails.overview: Indulge your creative side as you discover traditional Malaysian handicrafts and craft your own unique souvenirs on this family-friendly 4-hour tour. Enjoy a pewter-making workshop at the Royal Selangor Pewter Shop, where you’ll create a hand-made dish to take home. Then, discover the art of batik and let your imagination run wild as you experiment with colours and patterns to design a handkerchief.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day Penang handicraft experience.
Visit Royal Selangor and learn how to make your own hand-made pewter dish.
See a skilled batik painter create beautiful paintings.
Show off your artistic skills as you paint your own batik handkerchief.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: On this tour, get an in-depth look into two of Malaysia’s most beautiful handicrafts - – pewter and batik paintings. Pewter is made primarily from tin and mixed with copper or lead, and used to produce various items, such as bowls, plates, spoons and candlesticks. Visit the famous pewter shop, the Royal Selangor, and learn the process of turning pewter into works of art. Your instructor will lead you in making your own hand-made pewter dish, which you can bring take home.

Next, try your hand at batik painting. See a local expert batik painter show their style and skill in creating stunning paintings using wax and dyes. Malaysian batik is characterized by the use of a manual wax-resistant dyeing technique to create large floral motifs and vibrant colours. Learn how to create your own unique batik handicraft to take home as a memorable souvenir.

Packages.PackageDesc: Half-Day Penang Countryside Cycling Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Away from the busy Georgetown, the colourful sights and smells of the local villages, the fascinating life of locals and bountiful green environment, Penang countryside is another essence makes this small islands one of Asia's most captivating cities. Join a half-day cycling tour for locals and tourists who want to experience a different side of Penang,BalikPulau is the place for you.

highlights.highlightItem: Cycle the city streets to absorb the local atmosphere.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Family friendly.
Led by a local guide.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Join this small-group cycling tour to explore the different side of Penang, BalikPulau. The tour will start at 7am where we will transfer you to Balik Pulau.

Exploring the town by bicycle has all the advantages of going by foot, combined with a much greater action radius and cooling breeze. If you want to experience BalikPulau hideaways and countryside, touched by the charm of Malaysian way of country life at personal level, bicycle is a great way to do it.

Away from BalikPulau town there is a labyrinth of minor roads, pathways and alleys. Cyclists are treated as pedestrians, so you can use bicycle to explore green paddy field, fruit orchard, plantation, mangrove, fishing village and dozens of traditional Kampung in Balik Pulau.

Exploring the town by bicycle has all the advantages of going by foot, combined with a much greater action radius and cooling breeze. If you want to experience BalikPulau hideaways and countryside, touched by the charm of Malaysian way of country life at personal level, bicycle is a great way to do it.
