Packages.PackageDesc: High Tea on Penang Hill with Private Transfers

PackageDetails.overview: Admire the views from Penang Hill while indulging in a decadent High Tea on this 3-hour private tour from Penang, including hotel pick-up. Ride the world’s oldest funicular railway to the 2,625-foot (800 meter) peak of Penang Hill and enjoy magnificent views over Georgetown as you sip tea and tuck into clotted cream scones at David Brown's Restaurant and Tea Terrace.

highlights.highlightItem: Private 3-hour tour of Penang Hill with high tea.
Ride the Penang Hill Funicular Railway to the summit.
Take in the cool fresh air and panoramic views from atop Penang Hill.
Enjoy English high tea at David Brown's Restaurant and Tea Terrace, overlooking the sights of Georgetown.
Eat delicious scones and crumpets as you sip your tea!
Hotel pickup and drop-off by private vehicle and professional guide included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Begin your private tour in Penang at 2pm with hotel pickup by air-conditioned private vehicle. Your guide will take you straight to the Georgetown station, where you’ll board the Penang Hill Funicular Railway, in operation since 1922. The ride up Penang Hill takes approximately 10 to 20 minutes, with the lush natural landscape on display en route to the top.

When you reach the summit, 2,625 feet (800 meters) above sea level, you’ll appreciate the exhilarating views of Georgetown and mainland Malaysia beyond. Step foot inside David Brown's Restaurant, where your private party will be served English high tea in the cool, refreshing climate.

Marvel at the old-world furnishings and British-style colonial charm of the restaurant, surrounded by greenery, well-manicured gardens and a beautiful lily pond. Enjoy a delightful selection of scones, crumpets, jam and clotted cream with your tea while you are served by the friendly and professional staff. After tea, take a stroll around the summit with your guide before descending on the funicular train and returning to your Penang hotel.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

Packages.PackageDesc: Monkey Beach Excursion including BBQ Lunch from Penang

PackageDetails.overview: Escape the urban landscapes and make your way to sandy shores on this Monkey Beach excursion including BBQ lunch from Penang. You’ll enjoy a quick boat ride over calm and clear waters to an uninhabited Malaysian island for a day of sun, sand and ultimate relaxation. Choose to fish, trek through the jungle or just lounge on the beach before tucking into a delicious BBQ lunch cooked on the beach.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your Monkey Beach excursion including BBQ lunch from Penang kicks off with hotel pick up, where you’ll meet your friendly driver and make your way to crystal blue waters. Enjoy a 30-minute boat ride to an uninhabited island, where you’ll find sandy beaches, coconut trees, monkeys and wildlife. Choose from fishing in the stunning blue waters, taking a jungle trek through the surrounding foothills, or simply relaxing with surf and sun before enjoying a savoury BBQ cooked right on the beach! Your day ends with a return trip to your Penang hotel.

Packages.PackageDesc: Penang City Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Penang is a city that’s as rich in history as it is in culture, tradition and diversity. This city tour highlights all of the best—from colonial-era homes, to private mansions, famous museums and stunning temples. Follow an expert local guide through the famed Little India and Chinatown, wander the halls at Penang Museum and learn about the art of pewtersmiting at the Royal Selangor. Finish your tour at Watt Chayamankalaram, where you’ll be amazed by the giant reclining Buddha.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Join your expert guide and a small group of fellow travellers on this Penang City Bus & Minivan Tour. Journey through colonial Georgetown, where you’ll pay a stop to the famous Fort Cornwallis.Listen as your guide shares insights and stories about most famous historical remains in the city.

Next, make your way to colourful Little India and eclectic Chinatown before paying a visit to the Royal Selangor, where you’ll see local craftsmen fashioning works from pewter. After marvelling at this age-old art, head to WatChayamankalaram, where you’ll find the world’s largest reclining Buddha—one of the tour’s most memorable sights!

Your final stop is the Penang State Museum, where your guide will take you through halls of this colonial-era building and point out artefacts from Malaysia, China and India’s unique past. Choose to return to your hotel, or enjoy shopping at your leisure at Gurney Plaza.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation of this product will be received at time of booking.

Transfers are NOT available to/from Cruise Port.

Packages.PackageDesc: Penang Harmony Food Trail

PackageDetails.overview: Be a part of a small group as you venture through the Georgetown Heritage area on the trail for delicious local food. Make sure to be hungry for food and knowledge as your local Penang-born food guide walks you through each step of the way on this food tour, experiencing both the tangible and non-tangible heritage of Penang. Savour delicious local cuisine, also enjoyed by the forefathers of Georgetown, as we unveil the history of Georgetown.

Packages.PackageDesc: Penang Hill and KekLok Si Buddhist Temple Afternoon Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Experience the best of Penang on this half-day hill and Kek Lok Si Buddhist Temple afternoon tour. Ride the Penang Hill Railway to gain access to scenic views and tour the Pagoda of Ten Thousand Buddhas. Follow your expert guide through the Kek Lok Si Temple and gain insight and understanding into the history and traditions of Penang’s landmarks. Enjoy the ease of round-trip hotel transportation to and from your Penang hotel or the cruise port as part of this popular excursion.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day guided tour of Penang Hill and Kek Lok Si Temple.
Take the funicular railway to the summit of Penang Hill by.
Enjoy sweeping views of Georgetown, Butterworth and mainland Malaysia from Penang Hill.
Explore Southeast Asia's largest Buddhist temple, Kek Lok Si.
Admire the towering statue of Guanyin, Goddess of Mercy Snap photos of the tortoise-filled waters at the Pond of Longevity.
Includes hotel pickup and drop-off.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet your friendly and professional driver and guide at your hotel or cruise port and embark on this Peang Hill and Kek Lok Si Buddhist Temple afternoon tour, where you’ll learn about the history, traditions and practices of this incredible land.

Head off to Georgetown Station where you’ll experience the thrill of riding the Penang Hill Railway. This funicular train climbs to the nation’s oldest hill station and offers incredible views along the way. Keep your eyes peeled for monkeys, birds and other wildlife on the 20-minute ride.

Once you’ve taken in the epic panoramic views from atop Penang Hill—some 2,695 feet (821 meters) about the city—continue your adventure to Kek Lok Si. Known as the Pagoda of Ten Thousand Buddhas, this impressive destination ranks tops among Southeast Asia’s most iconic temples. Stationed near Penang Hill and carved into the side of Air Itam, the seven-tiered architectural masterpiece showcases features from Thai, Chinese and Burmese cultures.

Follow your guide through the temple complex, where you’ll see the bronze statue of the Goddess of Mercy standing some 99 feet (30 meters) tall and the Pond of Longevity, where hundreds of turtles live. Your guide will explain how these hard-shelled amphibians represent strength and endurance in local culture.
Your tour concludes with a return trip to your hotel or cruise port in air-conditioned comfort.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Packages.PackageDesc: Penang Hill Railway Ride and Dinner with Georgetown Views

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy fine food and beautiful views over Georgetown on this 3-hour Penang Hill Railway ride with dinner. Hop aboard the Penang Hill Railway in Georgetown and travel up Penang Hill. Discover English colonial charm at David's Brown restaurant, nestled among beautiful forest and gardens on Penang Hill. Savor a delicious dinner of British or traditional Penang cuisine, and enjoy breathtaking views over the bright lights of Georgetown shimmering and twinkling in the distance. When your meal is over, travel in style by train back to the city.

highlights.highlightItem: Penang Hill dinner experience.
Ride the world's oldest funicular railway system, the Penang Hill Railway.
Enjoy dinner at David Brown's Restaurant, overlooking the night lights of Georgetown.
Capture great photos with panoramic views of Georgetown and glimpses of mainland Malaysia.
Hotel pickup and drop-off and professional guide included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your evening in Penang begins with pickup from your hotel by comfortable air-conditioned vehicle. After being driven to the Georgetown station, board the Penang Hill Railway and travel approximately 10 to 20 minutes up Penang Hill, with views of the surrounding lush mountains on display along the way. Upon arrival at the top, marvel at the old English colonial charm of David's Brown restaurant, tucked away on Penang Hill and surrounded by greenery, well-manicured gardens and a beautiful lily pond. Dig into a delicious dish of either fine British cuisine or traditional Penang specialties. While being served by the friendly and professional staff, admire not only the restaurant's elegant colonial furnishings, but most especially the incredible panoramic view of Georgetown at night. After your delightful meal, board the railway once again and be dropped off at your Penang hotel.

inclusion.item: Roundtrip ticket on Penang Hill Railway.

PackageDetails.overview: Kick back and relax before your flight with this access pass to the Airport Plaza Premium Lounge at Penang International Airport. No matter whether you're traveling near or far, this lounge offers the perfect combination of luxurious amenities. In addition to comfortable seating areas, you'll also have access to shower facilities, periodicals and magazines, complimentary buffet, drinks and high-speed Wi-Fi and global TV networks. Choose from one of three different time lengths to suit your needs.

highlights.highlightItem: Plaza Premium Lounge at Penang International Airport.
Relax in a lounge at the domestic or international departure terminal before your onward flight.
Complimentary beverages include soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea.
Shower facilities, comfortable seating and international TV included.
High-speed wireless internet, local calls and fax services available at four work stations.
Choose a 3-, 6- or 12-hour pass.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Travel through Penang International Airport in style with this Airport Plaza Premium Lounge pass offering three, six and 12-hour options in both the domestic and international terminals. This high-end lounge offers a wide range of amenities to keep you entertained and relaxed before your next flight.

Head to the lounge any time during  its operating hours. The lounge in the international departure terminal is open from 5:30am – 11pm, while the domestic departure lounge is open from 7am – 11pm. enter the lounge and grab a comfortable seat in the richly-appointed interior.

Whatever you might need before your flight is available in this high-end facility. Grab some hot food at the included buffet, or get a complimentary non-alcoholic drink (alcohol is available at your own expense). Then entertain yourself by watching a full range of global TV networks, reading a newspaper or magazine, or logging into the included high-speed wireless internet. The lounge's four workstations are at the ready if you need to get some work done. A full list of services and facilities is detailed below.

inclusion.item: Depending on option selected, enjoy 3, 6 or 12 hours (from the time of entry) to utilize the facilities of the lounge.
Comfortable seating area Wi-Fi connections International TV channels, newspapers, magazines

Packages.PackageDesc: Penang Island Discovery Morning Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Experience the beauty of the “Pearl of the Orient” on this Penang Island Discovery Morning Tour. Venture to the sandy shores and picturesque countryside as you make your way through some of the area’s most incredible sites. Visit a traditional batik factory, wander through the grounds of the famous Snake Temple, see handmade wonders at a local jewelry factory and interact with locals at Malay Kampung—an old-school Malaysian village. This four-hour morning tour hits all the highlights and insures you’ll leave Penang having seen the best of the best.

highlights.highlightItem: Discover Penang on this four-hour Morning Tour.
Learn traditional batik printing techniques.
Discover the local fruits and spices of Penang.
Mingle with the locals at an old style Malaysian village.
Observe the art of gold and platinum jewellery making.
View the world's 3rd longest bridge.
English-speaking guide.
Hotel pickup and drop off.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your friendly driver and professional guide will collect you from your Penang hotel and transport you to a traditional batik factory where you’ll learn the age-old technique of fabric painting using wax and dye. Your knowledgeable guide will also share information and insight about rubber tree tapping and local fruits, vegetables and spices as part of this unique tour.

You’ll experience old-world Penang on a visit to Malay Kampong, a traditional Malaysian village, where locals will great you with friendly faces before you venture to the Snake Temple, where statues of poisonous serpents decorate the alters.
Next, make your way to OE Design, where you’ll see artisans crafting jewellery in the Free Trade Zone. Learn how fine adornments are created using some of the world’s most valuable materials.

Finally, travel across the world’s third longest bridge, connecting Penang Island to the mainland. Make your way through scenic Georgetown, where your guide will point out historical highlights before you return to your hotel.

Packages.PackageDesc: Penang National Park Half-Day Trek

PackageDetails.overview: Discover the wild landscape of Penang National Park, observing exotic wildlife and stopping to swim at gorgeous tropical beaches, during this 4-hour adventure. Take a hike along the park’s lush rainforest trails, keeping your eyes peeled for monkeys, monitor lizards and tropical birds. Then cool off in the turquoise waters of Telok Tukun Beach before heading to the sublime sands of Monkey Beach, where you’ll enjoy a box lunch before taking a boat back. This Penang National Park visit also includes round-trip transport from your hotel, bottled water and a guide.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day Penang National Park tour.
Hike through the lush forest and discover the unique flora and fauna with an expert guide.
Stroll along a canopy walkway and see elevated views of the verdant rainforest.
Jump into the cool, turquoise waters at Telok Tukun Beach.
Enjoy sandwiches and fruit for lunch at Monkey Beach Relax on a return 20-minute boat ride and spot migratory birds in the mangroves.
Hotel pickup and drop-off available from Penang.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: See a more natural side of Penang as you escape the city on this 4-hour excursion to the island’s wild rainforests and beautiful unspoiled beaches at Penang National Park. It’s the perfect chance to immerse yourself in nature as you enjoy a relaxing day of beautiful views and fun in the sun.

Start your trip with a pick up at 9am from hotels along Tanjung Bungah to Batu Ferringghi, continuing on a drive to the island’s north-western tip to Penang National Park. This 10-square mile (26 sq km) park is among the smallest in the world, yet still manages to harbor an incredible diversity of habitats including wetlands, coral reefs, mangroves and turtle-nesting grounds.  Lucky for you, this tiny national park also boasts eight of the best beaches on the entire island of Penang.

Stop by the park’s Interactive Centre and Gallery for an intro to all it has to offer. Then join your guide on a 1-hour trek into the rainforest, tracing its path between the fishing village of Telok Bahang to the gorgeous  Telok Tukun Beach.

Then walk along an 820-foot (250m) canopy walkway, dangling 49 feet (15m) above the forest floor, offering visitors a unique chance to observe the plant and animal life of the forest’s upper levels. During your walk on the canopy, listen as your guide shares details about the indigenous wildlife of the area, including its numerous monitor lizards. If you’re feeling hot, make sure to cool off with a swim in the refreshing pool fed by the Tukun River.

Continue to the beautiful Monkey Beach, where you’ll have time to relax and enjoy a box lunch of sandwiches and fruit. As you eat, keep your eyes peeled for the numerous monkeys that call the beach home, watching for other creatures like green turtles, flying squirrels and flying lemurs that inhabit the area. Take a short 20-minute boat ride back from Monkey Beach, watching for the many migratory birds that call these mangrove swamplands home.
Finish your trip with a return drive to your hotel in Penang.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.

Packages.PackageDesc: Penang Night Tour from Georgetown with Malacca Strait Ferry Ride

PackageDetails.overview: Experience the magic of the Penang capital at twilight on this 3-hour night tour of Georgetown, including hotel pick-up. Get a view of the glittering Georgetown skyline as you cruise the Malacca Strait, then drive back along the famous Penang Bridge. Finally, soak up the atmosphere of Georgetown’s nightlife and fill up on street food (own expense) as you stroll around the lively historic centre.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour night tour of Georgetown in Penang.
Taste a variety of delicious Malaysian delights from food carts at a local hawker center (own expense).
Enjoy a 15-minute ferry ride across the Malacca Strait along the Malay Peninsula.
Travel eight miles over the Penang Bridge by coach.
See the skyline of Penang lit up at night.
Hotel pickup and drop-off from selected Penang hotels included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Upon pickup from your Penang hotel, head to an open-air hawker centre in historical Georgetown, accompanied by your knowledgeable local guide.

Stop at numerous food carts and smell the aromas of exotic spices, sampling world-renowned Penang cuisine as you go (own expense). You’ll taste a variety of Malaysian dishes – from popular satay sticks of barbecued meat to local seafood delicacies.

Relax after dinner as you embark on a 15-minute ferry ride across the Malacca Strait to the mainland. In operation since the 1920s, the nostalgic ferry will take you back to what it was like to travel along the Malay Peninsula in the past.

From both sides of the ferry’s open deck, admire incredible views of Penang’s illuminated skyline at night. Along with a panoramic vista of Penang from the water, you’ll see Penang Bridge in the distance. After you disembark, board a sightseeing coach for your return trip to Penang Island and its nightlife. Travel across Penang Bridge, which spans eight miles (13.5 km) across, making it one of the longest bridges in the world!

Skip the long airport taxi lines with this convenient pickup service.
Choose a shared shuttle service for a worry-free start to your vacation or business trip.
Travel with a safe professional driver.

Experienced, friendly, English-speaking driver.

Be met by a friendly, English-speaking driver.
Relaxing, stress-free way to begin your stay in Penang.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Georgetown Sightseeing Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Explore colonial history and heritage in Penang’s ancient capital city on this private 4-hour sightseeing tour in Georgetown. Take a scenic drive through downtown Georgetown with your private guide and admire the UNESCO–listed colonial architecture you find. Explore Fort Cornwallis’ mighty perimeter and learn of Captain Francis Light’s first landing in the 18th century. Admire ancient antiques and historic treasures from Penang's colorful past at Penang State Museum. Head into the bustling Chinatown and Little India districts by trishaw  and visit the Chinese clan house of Khoo Kongsi.

highlights.highlightItem: 4-hour private Georgetown sightseeing tour.
View colonial buildings in historical Georgetown, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Visit Fort Cornwallis and the Penang State Museum.
Ride a trishaw from the heart of Georgetown to Little India.
Stop at Khoo Kongsi, a famous Chinese clan house in Penang’s Chinatown.
Hear fascinating commentary about Penang’s culture from your private guide.
Hotel pickup and drop-off by private vehicle included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your private guide will pick you up at your Penang hotel and take you to the capital city, Georgetown. Enjoy a drive through the historical downtown, whose colonial buildings were designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site. You’ll visit several prominent sites on your private half-day tour with commentary from your professional guide.

Stop at Fort Cornwallis, which once belonged to the English East India Company, and learn about the first landing of Captain Francis Light in 1786. Take a 10-minute walk with your guide along the fort’s perimeter, protected by 10-foot (3-meter) high walls. Exploring the fort’s interior, you’ll see original, century-old structures like the chapel, prison cells, munitions storage, bronze canons and flagstaff.

Next, visit the Penang State Museum, built in 1821. The displays here showcase a fine collection of antiques as well as other historical relics that highlight Penang's cultural heritage. Meander through several galleries to see the collection of old photographs, maps, historical documents, Chinese furniture, embroidery and clothing.

Afterward, enjoy an authentic trishaw ride through the heart of Georgetown. You’ll be fascinated by its charming colonial architecture as well as the modern skyscrapers of bustling Chinatown and all the colour of Little India.

During your ride, stop at one of the most magnificent clan houses, Khoo Kongsi — part of a closely-knit network of Chinese clan associations established in Malaysia since the mid-19th century. The traditional building nestled amid a crowd of terrace houses and shops, features intricate carvings and woodwork bearing the mark of master craftsmen from China.
Your private tour ends with return transport to your Penang hotel.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking, unless booked within 3 days of travel. In this case confirmation will be received within 48 hours, subject to availability.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Museums Tour: Pinaon Time Tunnel, Camera Museum and Made in Penang Interactive Museum

PackageDetails.overview: Combine three of Penang’s most unique museums into one great-value 3-hour tour and enjoy the undivided attention of a private guide. Walk through 400 years of Penang history at the Pinaon Time Tunnel, and then be inspired at the Camera Museum, as you trace the history of photography from 19th-century antique cameras to modern-day digital models. Finally, get hands-on at the Penang Interactive Museum, where you can browse the fun Diorama gallery and have your photo taken with 3D recreations of city landmarks.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour private tour of three Penang museums.
Step back in Penang history inside 11 tunnel exhibits at the Pinaon Time Tunnel.
At the Camera Museum, get hands-on with antique and digital cameras, and visit an experiential darkroom.
Interact with murals and miniatures at the Made in Penang Interactive Museum’s Diorama Gallery and 3D Gallery.
Includes hotel pickup and drop-off by private vehicle from Penang city hotels.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Upon hotel pickup, meet your guide and settle into the comfort of your private minivan. Begin your 3-hour tour with a visit to the Pinaon Time Tunnel, a unique history museum located in central Georgetown. With your guide at your side, step into 11 tunnels featuring exhibits on natural and cultural history, from the early settlers of 1592 to the development of modern-day Penang.

You’re free to photograph any items, including miniature sculptures, wall displays, antique furniture and equipment. Before continuing on, be sure to watch the rare video clip of an air raid on Penang by a Japanese warplane during World War II.

Proceed to your next stop, the Camera Museum, where you’ll begin with a presentation on photographic equipment. See the very first cameras created in the 1800s, and view priceless antiques on display. View more than 200 timeless treasures that lead up to the digital cameras of today, from century-old 3D imagery to a plethora of spy cameras. You can learn the many ways to make a photo in experiential rooms, including a darkroom and pinhole room.

Your final stop is the Made in Penang Interactive Museum (MIPIM), where you can enjoy a lively and interactive experience. Start on the ground floor, which houses the Diorama Gallery with miniature dioramas featuring amazing detail. Then head to the upper floor where the Penang 3D Gallery showcases wall and floor murals depicting various Penang scenes and historical figures.

After your guide captures photos of you and your private group hanging from the Queen Victoria Clock tower or other iconic landmarks, finish at the interactive kiosks where 3D images are projected onto a screen.
Your morning of whimsy ends with the return to your Penang city hotel.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
A maximum of 6 people per booking.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Penang City Sightseeing Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Experience a taste of all that Penang has to offer on a grand tour of the island with a private guide. Travel in comfort by private vehicle to Penang’s top attractions, including Kek Lok Si Temple, Snake Temple, the funicular railway on Penang Hill and the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre. You'll learn about Malaysian arts including pewter-making and batik, stop at a traditional fishing village and fruit plantation, and see Buddhist temples and other architectural gems, all while enjoying informative commentary from your expert guide.

highlights.highlightItem: Penang city sightseeing tour with private guide.
Enjoy sweeping views on a scenic drive and from Penang Hill by funicular railway.
Watch batik artisans at work and make a pewter bowl in a hands-on workshop.
See live pit vipers coiled at the Snake Temple (Temple of the Azure Cloud).
View a statue of Guanyin at Kek Lok Si Temple (Pagoda of Ten Thousand Buddhas).
Hotel pickup and drop-off by private vehicle.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: After morning hotel pickup in Penang, travel with your private guide in a climate-controlled vehicle along a famous stretch of the Batu Ferringhi beaches.

Stop at a traditional fishing village, then visit a batik factory. There, watch artisans shape designs from wax and dye to create this classic Malaysian textile art. Then drive by fruit plantations and learn about commonly grown fruits and spices such as clove and nutmeg.

Continue to the famous Snake Temple (aka Temple of the Azure Cloud), which was built in 1850 in memory of a Chinese monk who sheltered jungle snakes. Inside Snake Temple, venomous pit vipers coil around temple altars, the reptiles supposedly made drowsy and harmless by incense smoke, but their venom removed for safety.

Next up, head to one of the largest Chinese Buddhist temple  complexes  in Southeast Asia, Kek Lok Si Temple. The temple complex contains many pagodas, prayer halls and bell towers built in varying styles—from Chinese to Burmese to Thai. A bronze statue of the goddess of mercy, Guanyin, looks down from the hill above the pagoda.

Your final destination is the funicular railway that ascends Penang Hill (Bukit Bendera)—a 2,625-foot (800-meter) peak and Malaysia's oldest hill station. Disembark at the top for sweeping views of the island and mainland. When descending the hill, visit the Royal Selangor Visitor Centre and enjoy a 30-minute lesson about crafting pewter. Learn 19th-century techniques for manipulating the versatile metal into a simple pewter bowl using basic hand tools.

Your tour includes a stop for lunch at a local restaurant (own expense) and ends when your guide returns you to your hotel. Alternatively, you can opt to be dropped off at the Straits Quay Mall for some shopping on your own.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking, unless booked within 3 days of travel. In this case confirmation will be received within 48 hours, subject to availability.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Penang Island Tour Including Snake Temple

PackageDetails.overview: Discover the island known as the ‘Pearl of the Orient’ on this private 4-hour tour of Penang, including hotel pick-up. Enjoy the undivided attention of a private guide as you drive the Oceanside Batu Ferringghi Road, view landmarks like Penang Bridge and uncover the island’s military history at the Penang War Museum. Get a taste of local culture as you watch local craftsmen at work in a batik factory, then brave a trip to the striking Snake Temple, where live vipers guard the altars.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day sightseeing tour of Penang Island with a private guide.
Take a scenic drive around the island by private car.
Discover traditional batik printing techniques at a local factory.
Stop at a fruit stall for an introduction to Malaysian produce and spices.
Visit the Snake Temple (Temple of the Azure Cloud).
View Penang Bridge, the world's third longest bridge.
Hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: In the morning, you’ll be picked up from your Penang hotel by private vehicle. Drive along Batu Ferringghi Road, a famous stretch of shoreline, and enjoy panoramic views of the ocean. Your first stop is a batik factory, where you’ll learn the traditional techniques of producing this exquisite Malay textile using wax and dye to make the patterned designs.

Pass by the lush and green landscape of local fruit and spice plantations, stopping at a fruit stand. Your guide will provide an introduction to the local fruits and spices such as nutmeg and clove as you discover how Penang first achieved fame during the famous era of the spice trade.

Next,  head to the Penang War Museum, located atop Bukit Batu Maung on the southeast corner of Penang Island. Opened to the public since 2002, the museum was originally a British military defense fortress built in the 1930s to protect the island from enemy attack. Later it was transformed into a Japanese army base during World War II. You’ll learn more about the museum’s infamous history as you explore the fortress with your guide. Constructed over 20 acres (9 hectares), the site includes underground military tunnels, ammunition bunkers, canon firing bays, sleeping quarters, cook houses and a medical infirmary.

Continue by private car to the famous Snake Temple, originally named the Temple of the Azure Cloud to honour the beauty of Penang's sky. Live pit vipers now coil around the altars in the temple, built in 1850. But don’t worry—although the snakes retain their fangs, their venom has been removed and they are also considered harmless due to the smoke of burning incense.
On the return drive to your hotel, view Penang Bridge, one of the longest bridges in the world, which links Penang Island to the mainland of Malaysia.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Half Day Colonial Penang City Tour

PackageDetails.overview: This 4 hour private half day tour in Penang will give you the opportunity to visit the prominent buildings for the colonial era around George Town area. Some of the beautiful places you will visit include Fort Cornwallis, Armenian Street and the Street of Harmony.

highlights.highlightItem: Private guide for a more personalized experience.
Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Great overview and orientation of the city Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: You will be picked up from you hotel and our first stop is Fort Cornwallis, which is the largest standing fort in Malaysia built during the 1800s. This is one of the most popular and iconic historical landmarks of Penang. Our next stop will take you to the Chew Jetty; here you will explore local Chinese history and heritage. A short distance away you will see one of Penang's most famous murals at Armenian Street. We will then proceed to a fabulous district, Little India. You will find this place very atmospheric with the smell and sounds of India thrown in. This is a good place to find local Indian foods, clothing and jewellery to buy gifts for your family. After that, you will be taken for a short walk at Harmony Street where you can see a range of attractions such as Masjid Kapitan Keling, Kuan Yin Temple, St. George's Church, and Sri Mahamariamman Temple. You will finish off the day with the chance to enjoy some shopping for local products. Once the day is complete you will be taken back to your hotel safely.

inclusion.item: Private tour with professional art historian guide.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Half-Day Indian Culture Tour in Penang

PackageDetails.overview: Indian people and culture played a very important role in the development of Penang. Experience this wonderful culture by visiting the Indian Temple, Mosque and Little India Street to understand how Indian culture influenced Penang. This tour is approximately 4 hours long.

highlights.highlightItem: Perfect introduction for first-time visitors.
Choice of morning or afternoon departure.
All entrance fees included.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Firstly, The Kapitan Keling Mosque along Jalan Masjid Kapitan Keling (formerly Pitt Street), is one of the best known Indian Muslim mosques in Penang. The Kapitan Keling Mosque was used as the state mosque of Penang, since it is the largest historic mosque in George Town. The Kapitan Keling Mosque was named after Caudeer Mohuddeen, the head of the Indian Muslim community credited to have built it around 1800.

Next, explore the Little India. Little India is an enclave within the inner quarters of George Town, Penang. As with other Little India elsewhere, the Little India of George Town is lined with shops managed by the Indian Community . It's a place to enjoy a kaleidoscope of colors and sounds, with goods from India spilling to the sidewalks, the smell of various spices in the air and Indian music blaring from loud speakers. We will enjoy some Indian snack (roti canai and teh tarik) and drinks at the Indian Restaurant.

After that, discover the Sri Mahamariamman Temple, which is situated in George Town, Penang. It is the oldest Hindu temple in Malaysia, and features sculptures of gods and goddesses over its main entrance and facade. It became a place of worship as early as 1801 and became a temple in 1833. It has stood at the same place for more than 200 years.
To complete the day, you will have the opportunity to enjoy some shopping. Have fun browsing through all the famous local products.
NOTE: The visit Sri Mahamariamman Temple will be replaced by Sri Meenakshi Hindu Temple as it is under construction until further notice.

PackageDetails.overview: Named after King George III of England - George Town, being the oldest city in Malaysia that remains unchanged till this day where old Colonial buildings with narrow streets are found.

View top landmarks in the World Heritage–listed capital of Penang.
Visit Little India and the temples of Chinatown.
See the British-built fort and stroll the waterfront.

Next visit the State Museum to understand the local cultures of various races and the early history of Penang. Proceed to the British built Fort where the old structure and cannons are still intact. Pass by the clock tower and proceed to the waterfront where a walk down the Clan Jetty on the wooden platform where houses are built on stilt and a view of Penang Bridge. A slow drive through Little India, Chinatown and find out how Church, Chinese Temple, Indian Temple and Muslim Mosque are located just steps away from each other at Street of Harmony.

Please select your transfer from one of the below areas in Penang, depending on your hotel location: City area hotels - Hotels located in Gurney, George Town, Bukit Jambul and Bayan Lepas area.   Beach area hotels - Hotels located in Tanjung Bungah, Batu Ferringhi and Teluk Bahang area.

When reserving your shared transfer, please provide your departure flight details and hotel information (hotel name and location). You will receive instant confirmation for your booking and a voucher will be emailed to you. Please present your voucher to the driver during transfer pick-up. The departure transfer is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
Child rate applies only when sharing with 2 paying adults Infant rates apply provided they do not occupy a seat.

Vehicle does not specifically cater to passenger traveling with wheelchair. However, collapsible wheelchairs can be accommodated providing the passenger is accompanied by someone who can assist them to board and disembark.
A minimum of 2 people per booking is required.

Hotel pickups commence according to agreed timing, exact pickup time will be advised 24 hrs before departure day:from City hotels: 2.5 hours before flight departure time and from Beach hotels: 3 hours before flight departure time.

Packages.PackageDesc: Hot Air Balloon Flight over Putrajaya

PackageDetails.overview: Experience and enjoy the morning silence on this unforgettable sunrise hot air balloon ride over the beautiful Putrajaya. Hot air balloons travel with the wind, therefore flight paths each morning are quite different day to day. You are likely to take in many of Putrajaya’s landmarks, such as The Wawasan Bridge, The stainless steel Mosque, Persiaran Putra, Palace of Justice and many more of Putrajaya’s lovely lake and buildings. Travelers are invited to enjoy the stunning Putrajaya views with a rush of adrenaline by taking an unforgettable hot air balloon ride, the first and only commercial hot air balloon in Malaysia.

highlights.highlightItem: Enjoy fantastic aerial views.
Scenic air tour.
Qualified and professional pilot.
Romantic experience, perfect for couples.
Breakfast included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Add a hint of adventure to your travel itinerary in Malaysia, by booking a magical experience which starts with a spectacular view of the country’s administrative capital, Putrajaya. This favorite Malaysian capital is a gourmet paradise of beautiful, scenic landscapes as well as modern architectural buildings, with lots of different on-ground activities, suitable for everyone to enjoy.

Make your way to Putrajaya by arranging for a special pick-up service right from your hotel in the city or at a nearby hotel; which will bring you straight to the launch site. At the launch site, there is nothing quite like watching the hot air balloon fire up in the early morning breeze, while you kick-start your morning with a refreshing cup of coffee and light pastries. Before flight, of course, you would be briefed by an experienced hot air balloon pilot on safety, as well as what to expect on a hot air balloon ride.

When the balloon is ready to go, climb aboard a sturdy basket, which holds a maximum of 6 people, and then you’re ready to experience the thrill as your balloon fires up in the morning air and you slowly begin to rise over the scenery. While you glide and soar gracefully in the beautiful sky for at least 45 minutes, the pilot will accompany you on the ride to ensure everyone’s safety and provide narration on passing scenery. You will have plenty of picture-perfect opportunities, so make sure your camera is ready.

After your 45-minute flight, you can participate in the packing up of the balloon, which at times, can be quite an adventure. You will then get to toast your celebratory flight with a glass of sparkling juice, have a hearty breakfast at the stunning Cyberview Resort and Spa Hotel and to top it off; you will receive a certificate of completion, which you can share with family and friends.

inclusion.item: Hotel pickup and drop-off (selected hotels only).

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Putrajaya Day Tour from Kuala Lumpur

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy an afternoon venturing to the edges of Kuala Lumpur on this private tour of Putrajaya. Your expert local guide will transport you in the comfort of your own private vehicle to the administrative center of this incredible and diverse nation where you’ll explore highlights like the Taman WarisanPertanian Agricultural Park. Tour impressive landmarks like Putrajaya Lake and Perdana Putra as part of this informative afternoon. Travel with ease and enjoy ultimate relaxation and comfort thanks to round-trip hotel transport.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour private tour of Putrajaya from Kuala Lumpur.
Visit Taman Warisan Pertanian Agricultural Park.
See the Putra Mosque and Perdana Putra, the Prime Minister’s office.
Enjoy views of Putrajaya Lake and Putra Bridge.
Pass the Sepang Formula 1 Race Circuit, regarded as one of the best in the world.
Enjoy a customized itinerary with a knowledgeable private guide.
Round-trip hotel transport by private vehicle included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your professional, local guide will meet you at your Kuala Lumpur hotel and transport you in a private, air-conditioned vehicle to Putrajaya—the country’s administrative center, named after its first prime minister, Tunu Abdul Rahman Putra. Enjoy the scenic 45-minute drive from the capital and relax in your comfortable ride.

You’ll see where five confluences meet to form the main waterway, where tiny boats float past on Putrajaya Lake. Follow your guide to Taman WarisanPertanian Agricultural Park, where you’ll wander the impressive arboretum where fruits, vegetables and other local items are grown. Your guide will point out those that are unique to the region, making for an informative visit!

Afterwards, head to some of Putrajaya’s most famous landmarks, including the pink-domed Putra Mosque.Fashiones from stunning rose granite, this destination stretches from 250 feet (76 meters) into the air and is one of the tallest in the region. Follow your guide through the impressive grounds and pay a visit to the quiet Sahn courtyard where lush landscapes and waterways await you.

Next, head to Perdana Putra, the Prime Minister’s office. Known as the White House of Malaysia, this imposing building is home to several key government agencies. Your guide will highlight its functions, as well as key architectural features as you tour the grounds.

Before making your way back to your Kuala Lumpur hotel or the international airport, pass by the Sepang Formula 1 Race Circuit—widely recognized as one of the top circuits on earth. This memorable tour showcases some of the best of Putrajaya and provides travelers with an insider’s look at the administrative capital of Malaysia.

Please note: This private sightseeing tour of Putrajaya can be customized to your interests; please list any special interests you have (e.g. art, architecture, history, culture) at the time of booking to alert your guide, so that he or she can better prepare for your private tour.

inclusion.item: All taxes, fees and handling charges.

Packages.PackageDesc: Afternoon Bird watching Tour in Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: Spend an educational afternoon on a 4-hour bird-watching tour in Langkawi, led by a local bird-watching enthusiast. You’ll observe waterbirds such as whistling ducks, egrets and herons, and see mountain rainforest species including great hornbills, from a village pond to your perch at Langkawi’s highest peak. Bonus: binoculars and scope plus round-trip hotel transport are included.

highlights.highlightItem: Choice of morning or afternoon departure.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Led by a local guide.
Perfect introduction for first-time visitors.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: We begin this session with a short drive to a local village pond that is frequented by Lesser Whistling-Ducks, Little Egrets, Little Herons, Moorhens, Little Grebes, Pond Herons, Needle-tailed Swifts and Striated Swallows.

We then drive to the highest peak in Langkawi to see Great Hornbills, Wreathed Hornbills and other rainforest species. These amazing birds will be the highlight of the trip. The Great Hornbills measuring 1.3 meters (4 feet) from tip of beak to tip of tail are the largest birds in Langkawi.
Tours include: Transfer from and to the hotel, insurance, bird watching guide, drinking water, binoculars and scope.

AdditionalInfo.info: Subject to favourable weather conditions. If cancelled due to poor weather, you will be given the option of an alternative date or full refund.

Packages.PackageDesc: Dive Pulau Payar from Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: At the south-western tip of Pulau Payar lies a dive site known as the Coral Garden, considered one of the best marine playgrounds for scuba divers. Get up close to multicoloured fish and soft corals while a professional guide accompanies you into the azure waters of Pulau Payar Marine Park. You'll enjoy high visibility as you keep company with a variety of fascinating sea creatures. This full-day excursion for certified divers includes round-trip hotel transport, diving equipment and a buffet lunch.

highlights.highlightItem: Lunch included.
Led by a local guide.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.
All necessary equipment included.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Pulau Payar is well-known as one of Malaysia best diving destinations with white sand beaches, azure water and kilometres of coral teeming with riotous tropical sea life.

The nearby Pulau Payar Marine Park includes 4 small islands surrounded by coral reefs and is ideal for swimming, and scuba diving. The calm and clear waters enable the visitors to enjoy the enchanting marine life, with an average of 30-50 feet visibility in waters at the Payar Island Marine Park you are ensured satisfaction for diving activity at all times.
At the south-western tip of Pulau Payar lies a site known as Coral Garden, it’s one of the best marine playgrounds for divers, with spectacular views of multi-coloured and vibrant soft corals.

Other popular spots are the flat terrain to the east of Pulau Payar Marine Park and the area to its west around Pulau Segantang that offers steep diving conditions. The latter also provides an added incentive as you literally have various sea creatures as company while you swim and explore the site.

Pulau Payar is just one hour away by ferry from Langkawi and for those who do not dive, you can marvel at the spectacular sights below the surface from the large floating platform. Two tracking trails have also been made available for visitors to explore the flora and fauna of the island.
Packages include return hotel transfers, return ferry transfer, buffet lunch on the platform, marine park fee, full gear and diving equipment’s.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.
Not recommended for pregnant women.
Not recommended for participants with heart complaints or other serious medical conditions.
Evidence of dive certification is required from all divers wishing to participate in a certified dive.

Diving within 48 hours of flying is not recommended. All participants will be required to complete a health questionnaire prior to diving. Some pre-existing medical conditions (e.g. asthma, heart conditions, etc) may prevent you from diving, please consult your doctor.

Packages.PackageDesc: Evening Dinner Cruise in Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: This cruise explores Langkawi's southern islands with class and style on board the Sea Falcon. Sail with us through the picturesque straits between Dayang Bunting and Tuba islands, and then to the best highlights of the southern islands. Dinner is served on board.

highlights.highlightItem: Travel by boat and see the sights from the water.
Enjoy a romantic night including dinner.
Romantic experience, perfect for couples.
Buffet dinner included.
Family friendly.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Join this approximately 3-4 hour amazing dinner cruises of the Dayang Bunting and Tuba islands on The Sea Falcon during your holiday in Langkawi. A buffet dinner and drinks will be served during the cruise, such as tea, coffee, soft drink, beer and wine.

The Sea Falcon is perfect for both romantic getaways and elegant cocktail parties. The boat design ingeniously maximizes space with two sundecks, a lounge, dining room, galley and navigation room plus a gorgeous private suite with a large flat-screen television.

You can relax on the boat, watching the sunset with your family and loved one with some beers served on board. This sailing trip is set at a relaxing and smooth pace for your enjoyment and is a great option for those who prefer less crowded cruises with great optional activities. You will be transferred back to you hotel safely after the cruise.

inclusion.item: Unlimited beer, wine and soft drink.
Hotel pickup and drop-off (selected hotels only).

Packages.PackageDesc: Evening Tour of Langkawi Capital - Kuah Town

PackageDetails.overview: Kuah, formerly a humble fishing village, is now known today as Pekan Kuah, as booming a commercial center can be with shopping complexes, restaurants, fast food outlets, hotels and handicraft shops. Kuah is a nice and small town with a relaxed atmosphere. View this compact town in the evening with its collection of shops and local hawker stalls.

highlights.highlightItem: Explore the local streets on a walking tour of the city.
Perfect introduction for first-time visitors.
Ideal choice for families.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: The name ‘Pekan Kuah’ comes from the Malay word for gravy, and legend has it that the town arose from a cup of gravy spilled on the land by two giants, Mat Raya and Mat Cincang (now the names of the two highest mountains in Langkawi), while they were fighting.

Located on the southeastern tip of Langkawi Island, Kuah is the main town and the transit point for ferries from the mainland and Penang. Kuah is also the most important town on Langkawi Island. Though it is not an actual city, local people from Langkawi refer to it as a city. Among Langkawi’s most well-known attractions here is undoubtedly the Dataran Lang or Eagle Square. On this square an enormous hand-made eagle rises in the sky. This eagle symbolizes the island of Langkawi. The name of the island originates from a combination of the words Helang (which means eagle in Malay) and Kawi (red/brown, the color of the statue). On one of the many benches around statue you can enjoy one of the best sunsets on the island.

With the status of Langkawi as a duty free zone, you can shop for an extensive array of items such as liquor, tobacco, chocolates and some imported household items all of which are much cheaper compared to many other places. Kuah is recommended as it is the only place to do some real shopping on the island. This is a chance to haggle for a great shopping deal for those who enjoy a shopping spree and grab some souvenirs for friends back home. Return to your hotel afterwards.

inclusion.item: Hotel pickup and drop-off (excluding Kuah town hotels).

Packages.PackageDesc: Family Trekking in Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: Take a break from the beaches and trade the Andaman Sea for a swim in a natural pool during this private tour. Your own personal guide accompanies you on a short hike through the lush jungle to a magical spot by a quiet stream. This 3-hour outing, ideal for couples or families includes round-trip hotel transport from Langkawi.

highlights.highlightItem: Ideal choice for families.
Private tour is operated with just your party and a guide/driver.
Popular choice with kids.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This very short 500m trek will take us through a rainforest trail that ends at a quiet jungle stream that cascades into a natural pool. This fun outing is ideal for the whole family or a couple wanting to escapes the heat of tropical sun and swim in its cool and refreshing waters. You can spend time enjoying the stream or take a walk further into the rainforest.

Packages.PackageDesc: Full-Day Pulau Payar Snorkeling Tour from Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: Explore the colourful underwater world of the Pulau Payar Marine Park on a snorkelling day trip from Langkawi. This family-friendly outing takes you on a 1-hour ferry ride to a large floating platform, which serves as your snorkel base in the well-preserved marine park. Calm seas and high visibility make this snorkelling site — just 18 miles (30 km) offshore — popular with marine life enthusiasts and you’ll find plenty of undersea action. Includes round-trip hotel transport to the jetty plus snorkelling equipment and a box lunch.

highlights.highlightItem: Close encounter with wildlife.
Family friendly.
Get up-close to native wildlife.
All entrance fees included.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Lunch included.
Snorkel gear included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Pulau Payar is well-known as one of Malaysia's best snorkelling and diving destinations with white sand beaches, azure water and kilometres of coral teeming with riotous tropical sea life.

The nearby Pulau Payar Marine Park includes 4 small islands surrounded with coral reefs and are ideal for swimming, snorkelling and scuba diving. The calm and clear waters enable the visitors to enjoy the enchanting marine life, with an average of 30-50 feet visibility in waters at the Payar Island Marine Park ensures satisfaction for diving activity at all times.
At the south-western tip of Pulau Payar lies a site known as Coral Garden, it’s one of the best marine playgrounds for divers, with spectacular views of multi colored and vibrant soft corals.

Other popular spots are the flat terrain to the east of Pulau Payar Marine park and the area to its west around Pulau Segantang that offers steep diving condition. The latter also provides an added incentive: you can literally have various sea creatures as company while you swim and explore the site.

Pulau Payar is just one hour away by ferry from Langkawi and for those who do not dive or snorkel, marvel at the spectacular sights below the surface from the large floating platform. The amazing colored fish were seen when snorkelling will remain in your memory for years to come. Two tracking trails have also been made available for visitors to explore the flora and fauna of the island.

Itinerary.ItineraryItem: 09.00 a.m. Transfer from your Langkawi hotel to Kuah Jetty. All guests are required to check-in at least 30 minutes before departure.
09.45 a.m. Depart Kuah jetty for Pulau Payar Marine Park.
10.45 a.m. Arrive at Reef Platform - reef activities commence: swimming and snorkelling.
12.30 p.m. - 02.00 p.m. Lunch Box served.
03.15 p.m. Radio broadcast announcement to signal all guest to return to vessel and get ready for departure.
03.30 p.m. Depart reef platform for Kuah jetty.
04.30 p.m. Arrive at Kuah Jetty and transfer back to hotel.

Packages.PackageDesc: Full-Day Sailing and Geopark Adventure from Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: A fantastic, soft Geopark adventure cruise designed for all ages to enjoy, aboard a beautifully maintained sailing yacht! Sail in between islands, among the beautiful ecosystem of Langkawi’s outlying islands. Enjoy the beautiful view of Langkawi islands and do keep an eye out for dolphins, flying fish and birds of prey. Enjoy a delicious BBQ lunch on one of the deserted, quiet and beautiful beaches.

highlights.highlightItem: Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Family friendly.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will begin with a pickup from your hotel. From here you will be taken to begin your cruise! You will depart and on our yacht and sail up into the islands. On the way, you can participate in handling the yacht by taking the helm and trimming the rigging under the guidance of the crew. You can try some fishing, look for dolphins and flying fish, admire the sea eagles, cool off in our salt water Jacuzzi, have a party on board or just relaxes with your book and a drink.

Enjoy a delicious BBQ lunch on one of the deserted and beautiful beaches where you can also swim and enjoy the natural setting or go on an easy jungle walk to discover the Malaysian rainforest. Enjoy the rest of the day wining and dining on your sumptuous lunch on the quiet beach.

After this, proceed for a leisurely 30min sail to a very beautiful and special spot, to an area of open sea to observe sea eagles and their stunning performance of diving and splashing into the water just meters from the yacht. It's a spectacular and exciting experience that offers endless photo opportunities. Finally, sail back after a day of fun and adventure! You will be taken back to your hotel and left with unforgettable memories.

inclusion.item: BBQ Lunch on the beach or on board.
Unlimited drinks (open bar of beers, soft drinks, fruit juices and more).

Packages.PackageDesc: Half-Day Bike Tour of Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: Discover the beauty of Langkawi Island as you cycle through the countryside at a leisurely pace. Experience a completely different side of Langkawi as you catch a simple of the everyday lifestyle of the locals. Explore Langkawi’s countryside, paddy fields, rustic villages and more locations that visitors don’t normal get to experience.

highlights.highlightItem: Cycle the city streets to absorb the local atmosphere.
Small group ensures personal service.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will begin with a hotel pickup. From here you will be taken to a central meeting point where you will be given the chance to gear up. After short briefing, gear up for a 26km ride, starting from Langkawi’s most popular tourist street of Pantai Cenang. Cycling along the Pantai Cenang stretch, you will be able to get a glimpse of one of the most exciting spots in Langkawi, with an array of souvenir stalls, duty free stores, bars and pubs, budget accommodations, and massage parlors.

We will take a break around the Underwater World where there are duty free shops for you to get some drinks to re-hydrate yourself. It is advisable to drink lots of water when cycling in the heat of Langkawi Island. Further down the road is the Laman Padi Museum in which we will make a visit to. The museum offers an insight into the many procedures and equipment involved in the cultivation of paddy which was once the main industry in Langkawi. There is also an opportunity for you to walk through a scenic paddy field plantation. Feel the breeze in your face as you pedal down the country roads. Get a glimpse into the daily life in the villages as we will bring you to explore Langkawi’s countryside, paddy fields, rustic villages and lots more that are otherwise not normally experienced by visitors.

Langkawi is well known for its beaches and natural Eco system but many tend to forget the charm in meeting the local residents and experiencing their warm and friendly welcome extended to visitors. This tour enables you to experience just that as we bring you to a “kampong” to visit the  neighbourhood  and have a tea break at a local resident’ home. Our experienced and knowledgeable guide will also provide extensive information on the history and culture of rural Langkawi.

The final part of the tour will bring us to a mangrove vegetation and rubber plantation. There will be ample opportunity of spotting many colourful birds and small animals such as Kingfishers, Hornbills and Monitor Lizards. Do not forget your camera as the views are spectacular, especially as you cycle through green pastures spreading as far as the eye can see. This ride is moderate-level in difficulty. It could be a perfect way to relish calm and peaceful surroundings escaping the crowd of the city and the beaches.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation will be received at time of booking.
This ride is moderate-level in difficulty. Cycling distance is approximately 26km in total (flat terrain).
Subject to  favourable weather conditions. If cancelled due to poor weather, you will be given the option of an alternative date or full refund.
Reasonable fitness level is required. Advisable to wear/bring comfortable walking shoes, pants, hat, sunblock, camera, and a small backpack.
The tour is suitable for age 10 years and above (no child bicycle – lowest saddle position is 82cm). Children must be accompanied by an adult.
Not recommended for pregnant women.
Not recommended for participants with heart complaints or other serious medical conditions.

Packages.PackageDesc: Half-Day Geopark Mangrove Cruise from Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: Set sail for adventure on this half-day mangrove cruise boat visiting Tanjung Rhu River, Kisap and Kilim Rivers in the Langkawi geopark sites.

highlights.highlightItem: Popular choice with kids.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.
Perfect for all ages and skill level.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Travel by boat with an English speaking naturalist through the twists and turns of the Kilim River through the maze created by aerial roots and thick fleshy leaves of the mangrove trees.
Wildlife is abundant; we observe the bizarre land walking fish, vividly collared kingfishers, eagles and often otters and dolphins.
We often see other mangrove animals that make their home in this delicately balanced ecosystem which is responsible for the health and wide variety of species in the Andaman Sea.
We also explore how the mangrove area is a perfect environment for cottage industries such as processing charcoal and fish farms.

As we venture out of the mangroves you’ll see majestic limestone rock formations and sea stacks that rise dramatically from the ocean. This ancient coral thrust into the sky millions of years ago is home to a unique and ancient group of plants found nowhere else on earth.
This trip is highly recommended for all visitors to Langkawi.

Packages.PackageDesc: Half-Day Jungle Trek from Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: This trip is highly recommended for all visitors to Langkawi. It gives an opportunity to experience and begin to understand the magic and complexity of our million year old rainforest.

highlights.highlightItem: Close encounter with wildlife.
Led by a local guide.
Perfect introduction for first-time visitors.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: A non-strenuous trip through Langkawi's lowland rainforest that contains flora and fauna found nowhere else in the world. Our naturalists will show you birds, plants, animal’s butterflies and more, explaining how a fragile world of interdependence has evolved.

An early start ensures that you hear and see the rainforest morning chorus of birds and monkeys. Our well informed naturalist guide will introduce you to see different species of monkeys, birds, butterflies, medicinal plants and other natural wonders in their natural environment.
This tour is not recommended for children.

AdditionalInfo.info: Subject to favourable weather conditions . If cancelled due to poor weather, you will be given the option of an alternative date or full refund.
Not recommended for pregnant women.
Not recommended for children.

Packages.PackageDesc: Island and Fishing Adventure by Boat in Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: Overview Important Info Join this tour for a boat excursion in Langkawi like no other! Try your luck fishing in the sea, hop to Lake of Pregnant Maiden, Eagle Watching and have an enjoyable picnic by the beach.

highlights.highlightItem: Travel by boat and see the sights from the water.
Enjoy a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Family friendly.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your day will begin with a pickup from your hotel. From here you will be taken to the starting point of your adventure. You will depart on a long boat and enjoy some fishing activities (catch and release) before proceeding to the legendary Tasik Dayang Bunting (Pregnant Maiden Lake). Legend says that the water of the lake possesses some mystical power to help women bear children. This freshwater lake is cool and perfect for swimming, which you will be able to enjoy for approximately 40mins.

The boat will then take you to another Island where you will be able to witness birds of prey. There are a few different types of birds here but among the mostly commonly seen are the White-bellied Sea Eagle and the Brahminy Kite. Langkawi, the name of the island has been given after the reddish brown eagle. Helang in Malay means Eagle and Kawi is reddish brown color. The reddish brown eagles (also known as Brahminy Kites) are the most common form of eagles that you will find here. You will also see many White Bellied Sea Eagles in Langkawi as well which are larger in size.

The last island we will visit is Pulau Beras Basah (Wet Rice Island) a beautiful white sandy beach where it is possible to swim and enjoy a BBQ picnic. Pulau Beras Basah is famous for its beautiful white sandy beaches with crystal clear blue waters and the rich mystifying forest with magnificent mountains in the background. It an ideal place for you to get away for a while and indulge yourself in the beauty of nature. Besides its pristine white sand beaches, it offers other interesting activities too including (at own cost) Para sailing; snorkeling, banana boat ride swimming or you can just bathe and relax under the sun.

exclusion.item: Beach activities (parasailing, jet ski, snorkeling, etc).

Subject to favourable weather conditions. If cancelled due to poor weather, you will be given the option of an alternative date or full refund.

A moderate amount of walking is involved.
Advisable to bring swimwear and towel.

Packages.PackageDesc: Island Hopping Tour from Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: Get in on some island vibes during this island hopping tour from Langkawi. Explore the area by boat with an expert guide who will point out wildlife, land masses and other features as you make your way to Pulau Dayang Bunting (Pregnant Maiden Lake) and Pulau Beras Basah, where you’ll enjoy time relaxing on white sandy beaches.

highlights.highlightItem: Tour of Pulau Langkawi's islands.
Cruise along the ocean and marvel at the lovely sights of its abundant wildlife.
Relax on the white sandy beaches of Pulau Beras Basah.
Visit Pulau Dayang Bunting and see how its mountain formation takes the model of a pregnant lady.
Friendly and professional guide and hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Meet your guide and driver at your Langkawi hotel and head out to Pantai Cenang by boat. Revel in the beauty of rocky coastlines, lush greenery, stunning wildlife and clear blue waters as you listen to the expert commentary of your guide.

Your first stop is the island of Pulau Dayang Bunting (Pregnant Maiden Lake). Your guide will explain how the water found here is rumored to have medicinal qualities to cure infertile women. Keep an eye out for wildlife as you cruise the waters, where you may spot diving eagles or crab-eating monkeys.
Next, stop at Pulau Beras Basah, where you’ll have time to relax on sandy beaches and enjoy sun and blue waters before returning to shore and making your way back to the hotel.

Packages.PackageDesc: Jet Ski Tour of Langkawi Fishing Village with Lunch

PackageDetails.overview: Experience the best of coastal Malaysia on this 4-hour Langkawi fishing village jet-ski tour. Explore Langkawi Island’s beautiful coastline by jet-ski with your guide. See elegant cruise ships, luxury yachts and traditional fishing boats in the harbor. Learn of the Langkawi Archipelago during a stop at Kuah. Open the throttle in the deep seas where dolphins splash through the waves, and enjoy a delicious traditional lunch in Penarak fishing village. Gain insight into Malay village life and take in panoramic views over the Andaman Sea from your hilltop vantage point.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day Langkawi Island Jet Ski tour with an experienced guide.
Race over turquoise waters while sightseeing along the Langkawi coastline.
See the giant eagle statue at Langkawi Port and view cruise ships at Awana Porto Malai.
Venture into open waters where dolphins may race alongside your Jet Ski, and swim near Monkey Beach.
Stop at Penarak fishing village for lunch, cooked and served in a fisherman's home.
Choose a morning or afternoon departure, depending on option selected.
Small-group tour limited to four passengers ensures personalized attention.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Gather with your small group at the meeting point on Cenang Beach in the morning or afternoon, depending on your selection upon booking. After a safety briefing and tips, you and your fellow experienced solo riders can hop on the Jet Skis to embark on a glorious 4-hour ride.

Race effortlessly along the Langkawi Island coastline, following your guide past the Awana Porto Malai, a marina where you can spot cruise ships and a holiday resort with unhindered ocean views. Rev your motor toward the Navy Pontoon for a glimpse of sturdy vessels, followed by the Langkawi Port, home to numerous wooden fishing boats and a giant eagle statue — a popular landmark on the pier.

Learn about Langkawi’s commerce and economy as you stop at Jetty Pelancongan in the town of Kuah, and the history of the Langkawi archipelago en route to the Royal Langkawi Yacht Club that features an array of luxury yachts.

You’ll head out to open waters, where dolphins sometimes race alongside the Jet Skis, for a ride to your final destination: Penarak fishing village. Discover Malay village life and culture as you follow your guide to a fisherman’s house that’s only accessible from the water, where you’re welcomed with a provided lunch including fried rice, fruit and tea.

Enjoy a spectacular hilltop view over the turquoise waters of the Andaman Sea as you prepare for the greatest riding challenge of the day —a brisk ride to Monkey Beach for a brief dip in ocean waters before racing back to Cenang Beach, where your tour ends.

inclusion.item: Rental fees (Jet ski, life jacket and wet shoes).
All taxes, fees and handling charges.

exclusion.item: Water (please bring your own drinking water).

Packages.PackageDesc: Langkawi Cable Car Ride and Oriental Village Morning Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy a bird’s-eye-view of Mount Mat Chinchang and Langkawi with a cable car ride to the mountain’s peak. Journey into an Oriental Village and enjoy shopping before wandering around a stunning nearby lake and taking in mountain scenery.

highlights.highlightItem: Take a cable car ride to the top of Mount Mat Chinchang for a birds eye view of Langkawi.
Shop at the Oriental Village.
Amazing photo opportunities.
English-speaking guide.
Hotel pickup and drop off.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This Langkawi cable car ride and oriental village morning tour kicks off with pick up from your hotel. Travel to Mount Mat Chinchang and ascend its peak by cable car. Take in the stunning views of Langkawi and the hillsides down below as you listen to your guide explain how this suspension system is the longest in the world between two stations. Marvel at the fact it was constructed without a single road being laid through the jungle!

From the mountain’s peak, head to the Oriental Village where you’ll enjoy time to wander the shops, engage with locals and sample traditional cuisines for lunch (own expense). At the end of your tour return to your hotel with a camera full of picutres and a mind filled with memories.

PackageDetails.overview: Your vacation doesn’t have to end until you get home – pre-book a 3-, 6- or 12-hour pass for the Plaza Premium Airport Lounge at Langkawi International Airport and await your flight in style. Make the most of free Wi-Fi, hot showers, a hot and cold food buffet, and complimentary non-alcoholic drinks, then sit back in the comfortable lounge before your departure flight.

highlights.highlightItem: Entrance to the Plaza Premium Lounge at Langkawi International Airport.
Rest in a comfortable environment before your departing flight!
Choose a 3-, 6- or 12-hour pass.
Enjoy hot food, beverages, wireless connection and a quiet place to relax (all included).

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Sit back and unwind at the Plaza Premium Airport Lounge at Langkawi International Airport before catching your flight. Depending on the time you need, choose one of three pass options: three hours, six hours or 12 hours at the lounge.

Packages.PackageDesc: Langkawi Mangrove Forest and Eagle Watching Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Malaysia is a nation with diverse ecosystems, rugged beauty and incredible natural landscapes. Experience them all on this Langkawi Mangrove Forest and Eagle Watch Tour in Tanjung Rha. Float through mangrove forests by boat as you learn about the ecosystem that surrounds you. Navigate waterways and limestone crags as you take in the flora and fauna that make this destination unique. Sample local cuisine with lunch at a fish farm restaurant and hike into a bat cave where you’ll see these tiny flying mammals and watch various species of eagles being fed.

highlights.highlightItem: Mangrove forest tour with eagle watching in Langkawi.
Travel by boat and discover the abundant forms of wildlife hidden in Langkawi's mangrove forest in Tanjung Rhu.
Dine on a delicious lunch of freshly caught seafood from a local fish farm restaurant.
Enjoy the unique experience of watching white-headed eagles being fed!
Hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Your friendly and professional driver will collect you from your Kuala Lumpur hotel and transport you to Tanjung Rhu fishing village to kick off your Lankawi Mangrove Forest and Eagle Watching Tour. You’ll journey into the hidden landscapes and natural beauty of this vast nation and navigate limestone caves, waterways and canyons, where wildlife gather in trees and along the riverbanks.

Enjoy a traditional meal in this colorful fishing village and sample seafood fresh from the farm. With full bellies, head out to watch as various species of eagles are fed. The final stop of this memorable journey is a darkened bat cave, where you’ll find these flying mammals perched and taking flight.
Make your way back to your hotel after a short boat cruise back to Tanjung Rhu and enjoy the comfort and ease of round-trip transportation.

AdditionalInfo.info: Confirmation of this tour will be received within 48 hours of booking, subject to availability.

Packages.PackageDesc: Langkawi Round Island Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Get an insight into local life on Langkawi Island with this 3-hour tour, including hotel pick-up. Soak up a scenic panorama of lush rice paddies, rubber plantations and rural villages, and discover the island’s rich craft-making heritage at the Atma Alam Batik Art Gallery. After visiting landmarks like Makam Mahsuri (Mahsuri's tomb) and Eagle Square (Dataran Lang), stop at Kuah Town for some duty-free souvenir shopping.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day tour of Langkawi Island.
Hear about the legend of the beautiful villager Mahsuri as you explore Makam Mahsuri.
Take postcard-ready photos at the scenic site of Eagle Square.
Learn about the intricate nature of handmade batik art at the Atma Alam Batik Art Gallery.
Friendly and knowledgeable guide and hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: You will first be picked up from your hotel in Langkawi, after which, you will be taken to visit one of the most legendary landmarks in the island - the Makam Mahsuri (Mahsuri's tomb). Here, learn about how the interesting folklore of the young village beauty, Mahsuri.

Afterward, see the beautiful rural countryside of the island as you drive past quaint Malay villages, sprawling rice paddy fields with frolicking water buffaloes, and verant rubber plantations. Stop by the Atma Alam Batik Art Village, where the unique Malaysian art of handmade batik making was birthed. With your guide, explore the showrooms and art galleries to learn about this interesting aspect of the country's art and culture.

Finally, visit the Eagle Square (Dataran Lang), one of the city's most-recognized landmarks. Admire this nearly 40-feet tall (12 meters) statue of an eagle prepared to take flight and its postcard-worthy surroundings of miniature fountains, terraces and bridges.
Before being dropped off at your hotel at the end of the tour, make a stop at the duty-free Kuah Town for some souvenir shopping.

Packages.PackageDesc: Langkawi Sailing and Island Hopping Adventure

PackageDetails.overview: Take to the sea on this Langkawi Sailing and Island Hoping Adventure that highlights the best of the coast of Kuala Perlis. Explore the outlying islands as you make your way through calm waters aboard a comfortable sailboat. Relax on beaches and enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch cooked on board your vessel, complete with plenty of free drinks! This full-day excursion is the ideal way to experience the beauty of the tropical islands.

highlights.highlightItem: Full day Langkawi cruise and adventure of a surrounding island, Pulau Dayang Bunting or Pulau Singa.
Barbecue lunch and free flow of drinks from the complimentary bar.
Walk along the beach and explore the natural wildlife.
Hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Some 104 islands lay off the coast of Pulau Langkawi. This Langkawi sailing and island hopping adventure will take you to the white sandy beaches of Pulau Dayang Bunting or Pulau Singa, where you’ll experience tropical vibes, colorful wildlife and ultimate relaxation.

You’ll set sail on a luxury yacht from Langkawi and enjoy a two-hour ride over placid waters to a nearby island. While aboard the ship you’ll have time to take in the sights, including breathtaking archipelagos, crystal blue waters and incredible birds and fish. You’ll enjoy a flavorful barbecue lunch on the ship, complete with unlimited beer, cocktails, wine and soft drinks as you relax and unwind against the scenic backdrop of this stunning natural landscape.

You’ll have time to wander the beaches or explore the mangrove forests upon arrival at one of Langkawi’s islands. You might even spot monkeys, lizards or eagles. You can hike through the thick jungles or just soak up some sun before returning by luxury yacht to Pulau Langkawi.
