Packages.PackageDesc: Langkawi Sunset Luxury Yacht Cruise with Cocktails or BBQ Dinner

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy a relaxing evening on the open waters with this 2.5-hour sunset luxury yacht cruise along the Andaman Sea. Take in stunning natural views as you experience the beauty of a golden Malaysian sunset while sipping cocktails or feasting on a gourmet BBQ dinner. Choose from a meal or drinks and enjoy round-trip hotel transpiration as part of this popular tour.

highlights.highlightItem: Enjoy a relaxing 2.5-hour cruise on board a luxury yacht, set sail into the sunset off Langkawi Island.
Option to select cocktails OR a gourmet BBQ Dinner with drinks.
Hotel pickup and drop off.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: A friendly and professional driver will collect you from your Langkawi hotel and transport you in air-conditioned comfort to a luxury yacht as part of this sunset cruise with cocktails or BBQ dinner. Enjoy 2.5-hours on the open waters, where you’ll witness an incredible golden sunset and feast on stunning natural views. Choose to enjoy endless cocktails or a gourmet BBQ as part of this memorable evening, which includes round-trip hotel transport.

Packages.PackageDesc: Langkawi Underwater World and Crocodile Farm Tour

PackageDetails.overview: Get up close to Malaysia’s diverse native wildlife on this 3-hour Langkawi Underwater World and crocodile farm tour. Visit the Langkawi Crocodile Farm, home to over 1,000 crocodiles of all sizes. See the crocodiles’ breeding and habitat ponds, and watch them feeding as your guide explains their life-cycles. Marvel at freshwater and saltwater fish from across the world at Underwater World Langkawi, Malaysia’s largest aquarium. Head through the underwater tunnel as the colorful knife fish, catfish and stingrays swim overhead, and gain insight into Malaysia’s complex ecosystems.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour tour to Langkawi Crocodile Farm and Underwater World.
Visit two of Langkawi’s top kid-friendly attractions in one easy tour.
Witness feeding time at the Crocodile Farm.
See crocs of all sizes, and watch how they behave in their pond environments.
Admire marine life from the tropics to the sub-Antarctic at Underwater World.
Check out penguins, fur seals, catfish, stingrays, flamingos and more.
Choose either a morning or afternoon tour to suit your schedule.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: After hotel pickup, head to the Langkawi Crocodile Farm, a 20-acre (8-hectare) site that’s home to more than 1,000 crocodiles, one of the largest groupings of crocodiles in one place in the world.

Explore the various ponds — breeding pond, jumping pond, periodical pond and show pond — that imitate the crocodiles’ natural habitats, and watch them feed in a controlled environment. Marvel at crocs of all sizes, from babies to record-breakers.

Next, visit your second wildlife attraction of the day, Underwater World Langkawi. This aquarium — the largest in Malaysia — is home to freshwater and saltwater fish from around the planet. Walk through the 50-foot-long (15-meter) underwater tunnel to see colorful fish all around you, and check out the koi pond and seashell display.

As you explore the aquarium’s three ecosystems — tropical rainforest, temperate climate and sub-Antarctic — you’ll see a myriad of marine life, including knifefish, pacu, tropical birds, flamingos, fur seals, penguins, catfish and stingrays.
When you leave Underwater World, your tour ends with hotel drop-off.

inclusion.item: Hotel pickup and drop-off (select hotels only).

Packages.PackageDesc: Langkawi Archipelago Jet Ski Tour Including Dayang Bunting Island

PackageDetails.overview: Discover the delights of the Langkawi Archipelago on this 4-hour jet-ski tour. Hop onto your jet-ski and head onto the Andaman Sea with your guide. Enjoy breath-taking views over the crystal-blue seas and white sands of the Langkawi archipelago. Visit Dayang Bunting Island, widely considered the jewel in the archipelago’s crown. Admire forested hills and rocky outcrops, and hear of traditional island legends. Zoom among rocky outcrops and hidden bays on route to the Fjords, and enjoy personal attention from your guide on this small-group tour, limited to eight people.

highlights.highlightItem: Half-day Jet Ski tour of Langkawi archipelago.
Ride solo or with a passenger on a convoy across turquoise waters to secret coves.
Explore eight rocky islets with an experienced guide, including Dayang Bunting Island.
Take a dip in Dayang Bunting Lake, the largest freshwater lake in Malaysia.
Marvel at limestone structures and verdant jungle surrounding the Fjords.
Choose a morning or afternoon departure, depending on option selected.
Small-group tour limited to eight passengers ensures personalized attention.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: Choose a morning or afternoon departure time, and meet your small group at a designated spot on Cenang Beach. After a safety briefing and instruction on how to operate your Jet Ski, hop aboard and follow an experienced guide who leads your convoy over the tranquil waters of the Andaman Sea to eight islands in the Langkawi archipelago. You can ride solo or double up with a partner, depending on the option you select upon booking.

After a short stop at Tepur Island for a check-in and some advice from your guide on riding in formation, continue to the region’s second largest island and its star attraction: Dayang Bunting Island. Arrive at the lookout point for a glimpse of the pregnant maiden’s silhouette for which the island was named, formed by the outline of hills and rocky outcrops on one side of Dayang Bunting Lake — the largest freshwater lake in Malaysia.

Hear about the legend of a lovely fairy princess who became pregnant after drinking the water, and then follow your guide on a 5-minute jungle trek to the lake, which is separated from the sea by a thin ridge of limestone. Enjoy free time to swim, or rent a solar boat or paddle boat. For those looking to unwind, just dip your feet in the water on a dock and enjoy the lush surroundings.

When it's time, get back on your Jet Ski and speed over to the Fjords, a cluster of jungle-clad islands about one nautical mile (2 km) away. Skim across the crystal-clear waters between rocky islets and secret coves to arrive at another dip-worthy spot where you'll be surrounded by 360-degree views of jungle terrain.

Catch the breathtaking sight of eagles soaring overhead while your guide describes the flora and fauna. A mushroom-shaped island, limestone structures, stalactites, mangroves, and other vegetation unique to Langkawi are among the geological and biological wonders you'll learn more about.
Before riding back to the starting point, stop at an uncharted island for a short swim and snorkeling session (depending on water conditions) to top off your half-day Jet Ski adventure.

Packages.PackageDesc: Mangrove Kayaking Tour from Langkawi

PackageDetails.overview: Join us on adventure through the twist and turns of the mangrove river maze and enjoy a refreshing dip in a jungle stream. This tour includes kayaking along mangrove rivers and lunch at a family house.

highlights.highlightItem: See native wildlife in their natural environment.
Informative, friendly and professional guide.
Lunch included.
Free hotel pickup and drop-off included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: South East Asia is home to the highest diversity of mangroves species in the world and the mangroves around Langkawi are no different. Naturalist guide explains the mangrove ecology and its benefits to man and wildlife.

We often see spectacular kingfishers, sea eagles, kites, plovers, herons, fiddler crabs and mud skippers. We pass a local fishing station where local fishermen put to sea or return after a day out. Depending on the tidal conditions we begin at the coast and head upriver or begin upriver and head for the coast so we kayak with the flow of tidal currents.

The kayak journey lasts about two and a half hours, followed by a short drive and easy 500 meter hike to a secluded rainforest trail for a swim in a cool jungle stream. We end the day with delicious lunch before returning to the hotel.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Langkawi Island Tour

PackageDetails.overview: On this 3-hour private tour of Pulau Langkawi (Langkawi Island), you’ll get acquainted with the cultural history and heritage of its inhabitants. Visit the Kampung houses of Bon Ton and Mahsuri’s Tomb (Makam Mahsuri), then stroll the volcanic Black Sand Beach (Pantai Pasir Hitam) with commentary by your own personal guide. Admire Malaysian batik motifs on display and try your hand at making your own.

highlights.highlightItem: 3-hour private tour of Pulau Langkawi.
See Mahsuri’s Tomb and Bon Ton Kampung homes.
Wander Black Sand Beach and learn the art of batik.
Private guide offers a more personalized experience.
Hotel pickup and drop-off by private vehicle included.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: On this tour you will see traditional Malay housing on a visit to the Bon Ton Kampung Houses. We then move on to Mahsuri’s Tomb, Mahsuri is known to have been a very vengeful woman who cursed Langkawi for seven generations after she was wrongfully convicted and sentenced to death for adultery.

You will also check out whether the remains from the great battle between Garuda and Jentayu still exist (as some still believe), at Pantai Pasir Hitam Langkawi (Black Sand Beach in English). The peaceful Langkawi beach is stained with black sand - you'll find that not the whole beach is black but it's more like a mixture of black sand and normal sand. Unlike other black-sand beaches, this sand isn't volcanic in nature - iron oxide is believed to be the cause of this phenomenon.

Some people also believe that the black sand beach is caused by the burnt soil from the rice fields that were burnt during the Siamese war. The burnt soil flowed to the sea got washed up on to this beach creating the black sand beach.

Just down the road, see the intricate and beautiful designs of Malaysian batik on display at a craft cultural centre. Try your hand at batik making, a dying process that uses wax to produce various designs and motifs. Be sure to get a souvenir or two if anything fancy catches your eye! Lastly, marvel as you stand before the towering statue of a reddish brown eagle, its wings outstretched in flight at Eagle Square in the centre of town.

Packages.PackageDesc: Private Tour: Island Hopping in Langkawi Including Cable Car

PackageDetails.overview: Enjoy an exhilarating cable car ride to the summit of the famous Mount Mat Cincang! Enjoy marvellous views of the Andaman Sea and the smaller islands of Langkawi. Then hop to several famous islands of Langkawi including the legendary Tasik Dayang Bunting (Pregnant Maiden Lake), go eagle watching at a nearby island and pay a visit to Pulau Beras Basah (Wet Rice Island).

highlights.highlightItem: Enjoy fantastic aerial views.
Travel by boat and see the sights from the water.
Family friendly.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This tour will bring you to enjoy the exhilarating 920m (3018 feet) long cable car ride to the summit of the famous Mount Mat Cincang. Visitors can enjoy marvellous views of the Andaman Sea and the smaller islands of Langkawi. On clear days, one can also see the edge of Thailand in the North and Indonesia towards the South-West. Enjoy the cool air and the highland’s view before proceeding down to the Oriental Village.

The Oriental Village is one of the unique shopping, cultural and culinary destinations. Bold displays of culture, fashion and fascinating handicraft demonstrations by skilled craftsmen add to the visitor’s enjoyment here. With over 470 brands and 17,000 products, the village offers shopping buffs a bewildering range of international designer labels and local products. Take some time to shop at various outlets and enjoy your choice of cuisine for lunch (at your own expenses).

After lunch, you’ll be taking a trip by long boat, visit to several famous islands such as the legendary Tasik Dayang Bunting (Pregnant Maiden Lake). Tasik Dayang Bunting is Langkawi's largest lake and resembles the shape of a pregnant lady lying on her back. Some people believe the waters of the lake possess mystical powers as a local princess has blessed the waters. Because of the blessings, it is believed that any woman who is unable to conceive may have a child after drinking the water from the lake.

After passing by the first island, you will witness wild eagles at close range. The long boat will drift slowly for you to see these birds of prey soaring overhead. There are a few different types of birds of prey, including the White-bellied Sea Eagle and the Brahminy Kite. The last stop will be at a white sandy beach for you to relax and soak up the sun or splash around in the turquoise-blue waters off Pulau Beras Basah. This is a perfect location to enjoy a relaxing picnic in the shade of the casuarinas trees lining the beach. After this you will return to the main Island before being taken back to your hotel safely.

inclusion.item: Entrance fees (Langkawi Cable Car - Sky Cab).

PackageDetails.overview: This 3 hour tour starts with a visit to Budaya Craft & Cultural Complex and then goes to the Galeria Perdana. Firstly the Budaya Craft and Cultural Complex has a wide range of Malaysian handicrafts locally hand made on display and for sale which makes excellent souvenirs or gifts. Visitors as well get to see batik artists at work and witness how they painstakingly transform their designs. The Galeria Perdana has a much an international flavour holding over 2500 items which have been given to Malaysia from countries around the globe.

highlights.highlightItem: Private tour of Langkawi crafts and culture.

Admire Islamic art, inlaid gold and more at Galeria Perdana Private guide provides a more personalized experience.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: After enjoying the arts and crafts center we head to Galeria Perdana. The Galeria Perdana showcases a magnificent collection of over 2,500 pieces of handmade crafts, Islamic art, gold and silverware inlaid with precious stones, and even cars from all over the world, received by Malaysia’s former Prime Minister, Dr. Mahathir Mohamed, during his tenure in office. There are also innumerable gifts and souvenirs given by other world leaders as well as Malaysian admirers and the Galeria Perdana really showcases these priceless, unique and diverse items very well.

Descriptions.DescriptionItem: This Pulau Payar Marine Park Snorkelling Tour from Langkawi allows you to set sail on a classic catamaran through the waters south of Langkawi Island into West Malaysia’s only marine park. You’ll enjoy stunning views or coastal inlets, placid waters and clear horizons as you make your way to Pulau Payar. Enjoy snorkelling or SCUBA diving with colourful tropical fish and make your way to an underwater observatory for a closer look at wonders from the deep. This tour includes a buffet lunch served on deck and round-trip hotel transport.
